detailedDescription:
This truly wonderful two bedroom flat occupies the top floor of this newly developed property sympathetically and beautifully designed to be in keeping with the adjoining property. As to be expected, the property has been finished to the highest of standards with underfloor heating and bespoke, quality fixtures and fittings throughout. Specific attention to detail by the developers sees an abundance of natural light through all of the rooms and plenty of character incorporating the high ceilings and architectural flow of the roofing. Two double bedrooms and a bathroom provide excellent accommodation whilst the 23 ft kitchen/family room with doors leading directly onto a fabulous decked terrace, provides generous living and entertaining space. Located just off the corner of Arterberry Road this incredibly convenient location provides ease of access to both Raynes Park High St and Wimbledon Town Centre whilst the slopes leading to Wimbledon Ridgway, Common and Village are in the immediate area.

The ground floor flat is the only property within the development to enjoy parking, which also provides a charging point and there is also the benefit of a bike store for all residents. title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in a prime and secluded location by Wimbledon Common, a modern chalet bungalow with adjoining self-contained annexe offering an opportunity to modernise, extend or re-develop subject to the necessary planning consents and including seven garages and two workshops - all standing on a plot of just over 0.25 acre (1,024 sq m)

18 West Place comprises a plot of just over 0.25 acre (1,024 sq.m.) and the main house comprises a chalet bungalow built in 1964 on the site of three cottages with accommodation mainly on ground floor level but with two double bedrooms and a second bathroom on the first floor. A self-contained single storey extension was built in 1994 providing two further large rooms but without internal access from the main house. The house benefits from a secluded south facing garden with pedestrian access to both from West Place. (The annexe has a vehicular right of way from Camp View).

The accommodation of both properties is in somewhat dated condition and there is an opportunity for a purchaser to integrate, modernise and possibly extend the house and annexe or to demolish and build a new residence subject to the necessary planning consents being obtained.

Included in the Freehold interest are seven garages – two of which have access via a right of way from Camp View and the other five garages together with the two workshops have vehicular access via a right of way from West Place. (The current owners of 26a West Place have a licence to use Garage No 5 for as long as they own and live at No 26a. In addition the owner of 9 North View has a right of way over the land via the access from Camp View to his own garage which is located at the end of the garden of 9 North View). There is also a "pedestrian only" right of way to and from the rear of 25 West Place over the land in front of Garages 4,5 & 6 and along the private roadway between 26 and 26a West Place. No 25 has no access for vehicles or the parking thereof.
Purchasers should satisfy themselves as to the restrictions pertaining to the various rights of way through the vendor's solicitor

The property enjoys an almost rural location on the edge of Wimbledon Common yet is situated just 0.5 mile walk from Wimbledon Village High Street with its excellent selection of shops and restaurants and a regular bus service to Wimbledon Town from which there are frequent train services to Central London as well as theatres and cinemas.

Summary
auction sale 27 July 2021 - This property will be sold at auction to the best bid (subject to reserve). Auctions are an exciting and the most certain way you can buy. We hold sales every month. If you are buying for your occupation, development or investment we have lots for you to see.

Description
Freehold garage unit with mezzanine level
Full vacant possession

Location:
The garage unit is situated on the South side of Kingston Road, located
to the rear of no.s 134-136, close to its junction with Gladstone Road. Public transport links include Merton Park Tram Stop and South Wimbledon (Northern Line) underground station together with a network of local bus services serving the surrounding area.

Description:
The building comprises a garage/workshop unit of approx. 50sqm with mezzanine level.

Note:
The property may offer the opportunity for development subject to all necessary consents. Prospective purchasers are deemed to have relied upon their own enquiries in this respect.

To view:
Strictly by arrangements with the auctioneers.

Important Notice:
For each Lot, a contract documentation fee of £1,150 (inclusive of VAT) is payable to Barnard Marcus Auctions by the buyer. The seller may charge additional fees payable upon completion. If applicable, such fees are detailed within the Special Conditions of Sale. Buyers are deemed to bid in full knowledge of this.

The Guide Price quoted must not be relied upon by prospective purchasers as a valuation or assessment of value of the property. It is intended to provide purchasers with an indication of the region at which the reserve may be set at the time of going to press. The guide price may be subject to variation and interested parties are advised to make regular checks for variations and should be aware that the reserve price may be either below or above the quoted guide price.

Prospective purchasers should also be aware that the eventual sale price may be above or below the guide level dependent upon competition, and should therefore not presume the guide to be indicative of the final expected sale price or the price the property is available at.

When setting the guide price, the auctioneers have given consideration to the seller’s instructions in respect of their indicated reserve price at the time of instruction. The reserve price, (the level below which the property will not be sold), remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. The guide price therefore, is intended to indicate the region at which the reserve price is intended to be set. The seller will confirm their final reserve price close to the auction date and if appropriate the auctioneers may adjust the guide price to reflect this.
Whilst Barnard Marcus make every effort to ensure the safety and security of viewers at properties, we have not carried out a detailed Health & Safety inspection of properties in our auctions and cannot therefore guarantee the safety and security of viewers.
Prospective purchasers and bidders attend properties entirely at their own risk. Particular care should be taken when accessing cellars, attics, exterior grounds and outbuildings and boundaries. All non-conducted inspections of vacant sites should be made in daylight hours only and entry into such sites is entirely at the viewers risk.

A Vacant First & Second Floor Two Bedroom Split Level Flat. Offered with Planning Permission for the Erection of a New Roof Extension and to Extend the Existing Loft Area.

Tenure
Leasehold. The property will be held on a new 125 year lease.

Location
The property is situated on a residential road close to local shops and amenities. The open spaces of South Park Gardens are within easy reach. Transport links are provided by South Wimbledon underground station which is just a short walk away.

Description
The property comprises a well presented two bedroom first and second floor split level flat situated within a semi-detached building arranged over ground, first and second floors.

Accommodation
First Floor
Reception Room
Kitchen
Bathroom

Second Floor
Two Bedrooms

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A second floor one bedroom retirement apartment Kathleen Godfree Court was constructed by McCarthy & Stone (Developments) Ltd and comprises 59 properties arranged over 3 floors each served by lift. The Development Manager can be contacted from various points within each property in the case of an emergency. For periods when the Development Manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency Appello call system. Each property comprises an entrance hall, lounge, kitchen, one or two bedrooms and bathroom. It is a condition of purchase that single residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years.
Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property.

Living Room

Kitchen

Tiled and fitted with stainless steel sink unit with a single drainer. Wall and floor cupboards. Space for Fridge/freezer. Power points. Strip light. Electric cooker.

Bedroom

Built in mirrored wardrobe with folding mirror doors, hanging rail and shelf above. Light switch. Electric night storage heater. Power points, emergency pull cord, wall lights.

Bathroom

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming period house located in this quiet and highly regarded residential road near the Common and the Village and a wonderful variety of shops and eateries at the top of the road on Ridgway

This charming house is approached via its pretty front garden, opening to the entrance hall, off which is the well-proportioned double reception room with wooden flooring, feature fireplace and doors to the conservatory. There is a good-sized open plan kitchen/dining room which is open with the conservatory from where double doors lead out into the rear garden. The kitchen is fitted with a range of wall and base units with integrated appliances.

Upstairs over two floors there are four bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms. There are fitted wardrobes in the two larger bedrooms and generous loft storage space accessible from the second floor. Outside, there is a mature paved rear garden with a studio which could be used as a home office or gym. There is side access from the front of the property to the rear. The house is located in a picturesque residential street off the Ridgway, within a few minutes’ walk of some very useful local shops and eateries including one of Wimbledon’s most highly regarded restaurants. The Common and the Village High Street are also within a short walk

detailedDescription:
A spacious five bedroom family house with a large garden and off street parking in the heart of Wimbledon.

Location

Herbert Road is a central Wimbledon Town street. The property is just 300m from Wimbledon mainline train and District line underground station which provides a fast and regular link to London (Wimbledon to Waterloo 17 mins).

Wimbledon offers a good selection of supermarkets, gyms, cafes, restaurants and a cinema. Locally are a number of highly sought after schools including St Marys Roman Catholic School and Dundonald Primary School.

Source of times .
Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

A superb semi-detached family four/five bedroom house in the centre of Wimbledon Town and just 300m from Wimbledon train station. There is potential to extend subject to the usual consents.

On the ground floor is a spacious reception room which opens out onto the large garden and a dining room which flows through into the kitchen. There is a guest W/C in the hallway.

The first floor has four bedrooms (one of which is currently used as a study) and a family bathroom. The top floor has a bedroom and en suite bathroom plus eaves storage space.

The garden is wonderful being almost 100ft in length featuring a patio area and lawn. There is a side access leading from the front driveway to the rear garden.

There is off-street parking to the front.

Chain free.

Square Footage: 1485 sq ft

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly outstanding 5 bedroom family home that has been meticulously extended and updated by the owners to create a stunning family home. The light spacious accommodation is arranged over three and a half floors and comprises on the ground floor: Entrance hall; an exceptional double reception room which opens onto a stunning kitchen/family room with sliding glass doors to the terrace and garden, underfloor heating, a spiral wine cellar and a full range of quality appliances. A well-fitted study, utility room and a cloakroom complete this floor. On the lower ground floor is a home cinema.

On the first floor, there are 4 bedrooms (one with an en-suite shower room and dressing room) and a family bathroom. On the second floor is the master bedroom complete with a range of wardrobes and an en-suite bath and shower room.

To the front of the house is a driveway with space for several cars to park and to the rear is the westerly facing garden which has been well laid out and planted.

The house is part of the Drax Estate and is well located for access to the prestigious Wimbledon Village and benefits from the nearby Coombe Hill and Royal Wimbledon Golf Clubs. The area is renowned for its excellent schools, including The Rowans School and King's College School and is also handily placed for shopping centres in Wimbledon and Kingston and conveniently situated for Richmond Park and Wimbledon Common. There are many local amenities
and local shops only a 5-minute walk away. Transport links include the A3 with routes into Central London
or to the M25 with access to both Gatwick and Heathrow airports and fast rail links to central London from the nearby Raynes Park train station.
title: 5 bed detached house for sale

address: Eagle House, High Street Wimbledon, London SW19
detailedDescription:
A collection of luxury apartments within an outstanding Grade II* listed Jacobean manor house ideally located on the High Street behind a gated forecourt with off street parking.

Location

Eagle house is located in the heart of Wimbledon Village just off the High Street. The village has a distinctive character, happily blending a convivial community spirit with the sophistication of the best selection of boutiques and restaurants to be found in the area.

Many families flock to The Village for the excellent range of schools in the neighbourhood, including King's College School and Wimbledon High School.

Wimbledon Town Centre, a short distance away, caters for a wide variety of needs, including a shopping centre, two department stores, two theatres and a cinema.

Wimbledon Station provides fast over ground and underground connections to central London and to the south of England.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

This spectacular property built in the early 17th century has been painstakingly restored and converted into eight large exclusive apartments by Octagon Homes. The location is unrivalled being in the heart of Wimbledon village and moments from Wimbledon Common.

Set behind a secure gated entrance, all the apartments include two private parking spaces and access to the beautifully landscaped communal gardens to the rear.

Three Eagle House is a wonderful two double bedroom apartment arranged across the lower ground finished to an exacting standard featuring the latest technology. The apartment also has the benefit of a private walled patio garden.

The property opens into a deep hallway creating a wonderful sense of space. A superb kitchen/dining/living room to the rear offers a wonderful multi purpose living space and benefits from good natural light from four doors opening to the gardens. The stunning bespoke kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with stone work surfaces, fully integrated appliances and a large central island.

The principal suite has a dressing room and generous en suite bathroom with twin basins, a bath tub and separate rain shower. A guest suite features fitted wardrobes and a stylish en suite shower room. There is also a guest cloakroom and a fully fitted utility room.

Square Footage: 1655 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A substantial and most attractive, Victorian house, set in an elevated position in a prime location, walking distance from the Mainline/District line station and close to Bishop Gilpin School. The property has been extremely well maintained and has a very warm cosy feel, despite the high ceilings and well proportioned rooms. A particular feature of the house is the impressive master bedroom suite which has a lovely aspect and is reminiscent of a luxury hotel, with its spacious en-suite bathroom and ample wardrobe space. There are many other charming period features, including a stunning wide entrance hall with a tessellated floor, feature fireplaces and ornate coving and ceiling mouldings. The kitchen/breakfast room is well fitted with a range of appliances and has a vaulted ceiling that lets in lots of light. Off the kitchen there is a feature patio area which looks over the mainly lawned garden, that attracts the afternoon sun and to the front of the house, there is a hedged and walled garden offering privacy.

detailedDescription:
***Vendor's comments:***

“Having lived at Sunnymead Avenue for over 40 years, it’s time to downsize. It has been a fabulous, spacious family home to raise our three children and later entertain our grandchildren. All three children have grown up happy attending the local schools - you are spoilt for choice!

The location is perfect, it is so easy to get around with a great choice of bus, train and tram routes to reach many amenities, shopping centres etc. You could be in Central London in no time at all!

The house has been recently decorated with a new bathroom suite, double glazed windows and a new Corgi boiler. I lovingly tend to the garden which is blooming with roses and you will also find a very large double garage at the end of it!

It will be sad to leave the neighbourhood as the neighbours have been so friendly and helpful throughout the years."

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
*** vendors comments *** "i've lived on London Road for over 20 years with this property being our family home. Myself and my two sisters grew up here along with our parents.

The house was such a lovely place to grow up. Living in London with all the hustle and bustle, i've found once you entered the gates to our small community, everything changes. It's like you've been taken away to somewhere else. The location is so private and secluded with the river running around the house. Every window gives you gorgeous view of the river and the sound from the river is so relaxing.

The house is a grade two listed building making it very unique, along with it's layout which is not your standard at all. When we first viewed the house it was the garden which sold the place to us and its always been such a fantastic place to spend our summers. You have to really see it in person to understand its true beauty.

Our immediate family have all grown up and my siblings and I have also started our own families. The house is just too big for us now and it'll be nice for another family to enjoy this great home as we have."

detailedDescription:
This delightful semi-detached period house has recently undergone a full redecoration and comes to the market chain free. With spacious well-proportioned rooms, arranged over three floors, the house offers well-balanced accommodation and fantastic reception space across the ground floor. There are two separate reception rooms as well as a bright and spacious open-plan kitchen/dining room. The bedrooms are arranged over the first and second floors, with substantial built in wardrobes and eaves storage. Also, the second and third floor each have a bathroom.

Outside
There is a wonderful South-West facing garden to the rear. This is landscaped to include a useful patio area, directly accessed from the kitchen/dining room, which leads to a lawn with lots of space and a raised area at the end, ideal for a further seating area or space for home-office or shed.

Situation
Gladstone Road is a residential street offering excellent access to Wimbledon Town with its extensive shopping, recreational facilities plus mainline and District line station. Nearby Wimbledon Village provides a good range of exclusive boutiques, bars and restaurants. The immediate area is also known for excellent schools.

detailedDescription:
No Onward Chain & Share of Freehold. Brand new two double bedroom architect designed self contained apartment 0.1 miles away from Colliers Wood tube station (Zone 3) with direct access to the City in 20+ minutes.

This Brilliantly Located Apartment has;
* Your Own Secure Front Entrance, with remote video access control - No shared access.

No Onward Chain with Shared Freehold with Ground Floor Apartment, also to be sold.

Location

The property is located 0.1 miles from Colliers Wood tube station (Northern Line) and 0.7 miles to Haydons Road train station which has links to London Blackfriars, London Bridge and Wimbledon.

To Travel from Colliers Wood by Tube is;
2 minutes to Tooting Broadway.
4 minutes to Morden.
6 minutes to Balham (British Rail Main Line).
10 minutes to Clapham Common.
14 minutes to Stockwell.
20 minutes to Elephant and Castle.
24 minutes to London Bridge ( British Rail Main Line).

For primary schools, Singlegate Primary School is 0.1 miles away and All Saints' CofE Primary School is within 0.2 miles.
For secondary schools, Harris Academy Wimbledon is 0.5 miles away.

The property is within walking distance of shops, restaurants and local amenities.

address: Hounsfield Lodge, 5 Chambers Park Hill, Wimbledon, London SW20
detailedDescription:
A superb two bedroom apartment located on the second floor of this prestigious development adjacent to 19 acres of parkland and within easy reach of Wimbledon Village.

Location

Chambers Park Hill is just off Copse Hill. Wimbledon Village is within one mile with its delightful collection of shops and restaurants. The Common with its 1,200 acres of open space is around 800 metres and approaches the Village to create a sense of country living within London. Central London is around 8 miles distant and can be reached via the A3 or by rail from with Wimbledon mainline or Raynes Park (18 minutes) both accessed via the regular 200 bus route on Copse Hill.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
Source of times
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This wonderful apartment is located at the rear of the development close to the beautifully landscaped communal gardens.

The property is on the second floor of the building and has high ceilings with recessed lighting and attractive wooden flooring across the living space.

The apartment opens into an impressive entrance hall with double doors to a generous, elegant open plan reception/dining room/kitchen. Glass doors open to a private decked balcony overlooking the grounds and beyond. The contemporary kitchen is fully fitted with an extensive range of wall and base units, stone work surfaces, fully integrated appliances, complete with a breakfast bar.

The spectacular principal bedroom suite has a separate dressing area with well designed built-in wardrobes and a luxurious en suite bathroom with a separate glass shower. There is an additional double bedroom and a contemporary guest bathroom.

The apartment benefits from underfloor heating throughout and comfort cooling, plus an underground parking space. On site facilities include a well equipped gym, cinema,
conference facilities and a concierge service.

Square Footage: 950 sq ft

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom extended family house with large open plan kitchen-dining room, separate lounge, potential to create third bedroom and within 0.5 miles to St. Helier train station making this a great family home.

Entering the property there is a hallway with storage space below the stairs. To the front there is a separate lounge with bay window and feature fireplace to one side. The rear of the property has been extended to create a fantastic open plan kitchen-dining room area with patio doors leading out to the rear garden and two velux windows allowing plenty of natural light into the room. The kitchen has cupboard space to three sides, integrated gas hob, fan oven, microwave, dishwasher and space & plumbing for a fridge-freezer and washing machine.
There is also access from the dining area to a downstairs shower room with shower cubicle, w/c and hand basin.

To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms, the master bedroom overlooking the rear garden and the front bedroom has been split into two areas to create a third bedroom.
The family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Outside - To the front the property has a paved area with space for storage.
The private rear garden has a patio area leading onto artificial lawn and there is another patio area at the far end with a garden shed to one side.

Location

The property is located 0.5 miles to St. Helier train station with links into London Bridge, London Blackfriars and Wimbledon. Belgrave tram stop is within 0.9 miles and has links into both Wimbledon & Croydon.
There are great bus links into Morden & Sutton and Morden tube station (Northern Line) is 1.6 miles away.

For primary schools, Malmesbury Primary School is within 0.1 miles, St Teresa's Catholic Primary School is 0.2 miles away and both Tweeddale Primary School and Green Wrythe Primary School are 0.5 miles away.
For secondary schools, Harris Academy Morden is 0.4 miles away and Glenthorne High School is 0.8 miles away.

detailedDescription:
** guide price £400,000 - £425,000 **

Well proportioned four bedroom mid terrace house with private garden and off street parking, conveniently located just a short distance from Mitcham Eastfields station and amenities. The property provides bright and spacious, versatile accommodation including a generous first floor reception with access onto private balcony, large well equipped kitchen opening onto the garden, family bathroom and guest WC. A former garage has been converted to create a useful additional bedroom with en-suite facilities and personal door from the front of the property. Features include gas central heating, double glazing and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with access to useful guest WC, leading into the light and airy kitchen/diner, with ample space for table and chairs, and double doors opening out onto the garden. The kitchen area itself comprises a full range of matching wall, base and drawer units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. A well sized bedroom with en-suite shower is accessed via personal door to the front. Stairs rise up from the hallway to the first floor, and lead into a bright and spacious reception room with plenty of space for relaxing and entertaining, as well as sliding doors opening onto a front aspect balcony area. A generously sized bedroom with inbuilt wardrobes completes the first floor accommodation. To the second floor, there are a further two bedrooms, plus a family bathroom with three piece bath suite.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Mitcham, Streatham and Tooting, with railway services from Mitcham Eastfields just a short distance away. Numerous regular bus routes also offer good connections to the surrounding area. There are a variety of local shops and amenities nearby, with Mitcham and Colliers Wood providing a larger selection as well as restaurants and bars.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Auctioneer's Comments
Auctioneer’s Comments:
This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. We do not require the purchaser to exchange contracts immediately, granting 56 days for completion and with an aim to exchange contracts 28 days from the date the buyer’s solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down an non-refundable reservation fee of 4.2% to a minimum of £6000 including VAT which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.
The buyer will be required to sign an ‘Acknowledgement of Reservation’ form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Buyer Information Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.
Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed reserve price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid, both Starting Bid and reserve price can be subject to change. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Connells Property Auction powered by iam Sold. Reservation Fee is in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

detailedDescription:
Bright and spacious two bedroom maisonette on a tree-lined and really quiet street.

The property's immaculately turned out and both the kitchen and bathroom have been recently refurbished. You have a really strong layout with a light and spacious reception room - the size of which you'd struggle to find in a house!. Your most local stations are Wimbledon Station (District Line and Overground services into London Waterloo and Vauxhall.

There's just one flat below you but you each have a separate entrance. Open your own front door and take the stairs to the half-landing. From here the open plan reception room is 24 feet x 18 feet and includes a fully fitted kitchen and plenty of windows making the space feel light and airy. Adjacent is the master bedroom with an ensuite shower room.

On the upper floor as you turn left is the family bathroom and on the right is the second bedroom with an abundance of storage space.

Wimbledon Village provides a low-key easy-going lifestyle ideal with excellent transport connections to central London. There is an excellent blend of chic cafes, restaurants, bars, and independent shops nearby so you will never be short of options.

Wimbledon Park provides 67 acres of green space including a golf club, tennis courts, athletic track, and water sports.

You also have Wimbledon Central on your doorstep where National Railway service runs to major station terminals in Central London including Waterloo, St Pancreas, Clapham Junction and Vauxhall and the District Line (Zone 3) can take you to Central London in less than 20 minutes. Tram: From Wimbledon Station to local areas, numerous local buses, and a 24-hour taxi rank at Wimbledon Station for black London taxis.

We are delighted to offer for sale this spacious four bedroom period family with a superb westerly aspect garden, situated in the much sought after Lambton Conservation Area.

This attractive Edwardian family home has flexible accommodation arranged over three floors and has some fine original features.
On the ground floor is a spacious front reception room, kitchen/dining room, conservatory with double doors to the charming, partly walled south-westerly aspect rear garden. There is also a utility area and w.c.
On the first floor are three bedrooms and the family bathroom. On the top floor is another large double bedroom with en-suite shower.
There is off-street parking and a pretty garden at the front of the house.

The property is situated on a much sought-after residential road close to Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park and is well placed for access into Raynes Park with its mainline station with direct access to Waterloo. Raynes Park offers a selection of useful shops and businesses.

Wimbledon Common is also within easy reach. The area has an excellent choice of schools in both the state and private sectors.

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An outstanding 2 double bedroom 5th floor apartment with stunning views, not only directly into Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Club, but also right across London's skyline to the City clearly visible in the distance.

With 1,240 sq ft (115 sq m) of lateral space this apartment is perfect as it is and also offers the opportunity to redesign (subject to any required permissions) to suit. The panoramic views are simply amazing and at night time; outstanding. In our opinion, you really are unlikely to find better London views anywhere.

The substantial and extremely well positioned sitting room has double aspect windows offering an enormous amount of natural light. The original balcony has been enclosed in favour of the large communal gardens but this could be easily reinstated, again subject to any required permissions. The kitchen offers a good range of units whilst the bedrooms both have built in wardrobes and use of a bath/shower room each (one being ensuite).

There is parking in the underground garage for at least one car and visitors parking is available around the grounds. One of two lifts will take you from there to the apartment. A large and well-kept communal garden is available for all to use and there is a manned concierge office.

Location

This property's position is outstanding. Moments away from the world famous Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Club, this property sits in the heart of Wimbledon with leafy Wimbledon Village, with its boutique shops and superb restaurants one way and Wimbledon Town with its main stream shopping and London's transport network including the London Underground and Mainline Station. Horse riding, golf, long walks, country style pubs are all found nearby on Wimbledon Common and there is easy access to the coast and the rest of the UK including the international airports at Heathrow and Gatwick.

detailedDescription:
A delightful semi-detached period house with south facing garden and fantastic self-contained studio with scope to extend subject to planning permission, located in a quiet and sought after residential road close to local shops, restaurants, Wimbledon Common and the Village

This delightful period property is approached via its lovely front ‘cottage’ garden and covered entrance porch. The front door opens into the hall off which is the double length reception room with feature fireplace and French doors out to the garden. The kitchen is fitted with a range of units with integrated appliances and opens into the glazed dining/garden room, again with doors out to the sunny and secluded south facing garden, with a further door connecting to the rear studio where a mezzanine level provides a sleeping space if required, and has doors opening out onto a secluded patio garden. A shower room makes this space ideal for guests, or a housekeeper or for use as a home office. Upstairs, in the main house, there are two double bedrooms, one of which has fitted wardrobes and a smartly appointed shower room. There is scope to extend subject to planning permission.

The property is located in a highly regarded and sought after picturesque residential street off the Ridgway, and conveniently located within a few minutes’ walk of some very useful shops and eateries including a pharmacy, dry cleaners, convenience store, dentist and one of Wimbledon’s best restaurants. Wimbledon Common, the Village High Street and Wimbledon town centre are all within a very short distance. The Village offers a great selection of shops, boutiques, restaurants, cafes and bars and the town centre has more comprehensive shopping and transport connections with its District Line and Mainline stations to Central London and the West End.

detailedDescription:
A quintessential period cottage situated in one of the prettiest locations in Wimbledon Village. The property offers exceptionally spacious accommodation on the ground floor with a large studio which is linked to the main cottage. Open plan reception room, attractive kitchen with sunny garden room, two bedrooms plus a third mezzanine bedroom in the studio with a shower room. To the rear is a lovely 50ft garden with southerly aspect.

Denmark Road is an attractive residential street ideally situated for the centre of both Wimbledon Village and Town being within 800m of the High Street and railway station. Wimbledon Village is well known for its pretty boutiques, restaurants and gastro pubs as well as the wonderful open space of Wimbledon Common, which is less than 500m away. Wimbledon town centre offers excellent day to day shopping facilities with Elys department store and the extensive Centre Court shopping centre. Wimbledon rail station offers a fast and regular link to central London with overground trains taking 15-18 minutes and the District Line giving easy access to the West End.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Location, location, location.......This larger than average five bedroom, two bathroom, 1930's semi detached family home is located within this extremely popular residential road on the very cusp of London SW20, within close proximity to both South Merton train station and Morden underground station, with Morden town centre and its variety of amenities also being extremely convenient. In addition, the property boasts a wealth of recreational spaces nearby, including Mostyn Gardens, Cannon Hill Common and Morden Park all adding to the unique blend of convenience with peace and tranquillity. Having been beautifully cared for during the current vendors long and much-loved ownership, the bright and airy accommodation comprises lounge, dining room, kitchen/breakfast room, cloakroom and an integral garage to the ground floor, four bedrooms, bathroom and a shower room to the first floor and a converted loft providing a substantial main bedroom. Externally, the private front garden provides off street parking for 3 cars and access to the integral garage and the substantial private rear garden which is both substantial in size and extremely secluded providing a beautiful relaxing retreat aided by the mature planting.<br /><br />

title: 6 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A handsome mid Victorian family house offering well balanced living and entertaining space across three floors with a wonderful 111' rear garden, garage and planning permission to extend.

Location

Lingfield Road is one of Wimbledon’s most sought after streets located within 100m of the High Street and Wimbledon Common.

Wimbledon Village is renowned for its unique feel with a sense of having one foot in the country whilst being only 17 mins by rail to the City. The High Street has a number of pretty shops, restaurants and bars with two stables available for riding on the Common. The Common itself is over 1200 acres and is perfect for walking, riding, cycling or golf at one of the three courses within the Common.

Wimbledon railway station is around 800m away with a regular link to central London. Locally are a number of excellent schools with Kings College School and Wimbledon High School both around 600m away.

Source of times:
Source of distances: Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Agent's Note: Savills would like to make potential purchasers aware that the property is within a conservation area. For further information visit

Description

This outstanding five double bedroom family house is set back from the road behind a landscaped front garden and opens into a deep wide entrance hall with attractive herringbone parquet flooring which extends across the reception space. To the front is an elegant bay fronted double reception room with original dividing doors, beautiful marble twin fireplaces and green views of the garden to the rear. There is also a useful study/home office.

The lower ground floor provides excellent informal living space with a bay fronted reception room to the front benefitting from good natural light with built in cabinetry and display shelving. This could also be used as an occasional fifth bedroom as there is also a shower room alongside. To the rear is a fantastic kitchen/dining room with full height folding doors leading onto a beautiful stone terrace with gradual steps up to a spectacular, well stocked, private 111' rear garden.

The contemporary shaker style kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards with wooden work surfaces and fully integrated appliances complete with a central island. The utility room is conveniently located off the kitchen. There is also a downstairs shower room/guest cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is the principal bedroom suite with well designed fitted wardrobe space and a luxurious en suite bathroom with a large basin, roll top bath and a separate glass rain shower. To the rear is an additional double bedroom with built in wardrobes and a stylish guest shower room. On the top floor are a further two double bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom.

The house also benefits from a shared drive way, a garage and planning permission in place to add a sun room at the rear increasing the living accommodation.

Square Footage: 2783 sq ft

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Convent Mews, 45 Edge Hill, Wimbledon, London SW19
detailedDescription:
An impressive modern five bedroom family house in a private secure gated development close to Wimbledon Village and Common.

Location

Edge Hill is a popular residential street that runs between Wimbledon Village and town. Convent Mews is a prestigious gated development approximately 1200m from the mainline stations of either Wimbledon or Raynes Park.

The Village High Street is around 800m away with its collection of pretty boutiques and restaurants, King's College School only 100m distant. The Common with its 1,200 acres of open space is within 600m and is perfect for riding, cycling or walking. Locally are a number of picturesque golf courses with four clubs being within one mile.

Wimbledon railway station is around 1500m offering a fast and regular link to central London (17 min) and the District line for the West End.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
Source of times
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This impressive semi detached five bedroom family home is located within a prestigious secure gated development, built in 2013 to a high specification by a renowned developer.

The house opens into a deep, wide entrance hall with a solid wood staircase leading to upper and lower floors.

The ground floor comprises to the front a bay fronted reception room with dark wood flooring and double doors opening to a second reception space to the rear. Two sets of double doors overlook the paved south facing walled garden with access down to the garden and parking. The garden can also be accessed via a separate side gate. There is also a guest cloakroom.

On the lower ground floor, is an open plan family kitchen/living/dining space with an extensive range of smart bespoke fitted units, stone work surfaces, integrated Miele appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar. Two sets of French windows open onto the paved south facing patio garden perfect for outside dining. A fully fitted utility room is conveniently located off the kitchen and a downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the rear is the principal bedroom suite with cleverly designed wardrobe space and a generous en suite bathroom featuring twin basins, a bathtub and a separate glass rain shower. There is a further bedroom and contemporary family bathroom on this level.

A guest bedroom suite is located on the second floor with a stylish en suite shower room. There are an additional two bedrooms and a family shower room.

At the back of the property there is useful off street parking with a car lift.

Square Footage: 3366 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This delightful arts and crafts house provides well laid out family accommodation. The property has an entrance vestibule leading to an entrance hall and cloakroom, a spacious drawing room, dining room and study. There is a modern kitchen/breakfast room which opens to the hall and orangery with underfloor heating. The first floor has a master bedroom overlooking the garden with walk in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom. There are three further bedrooms, one with an en-suite, and a family bathroom. The second floor has two further double bedrooms, bathroom and box room. In addition, there is a great deal of eaves storage.

Outside
The property enjoys delightful gardens which back onto the attractive Buddhist temple and its wonderful grounds. The gardens extend to the right behind a neighbouring garden, where this is currently used as a growing area with raised beds for vegetables. This area is screened from the more formal gardens which can be seen form the house. This area has a paved terrace and lawn area with flower and shrub borders and mature trees. There is side access to the rear garden either side of the house, with a double-length garage to the right of the house.

Situation
Parkside Gardens is one of the most sought after roads in Wimbledon Village. The village is well known for its select range of individual shops, cafes and restaurants. Wimbledon Common offers a whole host of outdoor activities including horse riding and two well established golf courses . The area is well known for its schooling with Kings College school being a short distance away on Southside Common.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
George Ellis Property Services is the instructed agent for this property and viewings can be conducted in accordance with government guidelines.

If you have been looking for a house that you can buy and you do not need to lift a single paint brush – then this is it!

Based over three floors this extended four bedrooms, two bathrooms, two reception rooms and stunning kitchen awaits. The property has been lovingly maintained by its current owners, who have modernised and decorated to neutral tones, throughout. This end of terrace house offers a light and airy feel and has all of the benefits that a modern house has.

On the ground floor, you have two reception rooms and a downstairs WC. The second reception room expands into a vast luxury kitchen with ample units. There are patio doors that overlook a 40ft garden and then the surprise awaits. At the end of this garden is a very large summerhouse, with its own en-suite, fully fitted kitchen with washing machine, ideal to entertain family and friends when we can, or very useful as a guest room as it comes fully equipped.

The first floor has three bedrooms and the family bathroom, again all decorated to a great standard. Two have fitted wardrobes. The family shower room is fully tiled, most of the flooring within the house is of good wood or ceramic tiles in bathrooms and kitchen.

On the top floor there is a large bedroom, with ample storage in built-in units and under eaves. With a designated area to work from home and the doors open up on to a Juliette balcony overlooking the quiet garden. There is also a separate fully tiled shower room on this floor.

They seek serious buyers who have everything in place after being disappointed by previous buyers who could not get their mortgage.

There are some schools in the area that are outstanding and with quick access to many green spaces and great transportation links Eastfields, and Norbury br stations being nearby and Beddington tram. A selection of local retailers are nearby too if you do not wish to walk too far.

To appreciate what this property has to offer, we recommend you contact the vendors viewing agent; George Ellis Property Services at your earliest convenience.

detailedDescription:
A refurbished and beautifully presented ground floor apartment with private terrace forming part of an elegant Octagon development on one of the most prestigious roads in Wimbledon Village overlooking Wimbledon Common.

The apartment has undergone extensive refurbishment and fittings that are sourced from exclusive bespoke suppliers. This includes new contemporary bathrooms, fitted with bespoke majestic shower enclosures, Dornbracht shower and bath appliances, silver grey Italian porcelain, mother of pearl panelled niches with Thassos marble and lit with LED lighting. There is Element 7 Lunar Larch flooring in all rooms except the kitchens and bathrooms, silver hand blown glass handles. Approached via a smart communal entrance with generous communal areas designed recently by Hill House Interiors (completed in December 2018), the apartment has a spacious hallway leading to an elegant 27' sitting room with a Chesney's fireplace and double doors leading to a sweeping very spacious private terrace; a fitted kitchen/breakfast room with silver grey wall and base units with black granite work surfaces, Italian tiles and Miele & Neff appliances. The excellent master bedroom has mirror fronted wardrobes and smart newly fitted en-suite bathroom. There is a good size second bedroom with mirror fronted fitted wardobes and a newly fitted second bathroom fitted to again an exceptionally high standard. The private terrace is located to the front of the sitting room, whilst there are meticulously maintained communal gardens to the rear. A lift in the communal hallway leads down to the underground car park in which the apartment has two large designated car parking spaces. All apartments have access to the communal gardens.

Situation
Oxford House is a prestigious block of 18 flats built by Octagon immediately opposite Wimbledon Common on Parkside. The Mainline train station and District Line Tube station in Wimbledon town provide fast and frequent services to the City and West End.

Additional Information
The property is to be sold as a Share of Freehold with an underlying lease of 125 years which was granted in July 1996. The seller informs us that the Service Charge is approximately £4,000 per annum and the Ground Rent is £200.00, to increase by £100 every 25 years.

detailedDescription:
This wonderful four-bedroom mid-century house on Cottenham Place is a rare original. Positioned on the leafy slopes of the Copse Hill estate in Wimbledon, it was built in 1960 as part of a series of carefully conceived terraces with far-reaching and elevated views towards the North Downs. This house sits at the end of the terrace, among the estate’s sprawling communal gardens, with a south-facing balcony and patio garden.

The Building

The houses that form Cottenham Place, referred to as the Copse Hill estate by Nikolaus Pevsner, are an excellent example of the thoughtful, early 1960s developments that were inspired by the success of Eric Lyons’ Span estates, which are known for their considered design and beautiful gardens. These houses were a luxury development by Wimpey Homes; they were admired by Ian Nairn a few years after their construction in Modern Buildings in London for their “sensitively landscaped surroundings”. This house was bought by the current owners in the 1960s and is one of few to retain its original fixtures and fittings internally. As such, it requires some modernisation.

The Tour

The house is positioned at the top of the estate, at the end of a sloping road winding through the terraces to the peak of the hill. There is a private drive, which leads down to the lower ground floor internal garage. There is a secondary front door at this level that leads to a utility room with its original fixtures, a storeroom and a wonderfully bright hobby room, which could be used as a fourth bedroom. This space has sliding doors that open directly onto the garden.

The main entrance is at raised ground floor level, where beautiful five finger parquet runs underfoot and an open-tread staircase connects the three levels. To the left is the kitchen, which retains its original, soft grey-hued lino flooring and joinery, as well as a hatch into the dining room. The living room at the rear of the plan has further modern detailing, including a 1960s fire surround, and sliding doors that open onto the balcony, which has recently been restored.

Upstairs, there are three bedrooms, the largest of which has incredible views through a bank of full-width windows, as well as an en suite bathroom. The other two bedrooms and family bathroom can be found off the bright central hallway. The bathroom retains its original tiling, which reflects the considered natural palette of wood and grey tones found throughout the house.

The Area

Wimbledon is one of London’s most attractive areas, with its large, open green space of Wimbledon Common and the renowned restaurants, cafés and boutiques of the historic Wimbledon Village. The house is extremely well located for the green spaces of Wimbledon and Putney Commons, as well as Richmond Park, which is slightly further afield. There are a number of highly sought-after schools in the area.

Cottenham Place is a 15-minute walk to Raynes Park Station, which runs direct services into London Waterloo. Wimbledon Station has excellent rail connections and is also on the south London tram network. The A3 is close at hand, for easy access to central London and the Surrey countryside.
title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
House with a view - Newly refurbished to a very high standard, a stunning home with a fabulous south-facing entertaining area. Benefitting from underfloor heating throughout, all the mod cons, garage, plus front and rear access

On the ground floor, featuring a magnificent open plan fully fitted kitchen/diner with breakfast bar and living room which extends out via bi-fold doors on a large sun-drenched deck, split level outdoor area onto a paved garden - perfect space for a family or entertaining with guests. There is also one bedroom on this level which could also be used as a second reception room/kids lounge, as well a WC toilet.

On the first level, you have two double bedrooms and one single bedroom, all with built-in wardrobes. One of the doubles has an ensuite shower-room and boasts gorgeous views over greenery and garden allotments. There is a family bathroom also on this floor.

The master bedroom with ensuite occupies the entire top floor, boasting even better fabulous views. From the ensuite, relax in the tub while you watch the sunset and enjoy the peace and privacy.

The garage/shed to the rear can be accessed via the garden or the rear driveway, is fully insulated and wired, with tiled flooring and shelving, and also comes with its own American sized fridge freezer and ice maker.

Thurleston Avenue is ideally nestled in West Wimbledon with the closest underground stations being Wimbledon, Raynes Park and Morden, offering easy access into the City, or the overground stations South Merton, Morden South and Wimbledon chase, plus a short drive to access the A3 with easy access to Gatwick. Tescos Superstore is closeby, as well as smaller supermarkets such as The Cooperative, Sainsburys and Waitrose. Several parks are within close walking distance including Cannon Hill Common and Morden Park, plus Schools such as Hillcross Primary School, St John Fisher rc Primary School, Hatfeild Primary School, Harris Academy Morden and Perseid Upper School.

A Director of Berkeley & Woods is the Owner of the property.

A family bathroom, separate WC and three well-proportioned double bedrooms of which the smallest measures 10'3 x 9'8.

A stunning brand new home, set within a secure and secluded gated development with mobile phone activated gates.

The property benefits from allocated off-road parking and is situated in a highly convenient location close to Raynes Park Station, with frequent trains to Waterloo (21mins).

The house is part of an exclusive development and is built to a high specification, with accommodation arranged over four floors.
Accommodation comprises


Ground floor: Spacious entrance hall with storage cupboard | reception room which leads to the landscaped west facing rear garden | study | guest cloakroom | lower ground floor: Modern kitchen with integrated appliances open to A dining/family room with bi-folding doors to an enclosed and private terrace with stairs leading to the west facing landscaped rear garden | upper 2 floors comprises four bedrooms and three luxury bath/shower rooms including (2 en suites) with ample built-in storage
.

High quality finish | 10-year build guarantee | resident parking | west facing landscaped rear garden | patio on lower ground level, with stairs up to garden

joinery specification: Staircase – concrete stairs clad in wood, timber handrail. | doors – 2 panel white doors, lipped profile. | ironmongery – polished chrome handles on rose, bathrooms with matching escutcheon<br/><br/>location<br/><br/>Raynes Park is conveniently located close to Wimbledon and Kingston Town Centres with their excellent shopping facilities, as is the A3 trunk road offering fast access to Central London and both Gatwick and Heathrow airports via the M25 motorway network. The train station at Raynes Park provides frequent services to Waterloo with its underground links to points throughout the City, with the nearest tube station being Wimbledon.

The immediate area offers a wide range of recreational facilities including three golf courses, tennis and squash clubs. Richmond Park, which is an area of natural outstanding beauty, provides a picturesque setting for picnics, horse riding, jogging or just leisurely walks. Theatres at Richmond and Wimbledon are also popular alternatives to the West End together with an excellent choice of restaurants. There are also numerous schools for all ages, Public and State and International.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive six bedroom detached house on a large plot with green views across Holland Gardens, close to Wimbledon Common and the Village.

Location

Cambridge Road is a pretty tree lined street in West Wimbledon opposite Holland Gardens. It is around 1km from Raynes Park railway station, which provides a fast and regular services to central London in under 20 minutes.

The house is nextdoor to the sought after Hollymount Primary School. Locally there is an excellent selection of schools both fee and non-fee paying with King's College School being around 1km away.

Wimbledon Common with its fabulous 1,200 acres of open space is around one mile away. Both Wimbledon and Kingston can be easily reached via bus or train and offer a comprehensive range of shops, restaurants and theatres.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
Source of times
All measurements are approximate

Description

A superb six bedroom double fronted detached family house built around 18 years ago by an award winning architect. The property has a great sense of light and space and offers well balanced living and entertaining space across three floors. The house benefits from wonderful views to the front of Holland Gardens and to the rear is a mature, private 105' south facing garden complete with a summerhouse.

The property is set back from the road behind gates, with off street parking and a garage. The house opens into a central reception hall with a generous dual aspect reception room with an attractive fireplace, wood floors and French doors to the gardens at the rear. A stunning kitchen/dining/living room benefits from an abundance of natural light due to its southerly aspect and is fitted with an extensive range of bespoke solid wood units with granite work surfaces, fully integrated AEG appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar. This offers a wonderful open plan multi purpose family space. Underfloor heating is fitted to both the kitchen and hall. There is also a guest cloakroom with boiler cupboard and coat space.

A galleried staircase leads to the first floor with a large landing. To the front is the main bedroom suite with doors to a pretty balcony. There is well designed fitted wardrobe space and a generous en suite bathroom with twin basins, a bath and separate glass shower. There are three further double
bedrooms on this floor, one with a balcony, and two family bathrooms.

The top floor offers wonderful views towards the North Downs and comprises a double aspect games room/office with a large balcony to the rear. Alongside are two additional bedrooms, a stylish shower room and a fully fitted utility room.

Square Footage: 3558 sq ft

The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. To the upper floor, there are two well sized double bedrooms, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Mitcham, Streatham and Tooting, with railway services from Mitcham Eastfields just a short stroll away. Numerous regular bus routes also offer good connections to the surrounding area. There are a variety of local shops and amenities nearby, with Mitcham and Colliers Wood providing a larger selection as well as restaurants and bars.

Viewings of this lovely maisonette are highly recommended.

address: Watery Lane, Merton Park, London SW20
detailedDescription:
If you are lucky enough to purchase this property, not only are you buying a piece of history but a true piece of workmanship and art. Steeproof was built by the Arts & Crafts architect John Sydney Brocklesby for himself and his new wife, as a new home to start their family in 1906. Brocklesby was one of two architects working for John Innes in developing Merton Park as a garden suburb around Innes’ Rutlish Manor estate. Many of the houses he designed have notably quirky features – round or semi-circular windows, inglenook fireplaces, curious porches. But for his own house, Brocklesby really pulled out all the stops: Steeproof has a roof a Swiss chalet could be proud of, topping a panelled house constructed like a house of cards on just a few massive wooden columns and beams. Surrounded by a large garden and adjacent to John Innes park (formerly part of the manor house grounds).<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
This excellent family house has a great deal of character. The ground floor has a spacious hallway with a parquet floor leading to the drawing room with inglenook fireplace and double doors to garden. The sitting room looks toward the front of the property with parquet floor and gas coal effect fireplace. The modern kitchen with island unit opens onto a large conservatory/dining room. This area has a lovely outlook towards the secluded garden. A cloakroom and study complete the accommodation at this level. The 1st floor has a principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom. There are three further bedrooms and a modernised family bathroom. The top floor bedroom is a spacious room with en-suite shower room.

Outside
The property sits with gardens to the front and rear, as well as off-street parking in addition to the garage which has direct access to the house. The secluded rear garden has been well landscaped with three levels and is stocked with a range of mature shrubs and trees.

An exceptional contemporary six bedroom detached house with beautifully landscaped gardens.

Location

Spencer Road is a quiet tree lined residential road located 100 meters from Cottenham Park with a playground, tennis courts and a cricket pitch. Raynes Park Mainline station (800 meters) offers a regular service into London Waterloo. The 200 bus offers excellent access to Wimbledon Village and the stations in the Broadway.

Description

Approached by a long drive, Spencer Road is an exceptional new build six bedroom contemporary house in a quiet West Wimbledon location.

High ceilings and picture windows feature throughout this wonderful new house arranged across two floors with a lift. The ground floor comprises a superb open plan architecturally designed bespoke kitchen/dining/family space with a dual aspect. To the rear of the ground floor is a games room which benefits from a tremendous amount of natural light. Alongside is a double bedroom with an en suite shower room. To the front is a drawing room and study.

Upstairs, the generous principal bedroom is impressive, with a dressing room and en suite bathroom to the rear. There are a further four double bedrooms, across the first floor, two with en suite bathrooms. There is also a stylish family bathroom.

The beautifully landscaped gardens surround the house on all sides creating a sense of seclusion with a stone terrace overlooking the garden to the rear. To the side is off street parking for several cars.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A fine 6 bedroom detached house occupying an unusually large plot of 0.24 acre (975 sq m), with lovely views across Holland Gardens, well placed for Wimbledon Common, the Village and the station

Light pours through this detached family house built approx. 18 years ago by a former award winning architect, with great attention to detail and cleverly combining modern living with character details. The property offers a great sense of volume and enjoys attractive views across its large front garden towards Holland Gardens and to the rear over the extensive south facing rear gardens with summerhouse.

Approached through a generous reception hall with spacious double aspect living/dining room with fireplace, wood floors and doors to the gardens. The huge kitchen/breakfast room is extensively fitted with bespoke solid wood units with granite work surfaces incorporating AEG applicances including 2 ovens, microwave, coffee machine, 2 fridges, 2 freezers and gas hob. There is plenty of space for a family sitting area and dining area. There is underfloor heating to the kitchen and hall. There is a guest cloakroom with boiler cupboard and coat hanging space.

The triple height staircase leads to the first floor with generous landing and Principal bedroom suite with doors to balcony, plenty of built in cupboards and large full en-suite bathroom. There are two further, good size bedrooms on this floor, (one with balcony) and a family bathroom. The top floor has fabulous views towards the North Downs and has a double aspect games room/office with large balcony and views and 2 further bedrooms, a shower room and practical utility room.

This well presented property is situated in this pleasant road directly opposite Holland Gardens, well placed for Raynes Park Mainline station (Waterloo 15 minutes) and local shops. Wimbledon Common and the Village, with its array of boutiques, restaurants and cafes, are within easy reach as are a number of good local schools – 2 excellent state primary schools being within a short walk and other nearby schools include King’s College School, The Rowans and The Study to name a few. Recreational facilities abound including golf, tennis, riding stables and fitness studios.

detailedDescription:
Calling all investors and first time buyers! For sale, a 3-double bedroom top-floor flat, with good-sized living room and private balcony all within walking distance of Morden Station.

Situated on the top floor of this purpose-built apartment block the accommodation comprises, three, good-size double bedrooms, a spacious living room with private balcony, kitchen, bathroom and separate WC.

The property was redecorated a few years ago but has since been tenanted and so would benefit from refurbishment, and the plain, painted walls, neutral carpets, efficient kitchen layout and simple, white bath-suite offer any potential purchasers a blank canvas to create a stunning apartment.

The reception room measures approx 14'5 x 13' and has access out onto a private balcony overlooking the communal grounds. The kitchen has ample cabinets and space for both integrated and freestanding appliances as well as table and chairs while the main bedroom is a generous 12'4 x 11'7. In addition are two further double bedrooms both measuring over 10' x 9' making this property an excellent buy-to-let investment but also a good buy for those looking to get on the property ladder and also have plenty of space for guests and maybe a home office.

Located on London Road, Morden House is situated within walking distance of Morden Station and local amenities including Morden leisure centre and a selection of supermarkets and independent businesses along with great transport links and plenty of open green spaces.

At such a keen price and generous size this property will appeal to both first time buyers and professional landlords and Turners recommend early viewing.

address: Wimbledon Park Road, Wimbledon, London SW19
detailedDescription:
A contemporary detached five bedroom family house of 2,800 sq ft set back from the road with off street parking, a garage and a large rear garden.

Location

Wimbledon Park Road is regarded as one of the most popular roads in the area, being only 500 metres from the world famous All England Lawn Tennis Club. The property is located around 800 metres from Southfields Underground station with regular District Line access to central London. Southfields offers an excellent selection of day to day shops with popular restaurants and sought after local schools. Wimbledon Park with its fabulous boating lake and open grounds is only 250 metres away.

Source of times .
Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

Positioned behind electric gates, this well designed five bedroom family house has benefitted from a complete refurbishment in recent years, and now offers excellent lateral living and entertaining space across three floors. To the front is a generous double reception room with an attractive fireplace and solid wood flooring which extends across the ground floor. French doors to the rear open to a private, beautifully landscaped rear garden.

Alongside is a wonderful open plan kitchen/dining space which benefits from a tremendous amount of natural light with glass doors on two sides to the garden. The contemporary kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted unit and cupboards, fully integrated appliances complete with a breakfast bar. A study area is conveniently located off the dining room. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom and a utility room.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the rear is the principal bedroom with a wall of well designed fitted wardrobes, that overlooks the rear garden. There are a further three bedrooms, useful eaves storage and a generous family bathroom with a separate glass rain shower and bathtub. On the top floor is a guest suite with a stylish en suite shower room.

For privacy and security, the driveway is gated and, along with the garage, offers good off street parking.

Square Footage: 2809 sq ft

title: 4 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A stylishly refurbished one bedroom flat with design features, large living room, separate kitchen and communal gardens on quiet Darlaston Road on Wimbledon Hill, just a few minutes' walk to central Wimbledon, the Village and Wimbledon Common.

Set on the ground floor of this large Victorian property, the flat has been newly renovated to a high standard throughout. There is a welcoming central hallway upon entrance with useful built-in storage and new, solid wood Herringbone flooring that continues throughout much of the property. There is a large reception room with bespoke shelf storage, designer radiators and fireplace with a large integrated TV wall. The new kitchen has been finished to a high standard and is in keeping with the rest of the property. The fitted units have LED strip lighting, there are granite work surfaces, integrated Neff appliances and the sink has an InSinkErator and an instant hot water tap.

The bedroom is of a good size with extensive bespoke wardrobe space with in-built LED lighting along one whole wall, design lighting and radiator and window seating. The bathroom has been stylishly tiled, with high quality fixtures and has a large wet-room style walk-in shower.

The property also benefits from dimmable lighting, gas central heating and double glazing throughout, and there is a shared lawn garden at the rear of the property.

Darlaston Road is at the foot of Wimbledon Hill and is a desirable, quiet residential road within short walking distance of all the shops, restaurants, gyms, cinemas of Wimbledon. Ever popular Wimbledon Village with it's boutique shops and eateries is close by, as are the wide open green spaces of Wimbledon Common with tennis clubs, horse riding stables and golf courses.

Wimbledon mainline and tube station is a few minutes' walk away with regular services to Waterloo in 17 mins.

detailedDescription:
Elsrick Avenue is situated in a cul-de-sac location in a highly sought-after area of Morden, littered with green space at Morden Park and Risley Recreation Ground. This location is next to bus routes, which link Morden Town Centre, and beyond. Morden town centre benefits from the Northern Line tube station and a plethora of bus routes linking to Croydon, Sutton, Wimbledon, Raynes Park and Colliers Wood. St Helier and Morden South Train Stations also link to Sutton and Wimbledon, as well as Vauxhall and London Bridge. This part of Morden accommodates green spaces at Morden Park and Morden Hall Park, which forms part of the National Trust. The Leisure Centre in Morden Park is appealing for those with active lifestyles and for families there are a number of Primary Schools at hand.

Andrews Estate Agents are pleased to present to the market this well presented four bedroom terraced family home, located in a popular residential cul-de-sac within half a mile of Morden Tube station

The ground floor offers a light and airy bay-fronted, south facing, reception room with feature fireplace, a dining room which opens up to the conservatory and looks out in to rear garden, a perfect place to wind down after a long day at work. The kitchen completes the downstairs accommodation and comes fully fitted with integrated appliances.

The first floor boasts three bedrooms of which two are doubles and the third an ideal space to work from home. All three of these bedrooms benefits from fitted wardrobes, are well proportioned and serviced by a family bathroom with separate WC.
The second floor provides an additional double bedroom and three piece bathroom thanks to its loft conversion. Benefiting from built in cupboards to further enhance your storage solutions and wonderful views across Morden Park.

To the front of the property there is a driveway to provide off street parking. To the rear, a well maintained garden which offers lawn and patio areas making it ideal for 'alfresco' dining with family and friends. At the back of the garden there is a garage with an up and over door.<br /><br />

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An attractive two bedroom Maisonette situated in a highly regarded gated block of flats on Worple Road. The property is not your traditional split level Maisonette, as it boasts a "homely cottage feel" with a private entrance on Stanton Road.

The ground floor offers incredible light throughout the whole day and is comprised of a well-proportioned reception room with a large south-west facing balcony, a spacious and light kitchen leading out to an east-facing garden and a separate downstairs cloakroom.

The first floor consists of two good sized bedrooms both with separate en-suite bathrooms. The principal bedroom also benefits from a large south-west facing balcony.

There is an ample amount of storage available on the ground floor and in the loft. The property also has access to a private car parking space.

The Maisonette occupies an excellent position and is conveniently located for Kings College School, Wimbledon Common and the Royal Wimbledon Golf club. Raynes Park also benefits from excellent transport links with a train line into and out of Waterloo 12 times an hour, and bus services to Wimbledon, Kingston and beyond.

Located between New Malden and Wimbledon, Raynes Park has one of the largest proportions of green open space in south west London. With a number of parks including Cottenham park Recreation Ground and Cannon Hill Common with its 140-year old woodland that provides a habitat for a variety of flora and fauna, Raynes Park is excellent for both greenery and city convienience. The centre of Raynes park is built around the station and offers a variety of amenities with shops, pubs and restaurants including a Sainsbury's Local Supermarket, Health Centre and Post Office.
