detailedDescription:
A unique seven bedroom house in one of Wimbledon Village's most sought after locations with flexible accommodation, featuring a gym, an indoor pool, and a south facing garden.

Location

The Grange is positioned on one of the areas finest and most sought after roads in the heart of Wimbledon Village with the Common being approximately 150m away.

Wimbledon Village High Street with its popular boutiques, bars and restaurants is also approximately 400m away. Wimbledon Village retains a true village feel whilst being only 6 miles from central London with stables and small public houses that spill out onto the Common.

The Common is perfect for walking, riding or cycling with many routes and bridleways and three popular golf courses. There are a number of excellent schools within a few hundred metres with Kings College School for boys 400m away. Wimbledon mainline station is 1200m distant and offers a fast and regular link to central London (18 minutes)

Source of times .
Source of distances google pedometer
All measurements are approximate

Description

A contemporary seven bedroom family house offering over 6,500 sq ft of wonderful living and entertaining space located in the heart of Wimbledon village with a garage and off street parking.

Constructed in the late 1980's, the house is set back from the road with off street parking for several cars. To the front is a study and a superb kitchen/breakfast room with an extensive range of units and full height cupboards, fully integrated appliances and large central island/breakfast bar. To the rear is a spectacular open plan living space that runs across the back of the the house creating a wonderful multi purpose space. A family area flows through to a generous reception room which leads to a formal dining room. French doors from both the reception and dining room open to a wonderful terrace which overlooks a beautifully landscaped private southerly facing garden with a modern oval garden pod.

The lower ground floor comprises a superb leisure complex with a gym, sauna, spa area, swimming pool and pool room. There is also a double bedroom, a shower room and a plant room located to the front.

Upstairs, the principal suite is located to the rear with well designed fitted wardrobe space and a luxurious en suite bathroom. A guest suite with an en suite bathroom has French doors to a balcony at the rear. There are a further three bedrooms to the front and a stylish shower room. On the top floor is an additional bedroom, shower room, store room and large games room.

Square Footage: 6494 sq ft

title: 7 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This is one of only two executive build apartments in a very highly sought after estate which is unique for London, in that it is an oasis set within 4 acres of Greenery where the plants and trees are regularly maintained and even has a flowing brook.

The flat itself comprises of a extra large living room; 2 double bedrooms; a family size bathroom; an extra large kitchen, and a dining area which is large enough to seat gatherings 10 -12 for special occasions. All of the rooms are unusually spacious and bright; catching sunlight throughout the day, with pleasing views from every window or its large balcony.

The living room connects to the South West facing balcony through patio doors providing access to outside space all through the year, but especially benefits from the evening light as the sun sets in the west.

There are 3 extra large storage spaces in the flat itself; one large enough to use as study space, and has accessible loft space which is the same size as the entire flat.

The owners will also benefit from the convenience of off-street parking in a quiet cul-de-sac.

The flat has recently been freshly redecorated and completely refurbished which includes double glazing and wood flooring throughout; a new energy efficient central heating boiler. The new owner will also benefit from a newly installed kitchen featuring an energy efficient dishwasher; washing machine; oven and hob with a new kitchen sink, a newly refurbished bathroom and living room suite. The outside of the flat has been refreshed with new sofits and roof tiles.

Moving around the area without personal transport is made easy with very reliable bus service, including a 24 hour night bus that runs through the area for those on shift work, alternatively Morden Underground or Raynes Park Railway for greater distances provide fast services into central London.

The residents are spoilt for choice when it comes to shopping, surrounded by the 3 major shopping centres of Wimbledon, Kingston and Sutton to choose from, featuring all the major high street names in shopping and award winning eateries.

The flat is central to 3 major hospital including St Helier', St Georges' and Kingston Hospital and a large selection of gp services, some within walking distance.
There are a number of fitness centres nearby, notably the Virgin Active and the David Lloyd Centre frequented by Wimbledon tennis players and celebrities.

The area is home to popular schools including, st John Fishers, Aragon and Hatfield Primary school. Also Blossom House, Coombe Boys and Raynes Park High with Kingston and Rohampton University nearby.

With its prime location; refurbishment; generous living space; outside space; and off-street parking, Turners are expecting a high level of interest in this property and urge any interested parties to book early to view.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located just a short distance from the centre of Morden Town Centre this superb two bedroom first floor maisonette with a private garden. The property is ideal for those looking for their first purchase or rental investment.

As you enter the flat through your own front door you are greeted with a spacious hallway ideal for storage of shoes and coats. Continuing into the flat up a single flight of stairs you will find a generously sized separate reception room which is bright and airy due to its large windows overlooking the gardens at the rear of the building. Next to the reception room you will find a spacious kitchen with a serving hatch into the reception room which connects the two rooms nicely. The main bedroom to the front of the property is a well sized double room and again features a large window which makes it bright and airy. Bedroom two is a great size and is currently being used as a nursery but could be used as a guest bedroom or study. The bathroom is modern and neutral.

The large detached garden itself has a lovely patio area ideal for relaxing on a summers evening and a well maintained lawn.

Additionally there is the added benefit of a garage en-bloc which is ideal for additional storage or parking.

This is a wonderful maisonette which needs to be viewed to be truly appreciated, early viewing is recommended.

Location

Located on the Surrey and London boarders close to a vibrant town centre you will find this charming flat in Morden, you are close to all the bars, restaurants, cafes and shops which the area has to offer. The area boasts some outstanding schools both in the state and private sectors. For those fitness fanatics, there are a number of gyms close by and some great walks and trails to explore including Ravensbury Park and Morden Hall Park which is part of the National Trust both of which offer some lovely dog walking opportunities. Morden Station which is part of the London Underground Network (Northern Line) is a short distance away as is St Helier Station with its links into London Bridge and London Victoria stations. There are excellent road links to the A217, A3, M23 and M25. Gatwick airport can be easily accessed within 30 minutes with Heathrow only an hour away, the seaside resort of Brighton can also be reached within the hour.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular five bedroom new build property located in a highly sought after residential area of Wimbledon, South West London. Could you see yourself living here?

Overview

Exquisitely designed and built over four separate floors, this five bedroom, four bathroom family home in Wimbledon has been newly completed to an exceptionally high standard.

Starting on the lower ground floor where a bedroom with an ensuite, games room and a utility room make excellent use of the space. This floor would equally be ideal as a self contained guest facility as it would a place to relax indoors. Ample natural light is provided to the lower ground floor via a light well that visually connects the south facing rear garden located above it, seamlessly bringing the outside in.

The ground floor plays host to the hub of the home. A masterfully designed kitchen family room with elegant cabinetry and bi-fold doors offer an effortless transition into the rear garden. Elsewhere on the ground floor is an entrance hall, reception room and a downstairs cloakroom.

Moving up to the first floor where the principal suite consists of a large double bedroom, dressing room and an ensuite, featuring both a bath and a shower. A second bedroom also containing an ensuite can be found on the first floor. Elegant neutral decor and floor to ceiling windows leading out to a balcony give this space the feel of a boutique hotel.

The second floor features a further two bedrooms and a bathroom. The bedroom sitting towards the front of the property leads out to a Juliet balcony, adding to the airy feel of the space.

Throughout the property, no expense has been spared in terms of luxury amenities, including aluminium windows and doors throughout, Miele appliances in the kitchen, a Franke Omni 4 in 1 tap, underfloor heating, and Roca features in the bathrooms. Solar panels also boost the property’s energy efficiency credentials.

The front drive completes the property’s kerb appeal, and has been designed using extremely hard wearing block paving that also provides an off street parking space.

Location

Woodside is located in the heart of Wimbledon, and is close to Wimbledon Village, Wimbledon Common and the world famous All England Lawn Tennis & Croquet Club.

As a desirable leafy green area of the capital, Wimbledon offers an abundance of outdoor activities. This is alongside its various shopping districts, restaurants and entertainment venues, making Wimbledon a popular residential location for families and working professionals alike.

Several prestigious schools and colleges can be found in the area, 55 of which have been rated as ‘Outstanding’ by Ofstead, including Wimbledon Park Primary School, Holy Trinity CofE Primary School and Ricards Lodge High School.

Transport

Woodside is located 0.2 miles to Wimbledon Station (District Line) offering easy connectivity into Central London.

Wimbledon Train Station is served by South Western Railway and Thameslink, including a frequent service to London Waterloo. Wimbledon Tram Stop also provides convenience for travelling locally.

Nearby TfL bus services include services 156 (Wimbledon to Vauxhall), 453 (St George’s/University of London to Richmond) and N87 (Fairfield Bus Station to Aldwych).

For international travel, Heathrow Airport is a 12 mile drive from the property via the A3 and M25.

Viewings - By appointment only with Daniel White from Fine & Country Wimbledon. Please enquire and quote dwa.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A generous two double bedroom ground floor flat offering excellent lateral living and a southerly facing rear garden.

Location

Glendale Drive is a much sought after address in Wimbledon. Within a short distance are a useful collection of local everyday shops on Leopold Road with a more comprehensive range of shops, restaurants and bars in Wimbledon Village and Town.

Wimbledon mainline rail station (London Waterloo 17 mins approx) and Underground District line are around 1000 meters away. Locally are a number of excellent schools with Bishop Gilpin Primary 400 meters away, Kings College School for boys 2000 meters and Wimbledon High girls school 800 meters.

Wimbledon Park with its wonderful open space, tennis courts, adventure playground and boating lake is just 800 meters away.

Source of times .
Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This two bedroom apartment occupies the ground floor of a period property set back from the road with one half of the front garden. The flat opens into a central hallway with attractive wood flooring which extends across the living space.

To the front is a generous bay fronted reception room and a large double bedroom. Alongside is a modern bathroom with a bathtub and a separate shower. To the rear is the principal double bedroom with plenty of natural light due to the southerly aspect. Opposite is a contemporary kitchen with an excellent range of fitted units, integrated appliances and a useful dining space. Double glazed glass doors open to a private, paved garden to the rear with a southerly aspect and mature borders.

The property also benefits from useful gated side access with a store and is chain free.

detailedDescription:
Designed and built under the famed Farrell/Grimshaw Partnership, these listed townhouses rarely come onto the market. The property features four double bedrooms, spacious lounge-dining area, kitchen/diner, master bedroom with private balcony & en-suite, garage, private rear garden and is located in a quiet, leafy cul-de-sac.

The building has been recently renovated and refurbished to a contemporary design and high standard. The property entrance leads into the hallway with access to a downstairs bedroom/study, which could also be used as an additional reception room, with double doors leading out to the rear garden. There is also access to a downstairs w/c and the integral garage which has power, lighting and utilities room. The property has a previously approved licence to alter, for those looking to further adapt this space.
To the first floor, the recent kitchen has cupboard space to two sides, integrated gas hob, two fan ovens, fridge-freezer, dishwasher and island unit seating space to either side. The lounge-dining room area is an open, light filled space with large windows to the front of the property. To the second floor, there are two double bedrooms to the front & rear of the house, family bathroom tiled throughout with a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin with storage below and above and heated towel rail.
The third floor features a master bedroom, en-suite shower room and designed with space for a dressing area/second office; the master bedroom benefits from built in his and her wardrobes and bi-folding doors leading out to a private balcony/patio area, hidden by the trees above. The modern and spacious en-suite shower room has recently been fitted and there is a walk-in shower unit, w/c, hand basin with storage below and above and heated towel rail.

Outside - The property has a driveway space for one car and an integral garage used for additional storage space. The private rear garden is surrounded by mature shrubs & trees

Location

The property is located 0.4 miles from Southfields tube station (District Line) and 1.6 miles from both Earlsfield train station & Putney train station with links into London Waterloo, Clapham Junction & Wimbledon.

For primary schools, Albemarle Primary School is within 0.1 mile, Southmead Primary School is 0.2 miles away and Our Lady Queen of Heaven rc School is 0.4 miles away.
For secondary schools, Saint Cecilia's Church of England School is 0.4 miles away, Southfields Academy is 0.8 miles away and Ark Putney Academy is within 0.9 miles.

The property is within walking distance of Wimbledon Common, Wimbledon Park and easy access into both Wimbledon and Putney.

title: 4 bed town house for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful Edwardian five bedroom house in a much sought after location with a sublime south west facing garden, off street parking and a garage.

Location

Belvedere Avenue is one of Wimbledon's most sought after addresses within 100m of the High St and 800m of Wimbledon mainline station (London 17 min).

Locally are a number of popular schools with Wimbledon High School for girls and Kings College for boys both around 600m away.

Wimbledon Village retains a true sense of separation from central London whilst being only 8 miles from the West End. Wimbledon Common offers over 1200 acres of open space ideal for riding, cycling or walking.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
Source of times
All measurements are approximate

Description

An impressive five bedroom period home in a prime Wimbledon location within walking distance of both the High Street and Wimbledon town.

This beautifully presented house is set back from the road behind a landscaped front garden with stone steps to the front door. The property offers excellent lateral space across three floors with generous living and entertaining space and a self-contained annexe benefitting from a separate entrance.

The house opens into a generous reception hall creating a wonderful sense of space. To the front is a bay fronted formal dining room with elegant herring bone parquet flooring. Opposite is a stunning bespoke kitchen with an extensive range of fitted units, granite work surfaces, fully integrated appliances and underfloor heating. Cleverly designed ceiling windows allow an abundance of natural light. To the rear is a fantastic reception space with a contemporary fireplace and family room that extends across the rear of the house with three sets of French doors out to a paved terrace overlooking a beautifully landscaped south west facing garden with raised flowerbeds and a folly to the rear.

Upstairs, on the first floor the principal suite with a dressing area and generous en suite bathroom with a bath tub and separate glass shower is located at the rear. There are a further two double bedrooms both with en suite bathrooms. On the top floor are an additional two bedrooms and a stylish shower room with accessible eaves storage.

The annexe offers flexible accommodation and comprises a kitchen, a shower room, reception/office space and loft storage ideal for a nanny/house keeper.

Square Footage: 3867 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • *Guide Price £390,000 - £400,000*
  • Well Presented First & Top Floor Maisonette
  • Renovated Throughout to a High Standard
  • Two Double Bedrooms with Wardrobes
  • Mezzanine Level over the Living/Dining Room
  • Modern Kitchen with Appliances
  • Bathroom/Utility with Jacuzzi Bath
  • Front Garden & Off-Road Parking Spaces
  • Electric Heating System Built into the Ceiling
  • Local Amenities and Train Links to London & Beyond

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Two Bedroom Maisonette – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £390,000 - £400,000*

internal:
Entrance Hall - The front entrance door opens to the hall, with the staircase to the first floor landing.
First Floor Landing - With doors to the living/dining room, bedroom one and the storage cupboard, and stairs to the top floor landing.
Living/Dining Room - Offering space for furniture for both living and dining, with a rear aspect window, a bay with another rear aspect window, wood flooring and a look-through to the kitchen fitted with a fish tank. There is a high ceiling with a the mezzanine bedroom overhead.
Kitchen - Fitted with a modern range of wall and base units with marble effect worktops over. Inset sink basin with a mixer tap, and an integrated electric oven with a countertop induction hob and overhead extractor system. Spaces for a dishwasher and a washing machine, which connects to the storage cupboard in the hall.
Bedroom One - Double size room with a front aspect window, a built-in wardrobe and carpeted flooring.

Top Floor Landing - With doors to bedroom two, the bathroom and the storage cupboard.
Bedroom Two - Double size mezzanine room with a gallery overlooking the lounge, featuring a Velux window, a built-in wardrobe and carpeted flooring.
Bathroom/Utility - Modern suite comprising a push-button WC, a wash hand basin and a corner integrated Jacuzzi bath with 24 jets, lighting and an overhead electric shower. Velux window, a utility area spacing a washing machine and tumble dryer, and eaves storage.

External:
The property has its own front door and lawned garden, with off-road parking spaces opposite the property.
It's a short walk to Mitcham Common and Mitcham Town Centre with local amenities and facilities. There are also links from Mitcham Eastfield's station to Clapham Junction, London Victoria, London Bridge, City Thameslink, Farringdon, St Pancras International and Luton Airport, amongst many others.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

detailedDescription:
Overview

Hunters Tower Bridge welcomes this five bedroom end of terrace house to the market, set on popular residential street Park Avenue.

This wonderful home is set over three floors and covers 1587 sqft, and is decorated to a high standard, with new wooden floors throughout the house. All bedrooms are a good size and give ample storage.

This property also benefits from the location; it is close to reputable schools and fantastic transport links with fast connections to Clapham Junction, East Croydon, Victoria & Kings Cross.

The ground floor features a stunning white open plan kitchen that features a new modern fitted kitchen that overlooks the private rear garden. This open plan living space also leads into a good-sized dining room area (currently used as a lounge) that also follows the white and grey design scheme. Both these rooms feature new grey wooden floors.

Leading upstairs to the first floor, you have two large double bedrooms, the third single room (fits 4ft double bed) and a family bathroom.

The second floor includes a large double bedroom, a second double bedroom and a shower room.

The bathroom on the first floor and the shower room on the second floor are both new and feature pure white suites with grey wall tiles and flooring. Both also include storage.

The front garden is concrete and could easily be made into a front-drive for off-street parking. On-road permits are available for residents and visitors.

The back garden features a patio area, artificial grass, and a garden shed. There is also access to the garden via a gate that leads to a side entrance.

If you require any further information, please contact the Hunters Tower Bridge.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented five bedroom period family home, which has been tastefully finished, and is offered in excellent order throughout. Situated on a popular residential road, on the sought after Wimbledon park Grid, and located within the priority catchment area for Wimbledon Park Primary School. The house is just a short walk from Wimbledon Park station (District Line), and the local shops, cafes and restaurants on Arthur Road. The house offers to the ground floor, a spacious through lounge, with oak flooring, plantation shutters, beautiful bespoke handmade storage & shelving, and two attractive feature fireplaces. The ground floor also benefits from a bright and spacious fully fitted kitchen / dining / family room, with doors that open fully onto the very neat and low maintenance family garden. A ground floor guest cloakroom completes the ground floor. To the first floor there are 3 double bedrooms, a single bedroom/study, and bright and modern family bathroom, with shower over the bath. The second floor boasts a spacious master bedroom with ample bespoke wardrobe space and lots of additional eaves storage, and double doors with a Juliette balcony. There is a second full bathroom, with large shower cubicle, beautiful roll top bath and contemporary Moroccan influenced floor tiles. This is a great family home in a sought after location, and internal viewings are strongly advised. Energy rating: D.

address: The Wimbledon Beaumont Nursing Home, Arterberry Road, London SW20
detailedDescription:
Description

Wimbledon Beaumont Care Community has an elegant and historic building at its heart, thoughtfully adapted to its care home role.

The community also offers luxury apartments for independent living, with associated domiciliary and other services if they are required. The home is located close to local amenities in Wimbledon and Raynes Park which both have great public transport links.

The nursing home at Wimbledon Beaumont provides care and support to frail older people and to people living with dementia, while residents of the luxury apartments can access home care assistants and services from the home.

The home underwent a major refurbishment in 2016 and it's appearance was carefully designed with the people we care for in mind. Our bright new reception area is the perfect spot for socialising or taking part in one of our many daily activities. Our beautiful new dining room is a wonderful place to enjoy a three-course home-made lunch and our new bedrooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated.

Wimbledon Beaumont Care Community offers wide range of bespoke care services and facilities that can cater to all sorts of requirements.

address: Langham Road, West Wimbledon, London SW20
detailedDescription:
A superb four bedroom Edwardian family house with a south west facing garden in a much sought after location close to Raynes Park train station.

Location

Langham Road is located in the desirable area of West Wimbledon, known for its leafy residential streets and green environment. Locally are a number of popular restaurants and public houses with a useful Waitrose and Sainsbury’s nearby. Langham Road appeals to commuters as the station is around 600m away, which has a regular service to London Waterloo which takes around 20 minutes. There is also the 57 bus which runs from the end of the road which goes to Wimbledon Underground Station (just over one mile away).

The area is also popular with families as locally are a number of public parks including Cottenham Park and Holland Gardens (both with tennis courts). Within 500m is the popular primary school Hollymount with a number of selective fee paying schools within one mile including Wimbledon Common Prep School and King's College School.

Source of times
Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This attractive four bedroom Edwardian property offers generous living and entertaining space across three floors.

On the ground floor, to the front is an elegant reception room with an attractive fireplace and solid wood flooring. To the rear is a kitchen/dining/living room offering a wonderful open plan living space which benefits from a tremendous amount of natural light due to the southerly aspect. Double doors open to a paved terrace overlooking a private 35ft south west facing garden. A new contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of handle less fitted units and cupboards, integrated appliances and a large island/breakfast bar. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor are two double bedrooms with fitted cupboards, a single bedroom and a family bathroom.

On the top floor, is the principal bedroom with a contemporary en suite bath/shower room and useful eaves storage.

Square Footage: 1591 sq ft

address: Kingston Road, Raynes Park, London SW20
detailedDescription:
A well presented and spacious one bedroom first floor apartment in this lovely Retirement living Plus development conveniently located.

Summary

Liberty House is a purpose built Retirement Living Plus development built by McCarthy & Stone, designed specifically for the over 70s, for those who wish to enjoy independent living but may need some extra care and support. There is an Estate Manager who leads the team and oversees the development. The apartment comprises of a fully fitted kitchen, underfloor heating, fitted and tiled shower room, spacious bedroom and lounge. 24 hour emergency call system.
Communal facilities include a Club lounge where social events and activities take place, a function room and a roof top terrace there are also landscaped gardens. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A most attractive and truly delightful 6 bedroom detached house built in 2004 by the renowned house builder, Lifestyle Projects and located in the sought after Drax Estate, with the added benefit of a self contained 1 bedroom flat.

The house is set back from the road and is approached via a carriage driveway with ample off-street parking. On the ground floor the house comprises: An impressive entrance hall; a spacious kitchen/breakfast room with quality appliances and double doors to the terrace and garden; a large drawing room, with doors opening up onto Juliet balconies overlooking the garden; a dining room; a family room; a study; a cloakroom and access to the integral garage with stacker unit.

The lower ground floor is almost as impressive with a large games/cinema room, gymnasium, utility room, cloakroom and a 1 bedroom 'annexe' flat with separate kitchen and bathroom and accessed both from the hall on the lower ground floor and from the front driveway.

On the first floor is the impressive master bedroom suite complete with dressing area and en-suite bath and shower room. 3 further bedrooms and 2 further bathrooms (one en-suite) complete this floor. On the second floor are 2 large bedrooms, both connected to a 'Jack and Jill' shower room.

To the rear of the house are attractive gardens with mature trees and shrubs and a large entertaining terrace. Drax Avenue is a private road within a peaceful conservation area about a mile from Wimbledon Village where one finds an excellent selection of shops, boutiques, restaurants, cafés and bars in a unique and charming atmosphere. The surrounding area offers many good schools including King's College School for boys, the Study and Wimbledon High School, both for girls, the Rowans and Wimbledon Common preparatory School, several being within walking distance of the house. Recreational facilities are well catered for with golf, tennis and fitness clubs nearby and riding stables in Wimbledon Village. Central London is easily accessible by car or train, using the A3 trunk road, or the mainline stations from where regular trains provide access to Waterloo in 12 – 15 minutes. The Jubilee link at Waterloo now means that Canary Wharf is also within easy reach of Wimbledon.

On the first floor are two large en suite bedrooms, a family bathroom, a separate toilet and two further double bedrooms. The loft space offers a spacious fifth bedroom and bathroom. There is plenty of practical eaves storage as well.

The sunny rear garden faces south-west and is mainly laid to lawn and had a large patio space. The house also benefits from an integrated garage on the ground floor, accessed from the front-drive. The house would make an ideal family home and also offers huge potential for extension and enlargement (subject to planning).

Description
A lovely second floor purpose built flat situated close to Wimbledon Common is offered to the market in excellent condition.
Offering bright and airy accommodation consisting of a large double bedroom, a light and spacious reception room, a galley kitchen, and a bathroom with w/c, the property also has a sunny balcony looking towards Wimbledon Common. Presented in good condition throughout, this leasehold flat would make an ideal first time or investment purchase. An early internal inspection is essential to avoid disappointment.

detailedDescription:
Laurels are delighted to present this lovely one bedroom ground floor apartment in Morden, ideal for investors, first time buyers or commuters alike. Offering ample storage, off-street parking and low service charges, this property is not to be missed.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
No Onward Chain. Three double bedroom flat with lounge-dining room, separate kitchen, 113 year lease, private garden and within 0.4 miles of Wimbledon Park tube station.

Entering the property, the entrance hallway area has cupboard space to one side and access into the lounge-dining room which has built in storage cupboard space and room for sofas and a dining table & chairs.
There is a separate kitchen with cupboard space to three sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven, space and plumbing for a fridge-freezer, washing machine and dishwasher.
There are three double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side. The family bathroom is tiled throughout and has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Outside - The property has it's own private garden area which is paved and surrounded by mature shrubs & trees and there is parking on the road outside.

Lease - 113 years remaining.
Service Charge - £400.00 pa.
Ground Rent - £10.00 pa.

Location

The property is located 0.3 miles from Wimbledon Park Tube Station (District Line) and 0.4 miles from Haydons Road train station which has links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge & Wimbledon.

There are good bus routes nearby with regular buses into Wimbledon and Tooting.

For primary schools, The Priory CofE School is 0.4 miles away, Wimbledon Park School is 0.5 miles away and both Holy Trinity CofE Primary & Bishop Gilpin CofE Primary Schools are within 0.6 miles.
For secondary schools, Ricards Lodge High School is 0.5 miles away and Southfields Academy is within 1 mile.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A handsome detached house situated behind electric gates in a private close ideally located near Wimbledon Common.

Approached via a sweeping driveway, the house offers beautifully presented accommodation over three floors. On the ground floor, the property comprises a generous hall, a reception room, a formal reception room opening to a rear sitting room with bi-folding doors to the garden and a fantastic open-plan kitchen/dining/family room. The impressive kitchen/breakfast room is by leading Italian design company Comprex with top of the range integrated appliances including Siemens teppanyaki grill, wok burner, ancillary halogen hob, five-burner gas hob and warming drawers. There is also a cloakroom, utility room and access to the double garage on this floor.

Upstairs is a generous principal bedroom with a dressing room, an en-suite bathroom with a freestanding bathtub and a further shower room. There is also a second generous bedroom on this floor with an en-suite bathroom. On the second floor, there are two further generous bedrooms, both with en-suite shower rooms, and a useful kitchenette.

The gardens are attractively landscaped with a large paved terrace area to the rear of the house. In addition to the double garage, there is off-street parking.

Further benefits of the property include a biometric security entry system, a remote-controlled fireplace, underfloor heating throughout the bathrooms and air-conditioning to the principal bedroom suite and the kitchen/family room.

Greenoak Way is a popular location, off Calonne Road, within close proximity to Wimbledon Common and the Village. There are some excellent schools in the area (both in the private and public sectors) and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as golf, tennis and fitness clubs. The A3/M25 network provides direct routes into central London as well as both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

detailedDescription:
A truly exceptional three double bedroom 'Blay'. The property has been completely renovated to the highest of standards driven by architectural design that maximises light and space throughout.
The property has been extended by 4 metres on the ground floor to make a truly wonderful kitchen/breakfast/family area with flow-in/flow-out access to the garden and hard wood decking area via bespoke sliding glazed doors.
The kitchen contains a generous central island with integrated breakfast bar, a full length glass splash-back, and integrated quality appliances including a full height fridge, and full height freezer making it great for the family groceries. The vaulted ceiling floods natural light into the kitchen area via 2 large remote controlled and rain sensing velux windows. There is an abundance of kitchen cupboards to prevent unwanted clutter appearing on the worktops, and the cleverly designed hideaway utility area houses a separate washing machine, dryer, and sink, making more clutter disappear when not in use.
Not being overlooked, the upstairs affords unobstructed views over the surrounding mature gardens making it a joy to work from home.
There is new double glazing throughout as well as new electric, gas, and plumbing.
Early viewings really are advised to avoid disappointment of this unique and wonderful home.<br /><br />

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Click Property Management are proud to present this beautiful three bedroom, two bathroom terraced family home, situated on this very desirable and sought after road, moments from Merton Park Primary School.

As you enter the property through the double doors of the porch, you will see a lovely glass door which invites you into an exceptionally spacey hallway with a cloak cupboard underneath the stairs.

The Lounge feels extremely cosy with its open fireplace, soft carpet and large bay windows.

The Dining room boasts an original tiled Victorian fireplace, as well as original floorboards and an original French door which leads out onto the first conservatory which is currently being used as a library.

This two-sided galley kitchen has marble worktop surfaces, a modern upright radiator and double doors which lead out onto the second conservatory.

In between the kitchen and conservatory, there is a w/c and handwash basin. There is also all of the washing machine plumbing ready.

The second conservatory boasts underfloor heating and has a single door which leads out onto the patio area, as well as double doors which lead out onto the 70 foot garden.

As you go upstairs, you reach a wonderfully wide landing.

The master bedroom has an original tiled Victorian fireplace as well as bay windows.

The second bedroom (guest room) also has an original tiled Victorian fireplace, modern upright radiators and an en-suite bathroom (shower, toilet, sink).

The third bedroom is a single sized room and would make a great bedroom for a little one or even an office.

The bathroom has both a tub and shower cubicle.

The 70 foot garden is wonderfully mature with two patios and lawns. It is definitely the highlight of this home.

At the bottom of the garden, there is an alarmed office/workshop. Attached on the side of the office/workshop, is an awning with space to park one vehicle. The rear of the garden can be accessed via double gates which lead onto a lane behind.

Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
The Personal Agent are pleased to present this spacious terrace home offering flexible accommodation, currently laid out for use as a HMO (subject to licence). The property is located just a short distance of local shops and St Helier mainline station, a short bus journey of Morden Underground station, and close to the beautiful Morden Park with it's newly built gym and pool.

The property also benefits from the close proximity of a Harvester restaurant/pub, Merton College, Asda Superstore, St Helier Hospital, local surgery and schools.

The property comprises an entrance hall with access to under stairs storage with a door to; front aspect bedroom with an ensuite shower room, from the entrance hall there is a door to an inner lobby/reception area with a shower room. The kitchen comprises a range of modern eye and base level units with two in built ovens and hobs, with access to the boiler and doors to the garden. There are two further rooms on this floor, one with a shower room.

On the first floor there are two double bedrooms both with a small kitchenette area and ensuite shower rooms. On the second floor there is a large double bedroom with a kitchenette area, space for a lounge area and an ensuite shower room.

Outside to the front there is a driveway with space for off street parking, The rear garden measures approximately 32ft and is paved for low maintenance with a storage unit and a converted double garage which has been divided into 4 rooms with power supply, water supply and connected to waste.

The property is located close to three different parks and within easy walking distance of St. Helier mainline railway station. Morden underground station is just a short distance away.

detailedDescription:
Chain Free - A very spacious two double bedroom flat. Great opportunity for Buy to Let Investors and First time Buyers. Grand Drive is situated in a highly sought-after area of Morden bordering Rayne’s Park, littered with green space at Cannon Hill Common and Morden Park. This location is well serviced by bus routes which link Wimbledon, Sutton, Morden and Raynes Park, which in turn offer train and tube links into Central London. David Lloyd Leisure Centre is appealing for those with active lifestyles, and being in close proximity to the A3 offers excellent opportunity for family trips out.

Calling out all buy to let investors and first time buyers, this property presents an ideal opportunity to purchase this well-presented two double bedroom apartment ideally located close to local shops with a secure communal entry system. Situated on the top floor accommodation comprises, an entrance hall which benefits from a built in cupboard providing storage space. On your right is the reception room filled with natural light thanks to its large windows, towards the back of the property are the two, well-proportioned double bedrooms with the master measuring in excess of 13ft x 10ft. These rooms are serviced by a three piece family bathroom, a contemporary kitchen with fitted appliances and over/under counter units completes the accommodation of this lovely apartment.

Excellent local schools are located close by, state and secondary and the house is perfectly situated for easy access to Central London, the A3 Heathrow & Gatwick, Wimbledon, Kingston town centre and Putney.

detailedDescription:

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A fantastic two bedroom maisonette with private West-facing patio garden, modern kitchen and dining space and stylish, refurbished living room, on Kimble Road, a quiet cul-de-sac close to the River Wandle, parks and nature trail and within short walking distance of Tooting and Colliers Wood.

Set on the first floor the maisonette property has it's own front door before one flight of stairs up. There is a modern, stylish fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and a dining area with space for a good-sized table and chairs. At the front of the property is a large living room that has been stylishly refurbished whilst retaining fireplace and period features, and there is a small bedroom/study. To the rear, in addition to the kitchen diner, is a well presented double bedroom and there is a modern, tiled full bathroom.

From the back door off the kitchen is a staircase down to a private West-facing patio garden which enjoys the sun year-round and there is side-rear secure gate access for bikes and muddy-boots.

The property benefits from having been improved and modernised throughout, from double glazing and central heating and enjoys plenty of natural light. There is also potential to extend into the loft subject to Freeholder, and the usual planning consents.

Kimble Road is a quiet, secluded, residential cul-de-sac in a fantastic location within short walking distance of Haydons Road mainline station into and out of London, and both Tooting Broadway and Colliers Wood tube stations on the Northern Line into the City of London. The shops, supermarkets and cafes of Colliers Wood and Tooting are also close by, and Wimbledon is within walking distance as is St. George's Hospital and Medical School.

The Wandle River and Meadow Nature Park are just around the corner, perfect for bike rides or walks along the river, perhaps to Dean City Farm or to Merton Abbey Mills for a drink or meal.

Park avenue is located just off the Streatham road, allowing access to good transport links, with buses running along Streatham Road. Tooting train station is a mere 0.7 miles from your door, you literally cross over Streatham road and walk to the end of Ashbourne road, the station is just a few minutes further to walk. For those who like to keep fit Figges Marsh outdoor gym is within the same distance from your door and the green is ideal for a morning jog.

The condition of the property is a credit to the present owners and with the added benefit of off road parking to the front this property comes highly recommended. Call now to secure your viewing!

detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom extended ground floor flat with open plan kitchen-living room, private rear garden, en-suite shower room, share of freehold and within 0.1 miles of Wimbledon Chase train station making this ideal for first time buyers and young families.

The property has it's own private entrance leading into the hallway which has cupboard space to one side. The property has been extended to the rear and has a newly fitted kitchen-living room area. The kitchen has cupboard space to three sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven, dishwasher, washing machine and fridge-freezer. There is space for a dining table & chairs and sofas with the patio doors leading out to the rear garden.

There are two double bedrooms, the master bedroom has space for wardrobes to one side and access to an en-suite shower room with walk-in shower, w/c, hand basin and towel rail.
The second double bedroom is to the front of the property and has a feature fireplace to one side and bay window to the front.
There is also a family bathroom that has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Outside - The property has it's own private rear garden mostly laid to lawn surrounded by mature shrubs & trees with space.

Share of Freehold.

Location

The property is located 0.1 miles from Wimbledon Chase train station which has links into Wimbledon, London Bridge & Mitcham Junction.
Raynes Park train station is within 0.6 miles away and has links into London Waterloo & Clapham Junction.

For primary schools, both Wimbledon Chase Primary School & Joseph Hood Primary School are within 0.2 miles.
For secondary schools, Rutlish School is 0.4 miles away and Ursuline High School Wimbledon is within 0.5 miles.

The property well located for local amenities and there are links into Wimbledon.

detailedDescription:
This well-appointed modern detached family house is found to the rear of a sought after development situated between Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Town. The property benefits from excellent family accommodation on three levels.
The ground floor provides a spacious hall heading to two bedrooms, a shower room and utility room. There is also a garage at this level. The first floor has a good size reception room with wooden floors and patio doors opening to a terrace.
There is also a kitchen /dining/family room with fine views over Wimbledon.
The top floor has the principal bedroom with en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Outside

Situation
Pine Grove is a sought-after location conveniently situated for easy access to the fashionable shops, bars and restaurants of Wimbledon Village. Nearby Wimbledon Town provides further shopping and recreational facilities as well as a mainline and district line station ( 0.7 of a mile ). The property is also extremely well located for a number of excellent schools.

address: Somerset House, Somerset Road, London SW19
detailedDescription:
A well-presented light and spacious 2 bedroom apartment on the eighth floor of an award winning development, adjoining the All England Lawn Tennis Club. The apartment enjoys stunning panoramic views and the current owners have completely refurbished the property to a high standard and it presents exceptionally well. A spacious hallway, with a laundry area and excellent storage, leads to a generous double aspect lounge/dining room with oak-floor that runs through to the bedrooms as well. The open plan kitchen offers a superb range of Mobalpa units with quartz worktops and integrated appliances. The main bedroom has a range of fitted wardrobes and a modern en-suite bathroom. There is a generous second bedroom that also has built-in wardrobes. A well-appointed shower room completes the accommodation.

Outside
The development offers attractive communal landscaped gardens of 4 acres and a professionally staffed estate office. The property benefits from an underground parking space and storage and there is additional outside parking too.

Situation
The property lies between Wimbledon Common and Wimbledon Park. Nearby Wimbledon Village has a choice of exclusive boutiques, bars and restaurants, while Wimbledon Town has a wider selection of high street stores, a District Line underground station and mainline station with overland services to Waterloo. Located within the immediate vicinity are some of the Country's best schools for all ages, sporting recreational facilities, including tennis, squash, sailing, riding and hockey.

Additional Information
This property is to be sold as share of freehold with a background lease which was granted on the 1st January 1987 for 999 years. The vendor has advised that the present serivce charge is £1,506.82 per quarter and the annual ground rent is £30.

detailedDescription:
***vendors comments*** "Sunnymead Avenue has been our family home for over 20 years. It has good transport links to both Croydon and central London, as well as having three main line stations within a mile: Streatham Common, Norbury and Mitcham Eastfield.

The entrance of the property opens onto a large hallway. The living room has double French doors which open into the dining area of the kitchen, great for entertaining and hosting family & friends. The kitchen providing ample space for an integrated washing machine and tumble dryer.

Double patio doors lead from the kitchen to the garden which also has a patio area. The garden boasts both apple and quince trees. There is a garage at the end of the garden which is accessed via a side road via Rowan Road or Kingsmead Avenue.

The property consists of two double bedrooms; the front facing being the master bedroom, fitted with floor to ceiling wardrobes. The well proportioned third bedroom is currently used as an office.

We have nice neighbours who are all very friendly and helpful, providing a great community feel.

We fell in love with this house from the moment we saw it and have not regretted one moment living here. The reason we are selling is it's time for a new beginning in something a bit smaller now our children are grown up"

detailedDescription:
***vendors comments*** "I first purchased this flat in 2000. My sister had moved onto Lowry Crescent the year before and my parents were so happy that we were able to both purchase share of freehold flats so near to each other. They were reassured that we would be safe on such a pretty, tree lined, well lit, off road private estate with green spaces as well as being well maintained throughout.

The area was and still is to this day, quiet and peaceful with great neighbours. An added bonus is the allocated parking space that comes with the flat, provided in the car park outside the block. The location is great as you can easily access buses taking you into Colliers Wood or Tooting after a short walk to the bus stop outside the development.

My sister and I both bought properties near each other again in 2003 and the flat was sold to a family member as an investment property. I was then lucky enough to be able to repurchase the flat back in 2008 and returned having fallen in love with it again. I moved back in after completely renovating the kitchen and bathroom as I was due to marry and this flat became our first marital home.

The flat was freshly decorated in early 2021 and we had new UPVC doubled glazed windows installed throughout 5yrs ago.

Being share of freehold ensures there is a lot of control regarding the overall costs relating to the external building and ground maintenance costs. There is full transparency regarding how our very reasonable service charge is spent every year and the reserve fund. There’s a lot involvement in choosing any new cleaning and maintenance contractors and any rear issues arising are quickly resolved as the external areas of the flats are managed by the residents association and the contracted Management company are easily contactable. We are kept well informed continuously.

The flats were fully externally decorated late last year after we reviewed the bids received for the work; ensuring the estate remained well presented. This year, we have plans to extend the lease as we are the freeholders to a 999 year lease with only legal fees to pay of less than £1000 while still maintaining share of freehold status. The communal areas are cleaned weekly with the grounds and car parks well maintained monthly.

It was and still is the ideal flat for commuting with excellent transport links: 5-10mins away from Colliers Wood, bus stop is 2 mins away or 10mins if you prefer to walk. Well connected with a central bus stop hub in Mitcham Town Centre with buses. Tram Stops are also a 10-15 walk away taking you into Wimbledon Mainline Station or West/East Croydon within 20mins, as well as Mitcham East fields Train Station getting you into Clapham Junction Mainline Station and Victoria in under 20 mins after a short bus ride or 20mins walk.

The Flat is also well serviced with excellent amenities nearby. We have great shopping in Mitcham Town Centre as well as an Asda. In Colliers Wood there is The Savercentre with M+S, Sainsbury’s, Morrisons, Tandem Shopping Centre providing Next, Sports Direct, tk Maxx, WHSmith and Boots. There are 2 Lidl's and Priory Retail Park with Aldi, pc World and Dunelm all within a short walking distance. There is also a doctors surgery across the road. Several Gyms including Nuffield Gym with Jacuzzi Pool, swimming pool and Sauna as well as several other gyms offering 24/7 access.

Merton Abbey Mills is a short walk away which has great shopping, pubs, bars and restaurants to explore and enjoy as well as great Summer outdoor concerts. Merton Abbey Mills is a place of historical significance that is well worth a look around with bespoke boutique shopping, Children’s Theatre and Live Music Events including Outdoor Jazz in the long summer nights.

We are also spoiled with green open spaces with National Trust Morden Hall Park a short walk away as well as several Parks and open spaces that are safe and clean with sports Courts for those interested in outdoor exercise.

We have lived in in this lovely flat for over 10yrs and we have had many happy years here as a couple. We now need more space as we plan to extend our family soon and will miss our first home together immensely. It’s a lovely, deceptively spacious flat in fantastic surroundings: I love stepping out at night and seeing all the well-lit green spaces and properties twinkling with their communal external lights lighting the path and leading out to the main road.

We will miss our first home together, especially returning home after a long day at work and we are sure it will make a wonderful home for the new owners. Book a visit and see for yourself, you may not want to leave, like us!"

detailedDescription: Brinkley's Estate Agents are delighted to offer this beautiful three-bedroom Victorian maisonette located on the periphery of the South Park Gardens area and with easy access to Wimbledon town centre. This split-level property, recently renovated and extended, offers a fully fitted kitchen with ample storage, a large double bedroom and a good size reception room with original dark stained wooden flooring. A contrasting white painted staircase lightened by a skylight leads to a second double bedroom and recently refurbished bathroom. The tastefully extended loft presents a very spacious en-suite master bedroom with walk in shower, a Juliet glass balcony, double velux windows and eaves storage. Further benefits include an over 50-foot south facing private rear garden, off street parking, excellent local school catchments, easy access to local amenities and short distance to Wimbledon train station. Please call our Wimbledon Hill office on for more information and to arrange a viewing. Open 7 days a week. Viewings Mon- Fri 8-8, Weekends 9-6.

address: Burghley House, Somerset Road, London SW19
detailedDescription:
The flat is located on the third floor, and has an incredible view. The apartment has been modernised to an exceptional standard. There is a very good sized reception room with doors leading to a balcony. A beautiful luxury kitchen has been fitted with Island. The master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and there is a further good sized bedroom and shower room.

Outside
The development offers attractive communal landscaped gardens of 4 acres and a professionally staffed estate office. There is an allocated parking space in the underground car park as well as additonal unallocated parking spaces within the communal areas.

Situation
The development is situated overlooking the All England Lawn Tennis Club and is well placed for access to the Common and Wimbledon Village with its interesting selection of specialist shops, cafes and restaurants. There are stations at Southfields and in Wimbledon Town and easy access onto the A3 via Wimbledon Parkside. The apartment is also in a good position for both Wimbledon Common and Wimbledon Park with its extensive recreational facilities.

Additional Information
This property is to be sold with a lease which was granted in January 1987 for 999 years. The vendor has advised that the annual service charge is £5,259.34 which includes the water rates, gas central heating and ground rent.

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious two bedroom flat in a well maintained private development set back from Victoria Drive.

Location

Victoria Drive has good bus links to Clapham, Richmond, Putney and Wimbledon. Wimbledon Common is just 800 metres away and 600 metres from the All England Club. The village centres of Wimbledon and Southfields are both within one mile with Southfields Underground station around 1500m away and provides a regular link (District Line) to central London. Wimbledon Common with its 1,200 acres of open space is around 400m away.

Source of distances Google Pedometer

Description

The property is approached via a well maintained communal entrance with security phone. The flat is located on the second floor and opens into a spacious hallway with useful fitted storage.

The generous reception room receives a tremendous amount of natural light. The kitchen offers a good range of fitted units with integrated appliances.

There are two large double bedrooms, one with fitted wardrobes. Alongside is a contemporary bathroom featuring a corner bath.

The property also benefits from extensive communal gardens and a garage.

address: The Holt, London Road, Morden SM4
detailedDescription:
Two bedroom, purpose-built, second-floor flat for sale in Central Morden, SM4, just minutes away from the Underground Station.

Previously tenanted, the flat has neutral painted walls and plain carpet throughout, however any purchaser would have the benefit of being able to put their own stamp on the property.

Unlike many new-builds this property has a separate kitchen and living room meaning after a long day's work you can relax without having to look at the washing up! Additionally the two bedrooms are also separate, meaning night owls and morning larks won't disturb one another.

The kitchen, has a tiled floor and mosaic-tile splash backs. The bathroom is a simple clean, white suite.

Located in The Holt development on London Road, less than 10 mins walk from Morden Underground Station, this flat is ideal for first time buyers, or as a rental investment with its close proximity to local amenities and fantastic transport links.

This property is exclusive to Turners and has no onward chain so call and book an appointment to view as soon as possible.

address: Roskeen Court, 45 Arterberry Road, London SW20
detailedDescription:
An excellent bright and spacious ground floor flat
situated in a delightful gated development off Ridgway. The flat offers two bedrooms, two shower/bathrooms, an open-plan kitchen/reception room, garage and visitors parking. The entrance hallway leads to the kitchen/reception room which offers a good range of units with integrated appliances and a breakfast bar. The master bedroom features double doors to the communal garden, an en-suite bathroom and storage. The second bedroom, with storage, also provides double doors to the garden.

Outside
The development is approached from Arterberry Road via remote controlled gates along a driveway which leads to the private garage. The development is set around attractively landscaped and mature gardens. Some visitors parking spaces are available.

Situation
Roskeen Court is a modern purpose-built development on the corner of Ridgway and Arterberry Road and provides good access to Wimbledon Village with its range of exclusive bars, restaurants and boutiques. The area is well regarded for its excellent schooling in both the state and private sectors. Wimbledon Station provides mainline and district line services to central London. Other local stations include Raynes Park and Wimbledon Chase as well as the Dundonald Road Tram Stop.

Additional Information
The property has an underlying lease of 999 years which was granted in November 1990. The
sevice charge is circa £200 p.c.m.

detailedDescription:
Description First floor two bedroom flat with off street parking available for sale by conditional auction
The property is currently let on an AST (periodic) producing £14,400 per annum
Lease length: 150 years from 28/10/2010
Ground rent: £85pa
Service charge: £650 per 6 months

Further information and legal pack can be found on the sdl auction website


Auction method The auction for this property be conducted online through our online-bidding platform. This is a
"Timed Auction", so there are will no other lots being sold alongside this property.
The timeslot for the auction is displayed on sdl Auctions' website. To view this, search for the
property via their website, then click onto the property to view the property details. The time
remaining to bid, and end date of the auction, is displayed on the page.
You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also
provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be
processed.
When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to sdl Auctions' Buyers Terms (England &
Wales) which are available to read on sdl Auctions' website

Auction type - Conditional with Reservation Fee If you are the highest bidder when the auction for the property comes to an end, you will enter into
a reservation agreement with the seller. You must then pay the applicable reservation fee. You will
then have 40 business days within which to exchange contracts and complete the sale, unless the
Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack specify a different time limit. If you fail to
do so, you may lose your reservation fee. During the 40-business day reservation period, the seller is
not able to accept other offers.

Auction fees The following non-refundable fees apply:
• Reservation Fee- payable immediately when the auction ends. This is calculated as a percentage of
the actual purchase price of the property. Either:
(a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000
(b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000
The Reservation Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Reservation Fee
does not contribute to the purchase price.
There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view
within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional
fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of sdl Auctions, and will be in
addition to any fees payable to us. Sdl Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special
Conditions of Sale.

Deposit Deposit
This property is listed under the Conditional with Reservation Fee sale method, therefore the
deposit will be payable on exchange of contracts and executed via the solicitors. The amount to be
paid will be listed in the Special Conditions of Sale.

Payment method When you register to bid, you will be prompted to provide your payment details to sdl Auctions. In
the event that you are the winning bidder, your card will automatically be charged a proportion of
the Reservation Fee. The payment will be calculated based on the guide price of the property, in line
with the fee scale described above. Where the actual purchase price is higher than the guide price,
you will be required to pay the difference immediately after the end of the auction, which can be
paid by debit card or bank transfer. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted.
Example: You win the bid on a property with a guide price of £150,000, but the actual purchase price
is £170,000. At this point your bid is successful you will be charged as follows:
• Reservation fee of £7,200 – calculated as 4.8% of guide price- this will be charged immediately
after the auction if you are the winning bidder.
As the actual purchase price amounted to £170,000, after the auction, you will be required to pay
the following additional amounts on top of the initial payment:
• £960 for Reservation Fee shortfall (£8160 due as 4.8% of actual purchase price)

legal pack Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal
documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special
Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate.
To view the legal pack, first search for the property on sdl Auctions' website, and click onto the
property to view the property details. There will be a sub-heading "Legal Documents". Underneath
this, you will be prompted to "Log in to view the legal documents". Follow this link, you will then be
directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents.
The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most
recent version of the legal pack. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the
legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not
be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale.
It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and
raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.

Special conditions of sale The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that
are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of sdl Auctions' terms and conditions.
The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at
the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to
read in the legal pack.

Description
A spacious and high specification townhouse perfectly situated on the borders of Southfields, Putney and Wimbledon. Comprising of bright and airy accommodation spread over three floors of this newly constructed property, the property benefits from plenty of natural light and lovely green views over the gardens. On the ground floor there is a large family kitchen dining space leading onto the easy to maintain rear garden, a large downstairs w/c and plenty of storage. The first floor has a large reception space with a Juliet balcony, a high specification family bathroom, and a large double bedroom with built in wardrobes. The internal accommodation is completed on the second floor with two further double bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower room. Helena Close is situated moments from Wimbledon Common, and is also within easy reach of some of the areas best Primary and Secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
This modern contemporary house has been recently constructed and finished to the highest specification throughout. Benefitting from a large south-facing garden with views of the Surrey Hills and set in a quiet gated mews hidden off the street.

The ground floor comprises a large entrance hallway off which is the study and a large formal drawing room and bar area that has bi-folding glass doors which open to a terrace.
On the lower ground floor is a spacious kitchen/breakfast/family room with utility room bedroom/playroom and a guest bedroom suite with shower.

On the first floor is a grand principal bedroom suite with built-in cupboards and ensuite shower room and a second bedroom with an en-suite bathroom. The top floor has two further large bedrooms and separate family bathroom.

At the rear is a large 75' south facing garden with stunning southerly views towards the Surrey Hills while at the front is off-street parking.

Arterberry Road is a popular road with incoming purchasers being a short distance from Wimbledon Village and the Common. There are some excellent schools in the area (both in the Private and Public sectors) and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as golf, tennis and fitness clubs. The A3 is closeby and provides a direct route into central London and also connects to the M25 network for both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

title: 4 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
This spacious modern house offers over 3,500 sq ft (327 sq m) of living space and has been finished to a high specification throughout with stunning views towards the Surrey Hills. The house is located in a quiet, private gated mews, which is a short walk to Wimbledon Common and benefits from a large southerly facing garden.

The property benefits from high-quality finishes and materials such as handmade bricks, natural stone and green roof (as advised by the developer) along with Miele and Bora kitchen appliances, Sonos zoned sound systems and under-floor heating.

On the ground floor, the property comprises a spacious reception room with bi-folding doors to the terrace that overlooks the rear garden and a study with built-in shelving. There is also a bedroom with an en-suite shower room and a guest cloakroom on this floor. Downstairs on the lower ground floor, there is a further bedroom with an en-suite shower room, a media room/gym, a useful utility room and a further cloakroom. The impressive kitchen/reception room has bi-folding doors to the garden making this an ideal entertaining space. The kitchen has a range of fitted units with integrated high-quality appliances and a central island with a wine fridge and additional storage.

Occupying the entire first floor is the principal bedroom suite with a dressing area, an en-suite bathroom and doors opening out onto a balcony. On the second floor are two further double bedrooms, one of which has doors to a Juliet balcony, and a family bathroom.

To the front of the property there is off-street parking and to the rear is a landscaped garden with a patio area and built-in barbeque.

Arterberry Road is a popular road with incoming purchasers being a short distance from Wimbledon Village and the Common. There are some excellent schools in the area (both in the Private and Public sectors) and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as golf, tennis and fitness clubs. The A3 is closeby and provides a direct route into central London and also connects to the M25 network for both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

address: Alwyne Mansions, Alwyne Road, Wimbledon, London SW19
detailedDescription:
A generous three bedroom ground floor flat located on a much sought after road in Wimbledon town.

Location

Alwyne Road is a quiet residential road located just off Wimbledon Hill. The property is ideally situated a short walk from each of Wimbledon Village, Wimbledon town centre and Wimbledon Railway Station, providing a plethora of leisure and retail activities as well as convenient transport links. Several nurseries and schools are located within close proximity. The property is within the Bishop Gilpin catchment area.

Wimbledon Village is well known for its pretty boutiques, restaurants and public houses, as well as the wonderful open space of Wimbledon Common. Wimbledon town centre offers excellent day-to-day shopping facilities, with two department stores, various high street retailers and supermarkets. Wimbledon Railway Station offers a fast and regular link to central London with overground services taking 15-18 minutes to Waterloo and District Line services to the West End.

Sources of times:
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This generous garden flat opens into a deep hallway with attractive wooden flooring which extends across the reception room and into the bedrooms.

A generous bay fronted reception room is located to the front with an attractive fireplace and fitted cabinetry with useful display shelving. The contemporary kitchen/ dining space is located to the rear with French doors to the extensive communal gardens. The shaker style kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with fully integrated appliances.

There are three double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes, one is currently used as a a study. There is a family bathroom with twin sinks and a separate guest cloakroom/shower room.

Square Footage: 980 sq ft

detailedDescription:
An exceptional three bedroom penthouse apartment with two parking space and wonderful views across Wimbledon.

Location

Arterberry Road is a popular residential road in between Wimbledon Village and West Wimbledon. The property is approximately 700 metres from Wimbledon Common which has over 1,200 acres and perfect for walking, riding, cycling and golf.

The property is approximately 1,300 metres from the shops and bars of Wimbledon Village and 900 metres from Raynes Park railway station which has a regular overground link to Waterloo (approximately 21 minutes).

Buses also run from both Ridgway and Worple Road to Wimbledon Station with its overground and underground district lines.

The large reception/dining room has a dual aspect with bay windows on two sides providing good natural light. The generous principal bedroom suite has well designed fitted wardrobes and a luxurious en suite shower room. There are two further double bedrooms one with a stylish en suite bathroom and a separate guest cloakroom. There is also extensive eaves storage space.

detailedDescription:
A Spacious One Bedroom Flat set over 2 floors with additional loft room, in this attractive period terraced building on Kohat Road, SW19, close to Haydons Road Station and short walking distance to central Wimbledon. Available with the complete Freehold to the building, there is clear potential to develop (subject to the usual consents) into a 2 bedroom property and planning permission was previously obtained (plans viewable here).

The split-level property is in good condition and benefits from a light and airy reception space with open plan kitchen, a modern bathroom with bath and shower and a good-sized master bedroom with built in wardrobes. On the second floor there is a loft room currently being used as a study with a Velux window and ample storage into the eaves. Subject to the usual consents there is potential to put in a dormer and reconfigure the access to create a second bedroom and possibly ensuite.

Planning Permission was previously obtained for a mansard roof extension so there is clear precedent.

Kohat Road is a desirable and quiet residential road close to Haydons Road mainline station and within walking distance of central Wimbledon, Wimbledon Park and Colliers Wood/Tooting. There are local supermarkets and convenience stores close by on Haydons Road and Plough Lane and the River Wandle has a meadow nature park and tow path for walks and cycling.

A perfect flat for a first time buyer, professional couple, as a London pied a terre or as a Buy to Let investment.

address: Lantern Court, 99 Worple Road, London SW20
detailedDescription:
A delightful bright and spacious first floor apartment, beautifully presented with a welcoming feel. Accommodation is well thought through with a good sized and modern kitchen. There is wonderful reception room to the front with an attractive floor to ceiling window, which fills the room with a great deal of natural light. The apartment has a very well-proportioned main bedroom, with en-suite, and substantial built-in wardrobes. A second bedroom and and second guest bathrom completes the accomodation. The property benefits from a communal garden and secure underground parking with parking for visitors.

Situation
The apartment is located on the corner of The Downs (a popular residential road off Ridgway) and Worple Road. Wimbledon Common is approximately one third of a mile away and Wimbledon Village, which borders the Common, has an attractive High Street lined with an exclusive range of boutiques bars and restaurants. Wimbledon Town has a wider range of amenities with an excellent shopping centre, as well as a mainline and district line station with services to Waterloo and beyond. Raynes Park station is also within walking distance.

Additional Information
The property is being sold with a lease of 125 years which was granted in March 1988. The vendor has advised that the annual service charge is £3,700 and the annual ground rent is £300.
