detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented house has been extended and fully modernised to a very high standard and offers all the latest modern home technology whilst retaining the character and charm of the period.

Set back from the road behind electric gates, the house briefly comprises a generous entrance hall leading to a reception room with a feature fireplace, a second reception room that leads through to the dining/reception room and the modern kitchen/breakfast room. There is wonderful entertaining space and bi-folding doors open out to the beautiful garden with terrace area. A study, utility room and gym complete this floor, with a cinema room on the lower ground floor.

On the first floor is the spacious principal bedroom with a dressing room and en-suite bathroom, and two further double bedrooms with en-suite shower rooms. The top floor comprises three good-sized bedrooms, two of which have en-suite bathrooms, and useful eaves storage.

The property further benefits a private garden mainly laid to lawn with flower and shrub borders, a detached garage and off-street parking.

Situated in a highly convenient location in the Village, the house is ideally placed within easy walking distance of all the area's best schools such as King's College School, Wimbledon Common Preparatory School, Wimbledon High School, as well as a wide variety of recreational facilities including golf clubs, riding stables, tennis and fitness clubs. The house is also well placed for walking to the main town from which there are fast and frequent mainline and underground train services to central London and beyond.

detailedDescription:
A generously sized, period, 3 bedroom property located within close proximity to Wimbledon Common.

Overview

Comprising 1,684 sq ft of lateral living space, the apartment is a deceptively large 3 bedroom property in the heart of Wimbledon Village.

The entrance hall leads to an impressive reception room. As an ideal place to unwind or entertain in, the room is framed by a stunning circular bay window allowing plenty of natural light to fill the space. Herringbone wooden flooring coupled with high ceilings continue throughout the property giving an open plan feel.

The three double bedrooms each contain ample built-in storage and have been tastefully decorated, while retaining the charm of the building's characteristics within the decorative flourishes on the walls and ceilings.

Sleek marble worktops can be found in the kitchen diner, which features cabinetry units and a central island.

This touch of luxury continues into the property's two bathrooms, with the main family bathroom also containing marble pattern flooring and wall panelling. A stand-alone bathtub and vanity unit with wall mounted taps complete the bathroom, giving a contemporary look to the room.

The internal living space also features a utility room providing additional storage, and a study that is suitable for home office use.

The private external grounds boast a secluded seating area complete with decking, making it ideal for outdoor relaxation or dining.

Location

Ridgway is a residential street in South West London. The property is a 10 minute walk to both Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon town centre with an abundance of restaurants, pubs and boutique shops within easy reach. There are various golf and tennis clubs, including the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, home to the world famous Wimbledon Tennis Tournament.

As a leafy green area of the capital, Wimbledon offers plenty of opportunities to partake in outdoor pursuits. Wimbledon Common and Cannizaro Park are a few minutes walk from the property and offer walking, cycling, riding and golf, as well as the nearby Richmond Park with 2,500 acres of parkland.

Merton ranks within the top 6 safest areas to live in London, with nearby Richmond also scooping the top spot. Wimbledon is known for its outstanding schools, and the property is a 2 minute walk to the entrance of Kings College Wimbledon.

Transport

Wimbledon Station located 1 mile from the property has frequent services into London Waterloo, as well as the South East, operating both Southwestern and Thameslink services, as well as the London Underground District Line, offering easy connectivity into central London.

The A3 and M25 are within a short drive of the property, with Heathrow Airport around 30 minutes' drive away.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Situated within a popular modern development close to a vibrant town centre this superb one double bedroom apartment offers a potential buyer a great first time purchase or rental investment.

As you enter the apartment via a secure communal hallway with entry phone system and the benefit of a lift you are greeted with a larger than average entrance hall with plenty of space for storage of shoes and coats and other household essentials. Off the hallway you will find a very bright and spacious double bedroom which looks over the well maintained communal grounds and features fitted wardrobes. The modern and well appointed bathroom is generously sized and perfect for modern living. The real jewel in the crown is the modern open plan kitchen / reception which is incredibly spacious and ideal for those who like to entertain. The modern kitchen features all of the mod-cons one would expect from a modern apartment and great for the budding chef.

In addition to this, there is an allocated parking space for the flat and bike storage.

This is a wonderful flat which needs to be viewed to be truly appreciated, early viewing is recommended.

Location

Located in South West London you will find this beautiful apartment a short walking distance from Raynes Park and Wimbledon Chase. This fantastic location offers shops, cafes, restaurants and plenty of local green spaces.

Transport links aplenty; you are situated in between a number of train stations offering very frequent trains including Wimbledon (Rail, District Line Tube, Thameslink, Tram), Raynes Park (Rail) with its direct links into London Waterloo (approx 25 mins) and Wimbledon Chase (Thameslink) as well as bus routes along Worple Road and Kingston Road.

The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away.

SW20 and SW19 are both affluent and vibrant areas of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser. The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms, shops and restaurants close by including both Wimbledon and Raynes Park town centres as well as Wimbledon Village.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

address: Fielding House, Cairns Avenue, Streatham SW16
detailedDescription:
Laurels are pleased to present to the market this modern one bedroom ground floor apartment. This fantastic property is located on a modern and sought-after development which is surrounded by an abundance of outdoor space. The property is within close proximity to both Streatham Common and Mitcham Eastfields stations (Zone 3-London Victoria approx 20 minutes) and has a number of local bus routes that stop just outside the development, giving you excellent transport links into Central London.

As you enter the property you are greeted by a welcoming entrance hallway which flows through to the spacious double bedroom with plenty of natural light and views into the communal garden. From the bedroom you are guided through to the spacious open plan living/dining area with adjoining kitchen, this is fitted with modern appliances and benefits from ample storage. The apartment is completed with a contemporary family bathroom.

Further benefits of this award winning eco-friendly property includes being under NHBC warranty, solar panels which reduces monthly outgoings, close to outstanding local schools (St. James the Great) and has a fantastic community feel. The wonderful property has visitor parking available, this home is perfect for both commuters and first time buyers alike.

detailedDescription:
Open day - 1OTH July.
The ultimate in contemporary living…….This stunning four bedroom, two washroom family home has undergone a thorough refurbishment program during the current vendors long and cherished ownership, including impressive and carefully considered extensions to the rear of the ground floor which now provides the highly desirable open plan living as well as the loft providing a delightful principal suite. Incorporating not only exceptional workmanship and design but the very best high end quality products which as a result now provides beautifully presented bright, airy, and spacious accommodation, comprising a lounge, open plan family room/kitchen/breakfast room/dining room and a cloakroom to the ground floor, three bedrooms and a family bathroom to the first floor and the principal suite comprising of bedroom with Juliet balcony and an en suite shower room to the second floor. Externally the property benefits from off street parking to the front for 2 cars and a private rear garden with a brick built garage to the rear. Located in the ever popular ‘Lower Morden’ area of Morden, midway between Morden and Cheam town centres boasting a host of transport links, amenities and popular schools including Glenthorne High school rated outstanding by Ofsted. In addition, the newly built Morden leisure centre as well as many more amenities and services in Morden Town Centre together with the vast recreational spaces of the nearby National Trust's Morden Hall Park, Morden Park and Nonsuch Park providing a unique blend of convenience with peace and tranquillity. An internal viewing is highly recommended to avoid almost certain disappointment of missing out on the opportunity of being the new owners of this truly stunning home.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Laurels are absolutely thrilled to present to the market this superb two double bedroom split-level conversion property in the very heart of Wimbledon. Just moments from everything this brilliant town has to offer, the property boasts fantastic local amenities with bars, cafes and restaurants all just moments away as well as excellent transport links with Wimbledon Train Station (Zone 3) less than 0.3 miles from the property.

Upon entry to the property via your own front door you are greeted welcomingly into the spacious kitchen & diner. This room offers an eating area, integrated appliances, high ceilings and direct access via French doors to the private terrace and garden. The terrace is ideal to enjoy the sun and leads downstairs to the private garden, both with a south-facing aspect, the perfect space to entertain. Further internal accommodation includes two double bedrooms, both with built-in wardrobes and ample light, as well as a recently refurbished family bathroom with underfloor heating. Finally, this wonderful home is finished off on the top floor with a superb reception room, with high ceilings, full fitted blinds, ample storage and beautiful flooring.

Further benefits of this property include on-street permit parking, close proximity to high street, private garden and terrace, immaculate condition throughout and much more. Furthermore the property is located within the catchment area of a number of highly sought-after school including Dundonald Primary School (Ofsted: Outstanding). Early viewings are highly recommended so as not to miss out and can be accommodated seven days a week including Bank Holidays!
EPC to follow

address: Convent Mews, Edge Hill, Wimbledon, London SW19
detailedDescription:
The beautifully finished modern townhouse benefits from exceptional family space and is conveniently located for the Village, the Common and Kings College School.

Located in a private securely gated mews, on the ground floor this house comprises an entrance hall; a formal drawing room overlooking and accessing the garden; a dining room with a 'dumb waiter' lift from the kitchen below; and a cloakroom.

On the lower ground floor is the exceptionally bright and spacious kitchen/breakfast/family room with bi-folding doors leading out onto the terrace. In addition, there is a fully fitted cinema room, a gym, a sauna, a playroom and a shower room on this floor.

On the first floor is the stunning principal bedroom suite, complete with a dressing room and en-suite bathroom with a separate shower. To complete this floor there are two further bedrooms and a family bathroom.

On the second floor, there are two further bedrooms, both with en-suite shower rooms. The house includes underfloor heating in the bathrooms and air-conditioning throughout.

To the rear of the house is a lovely south-westerly facing garden and to the front there is off-street parking and a garage.

Edge Hill is a popular location with incoming purchasers being so convenient for both the Village, Town Centre and stations. There are many excellent local schools in the area both in the State and Private Sectors (including King College just along Ridgway) and a variety of leisure facilities including Golf Courses, Tennis Clubs and Health Clubs. Heathrow and Gatwick Airports are both accessible via the A3 and M25 motorways.

address: Marian Lodge, 5 The Downs, London SW20
detailedDescription:
This unique lateral apartment offers over 2,000 sqft of living space with three bedrooms, three receptions rooms, four bathrooms and three balconies.

Located on the second floor of this modern development, the property provides spacious, bright living accommodation. And benefits from secure underground parking.

The apartment is comprised of three spacious bedroom suites all with built-in cupboards, en suites and two with private balconies. A large main reception room with a balcony, a study and a second reception/TV room. Additionally, there is a separate kitchen with granite worktops and integrated appliances and a separate guest bathroom. The property is ideally suited for home working due to the overall layout and amount of living space or it can be used as a four or five bedroom property.

The property further benefits from two underground parking spaces, communal gardens, access to the communal gym and 2 storage lockers.

The property was originally two flats that have been combined to create a large single dwelling. However, the property could be separated into two two-bedroom properties of around 1,000 sq. Ft each.

The Downs is a short distance to Wimbledon Common, the Village and Wimbledon mainline train station and underground train station (District Line). There are many good schools in the area, both in the private and public sector and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as tennis and golf clubs. The A3 is close by with its direct access into central London and links to the M25 network to both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports.

detailedDescription:
Warden assisted - over 55s only!
A spacious and well maintained, one bedroom, second floor retirement apartment offered to the market with no onward chain. The property is situated in a popular location in Mitcham close to the cricket green.
The property comprises a spacious living room leading through to a semi open-plan fitted kitchen, a double bedroom and wet-room style shower room. Other features include a lift service, communal gardens and residents parking.
The development also has the added benefit of a communal lounge with regular events for the residents scheduled during the week.
The property comes with a 70% share of the ownership with the remaining 30% being retained by Optivo Housing Association.

detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • *Guide Price £315,000 - £340,000*
  • Open Plan Living Space
  • Modern Kitchen & Bathroom
  • Double Bedroom with Fitted Wardrobes
  • Well Maintained Communal Gardens
  • Lift Access to All Floors
  • Close to Amenities & Transport Links
  • Walking Distance to Wimbledon Common
  • Ideal for First Time Buyers & Investors

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this One Bedroom First Floor Flat – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £315,000 - £340,000*

internal:
Communal Hall - The grand staircase or the lift gives access to the first floor.
Entrance Hallway - The entrance door opens to the hall, with doors to the lounge/kitchen/diner, the bedroom and the bathroom.
Lounge/Kitchen/Diner - Open plan living space with a lounge area, a bay window with space for dining furniture, and a modern fitted kitchen. The kitchen is fitted with a range of wall and base units with worktops over including a breakfast bar. Integrated appliances including an electric induction hob and an overhead extractor hood.
Bathroom - Comprising a wall-fitted Wc, a wash hand basin and a curved bath with an overhead shower.
Bedroom - Double size room with a double glazed window and a built-in wardrobe unit with mirror doors.

External:
Gated communal gardens with a pathway to the grand entrance. To the rear there is a further garden, laid to lawn with paved pathways and mature trees, hedges and shrubs.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

detailedDescription:
This is a well presented four bedroom terrace house situated on a sought after residential road in Mitcham. The ground floor comprises of a porch, an entrance hallway, spacious reception currently being used as a fourth bedroom, W.C, generous size dining room and modern kitchen with a large skylight offering an abundance of rich natural light just one of many features that enrich and add character to this property and patio doors leading out to the large private garden.

The first floor consists of a three piece contemporary style bathroom suite, a second kitchen allowing investors the potential to convert this property into two dwellings and two double bedrooms with bedroom four offering large bay windows.

The second floor includes a large master suite with a a modern en-suite.

This property has a wealth of potential, character and space with bespoke lighting throughout, ideal for families or investors. Viewings are recommended.

Location

This property is situated near Mitcham train station which is within walking distance and also near Mitcham Tram stop. The accommodation is in the heart of Mitcham with bus routes to South Wimbledon and underground stations Colliers Wood, and Tooting Broadway, The Town Centre is a short stroll away and just 100 yards to the lovely open space of Figges Marsh as well as popular schools and amenities.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Laurels are excited to bring to the market this rarely available property offered with no chain on Phipps Bridge Road in Merton. This property offers huge potential to extend, refurb and modernise (STPP) and viewings are available seven days a week including Bank Holidays.

This residence offers front garden, with on-street parking available, and then upon entry to the property you are greeted by a spacious front reception room to your left, currently being used as a fourth bedroom. To the rear of the house you find the kitchen and bathroom, as well as rear access onto the extensive private garden.

The upstairs of the property boasts three double bedrooms and then a large loft space, with potential to extend to create extra living space as required (STPP).

Further benefits of the property include Phipps Bridge Tram Stop just seconds from the property, an abundance of bus links with access to local train stations, Morden Hall Park less than a 10 minute walk away, as well as much more. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly magnificent first floor two double bedroom maisonette situated within one of Wimbledon Town Centre's most popular residential roads, offered chain free.

This two bedroom maisonette is a true hidden gem. This house would make an ideal pied-à-terre for those looking for a bolt hole in London, an ideal rental investment or perfect for someone looking to upsize locally.

Upon entering the flat through your own front door you are greeted with a spacious hallway with enough space to hang coats and store shoes. Moving upstairs into the property itself there is spacious landing in the centre of the property. Off the landing you have access to both double bedrooms, the reception room / kitchen and family bathroom.

Both bedrooms are excellent sized double rooms and feature fitted storage which can be utilised as wardrobes. In addition to fitted storage, the second bedroom has a fitted oak desk and shelving. The primary bedroom to the front of the property features double windows and this makes the space incredibly bright and airy.

The open plan kitchen / reception room features dual aspect windows which allows natural light to flood into this space. This space is huge and ideal for those who like to entertain, with a fitted walnut dining table. For the budding chef the modern kitchen is fitted with all the mod-cons one would expect to find. The modern family bathroom is a lovely place to relax after a hard days work.

In the private spacious garden there is a lovely lawned area with flower beds to the side ideal for those with green fingers to grow plants and a stunning summerhouse at the rear which can be utilised as an office / cinema room / home gym. This is an incredibly versatile space and not usually associated with this style of property.

This flat truly is one of a kind and not to be missed; early viewing is recommended.

Location

Located in South West London you will find this beautiful maisonette a short distance from both Wimbledon and Wimbledon Village.

The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms and eateries close by and some great walks and trails to explore, including Wimbledon Common itself which offers some lovely dog walking opportunities. The open space of Haydons Road Recreational Ground is on your door step and offers a beautiful place to relax and enjoy in the summer months.

Transport links aplenty; you are situated in between a number of train stations including Wimbledon and South Wimbledon which are part of the London Underground network. Surrey is also easily accessible via the London Tram Line at Wimbledon station. The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away.

SW19 is an affluent and vibrant area of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser.

detailedDescription:
A modern and bright, one double bedroom flat with new kitchen and new bathroom and off-street parking on quiet and desirable Devonshire Road close to Colliers Wood tube station and shops and Tooting mainline station.

Set on the ground floor of this well-maintained, small apartment building, which is set back from the road within communal grounds and with residents parking at the rear, this fantastic flat has been lovingly updated throughout and is simultaneously modern and homely. There is a central hallway upon entry running the length of the property with rooms off. There is a good-sized double bedroom with plenty of natural light and a stylish, tiled full bathroom that has been updated recently. The kitchen has been recently refurbished with smart fitted units, attractive wood work tops and integrated appliances. There is a spacious living room at the end of the hall with space for dining and relaxing at the end of the day.

The property benefits from gas central heating and has good-quality double glazing throughout.

Chagford Court is a well maintained, small brick apartment building on popular Devonshire Road between Colliers Wood and Tooting. Gorringe Park and tennis courts, and the River Wandle with it's Meadow Nature Park are a few minutes' walk away.

There are excellent transport links with Tooting mainline station close by, and Colliers Wood and Tooting Broadway tube stations are also within easy walking distance. Colliers Wood has excellent supermarkets, shopping and independent cafes. There are quick bus and road connections to Wimbledon, Streatham and Mitcham and into and out of London, and the CS7 Cycle Superhighway takes you directly into the City.

A perfect flat for a first-time buyer, as a retirement property, as a Buy-to-Let investment or as a pied-a-terre.

On the ground floor is a good sized front reception, lovely bright dining area with doors out to the sunny garden and a modern kitchen. Upstairs are two double bedrooms and a large well appointed four piece family bathroom suite. There is fantastic potential to extend on the ground floor (side return and off the rear) and into the loft (which could add two further bedrooms and a bathroom) subject to the usual consents. Being located close to Wimbledon, Thameslink and Northern Line stations as well as excellent local schools and parks, an early viewing is therefore recommended. No onward chain

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented five bedroom Edwardian halls-adjoining end of terrace family home, offering sumptuous accommodation arranged over three floors, with a south-westerly facing rear garden. Conveniently located in a popular residential road, within easy reach of Wimbledon Town centre and station, with the local shops of Leopold Road just around the corner; Waitrose and Wimbledon Park station are also close by. A fabulous kitchen/dining room forms the heart of the home, with two further generous receptions on the ground floor, with four double bedrooms, a further single/study and two bathrooms are situated on the first and second floors. A superb south-west facing low maintenance rear garden provides the ideal space for entertaining and relaxing.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This charming two bedroom, first floor maisonette is situated within one of SW20's popular residential roads offered to the market chain free.

This apartment is a true hidden gem. Upon entering the front of the property you are greeted with charming frontage to this maisonette. Through your own front door to the flat you will find a spacious hallway with enough room for storage of coats and shoes.

Off the hallway to the front of the house you will find the generously sized bedroom which could be utilised as an office/study or large nursery, this room is bright and airy owing to its large window. Next to the bedroom to the front you will find the great size separate reception room which will comfortably fit a dining room table as well as living room furniture. Moving further into the property there is a superb double bedroom currently being utilised as the primary bedroom and being at the rear of the property is incredibly quiet. The modern family bathroom is a beautiful space and features a separate bath and shower which is rare to find in a property of this type. The separate modern kitchen is a wonderful place to be for a budding chef and has all of the mod cons one would expect.

This flat is truly is one of a kind and not to be missed; early viewing is recommended.

Location

Located in South West London on the border of SW20 and SW19 you will find this beautiful apartment a short walking distance from Raynes Park, Wimbledon and Wimbledon Chase. Transport links aplenty; you are situated in between a number of train stations offering very frequent trains including Wimbledon (Rail, District Line Tube, Thameslink, Tram), Raynes Park (Rail) and Wimbledon Chase (Thameslink) as well as bus routes along Worple Road and Kingston Road on either side connecting these as well as South Wimbledon tube station for the Northern Line. The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away.

SW20 and SW19 are both affluent and vibrant areas of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser. The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms, shops and restaurants close by including both Wimbledon and Raynes Park town centres as well as Wimbledon Village. There are plenty of green spaces and parks nearby including Wimbledon Common and Cannon Hill Common which offers some lovely opportunities for outdoor activities.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • *Guide Price £500,000 - £525,000*

Full description:
*viewings still accepted*

The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Four Bedroom Mid Terrace House – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £500,000 - £525,000*

Situated within the highly sought-after area of Mitcham, this well-presented four bedroom mid terrace property would make the perfect family home. Within a quiet cul-de-sac, the area boasts fantastic transport links (Northern Line to Central London), a variety of amenities such as local schools, shops and hospitals, making this a great hub for working professionals and families. The property also lies 5 minutes (approx.) from the Nation trust Morden Hall Park and is a short walk away from Mitcham Common, making it perfect for those who enjoy the outdoors.

Internal:
Entrance Hall - Front door opens to. With stair access to First Floor and door opening to;
Lounge - Generous sized lounge area with fitted wooden flooring and ample space for a range of furniture. With window to front aspect bringing plenty of natural light.
Kitchen - Spacious kitchen fitted with a range of wall and base units and fitted tile splash back walls. Kitchen boasts plenty of space for dining furniture and door access to conservatory.
Conservatory - With space and plumbing for appliances, the conservatory is currently used as a dining space with French door access to rear garden.

First Floor Landing -
Bedroom One - Double sized bedroom with fitted floor to ceiling wardrobes and space for additional furniture. Window bringing natural lighting.
Bedroom Two - Double sized bedroom with fitted wooden flooring and window bringing natural lighting.
Bedroom Three - Double sized bedroom with fitted wooden flooring and space for additional furniture.
Bathroom - 3 Piece Suite comprising Panelled bathtub with overhead shower tap attachment and surrounding tile walls. Low level WC and wash hand basin.

Second Floor Landing -
Bedroom Four - Large master bedroom with double aspect skylight windows bringing natural light. Fitted wooden flooring and plenty of space for additional furniture.

External:
Rear Garden - Large south-facing block paved private garden with space for outdoor furniture, plant beds and shrubbery.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful Victorian family house with off street parking close to Wimbledon Town Centre.

Location

Courthope Villas is a sought after no through road ideally located close to Wimbledon Town Centre with its excellent shopping facilities. Excellent transport links with a fast and regular link to central London from Wimbledon mainline station (17 min) and the District Underground line. Wimbledon Village is around 600m away with its collection of pretty boutiques and restaurants alongside is Wimbledon Common with its 1,200 acres of open space perfect for riding, cycling or walking. Locally are a number of picturesque golf courses. There are a number of great schools nearby with Wimbledon High School for girls 300m away and Kings College School for boys 900m away.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
Source of times
All measurements are approximate.

Description

A superb Victorian house arranged across three floors, offering well balanced accommodation for both family living and entertaining.

On the ground floor to the front is a generous bay fronted reception room with original fire places and useful display shelving. A further reception space features in built cabinetry and leads to a large kitchen/dining room. The stunning contemporary kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards, fully integrated appliances and features a large central island/breakfast bar. The dining space benefits from a vaulted ceiling with large Velux ceiling windows allowing a tremendous amount of natural light. Double doors open to a paved patio overlooking a private, landscaped rear garden.

There is a wonderful annexe in the garden with a double bedroom, bathroom and ample storage which could alternatively serve as an office space or gym.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is the principal bedroom with excellent fitted wardrobes and large sash windows. There is an additional double bedroom and contemporary family bathroom with a separate glass shower and a lovely study which could be additional bedroom, overlooking the garden.

On the top floor are a further two double bedrooms both with a stylish en suite shower room and excellent storage under the eaves.

Square Footage: 2122 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious, modernised and extended, four bedroom and two bathroom house with private rear garden and top-floor master bedroom with ensuite bathroom and Juliette balcony, on Mina Road in the desirable Old Merton Park area of Wimbledon in SW19.

Set back from the road, this attractive house has a welcoming front aspect with path and front garden. There is a hallway upon entry with under-stairs storage and a large, stunning reception room at the front with period features and bay window. There is a second reception space that opens onto a dining area in the ground floor extension which is also accessible from the hallway, via the fitted galley-style kitchen with integrated appliances. There is a downstairs WC and French doors that open into a good-sized private garden that has recently been landscaped with attractive patio area, shed storage and rear garden access.

On the first floor of the property are two spacious double bedrooms, a single bedroom/study and a family bathroom with bath and shower. On the second floor is a loft extension bedroom with en-suite bathroom with walk-in shower, and excellent eaves storage.

The property has been modernised throughout, enjoys plenty of natural light and there is gas central heating and high quality double glazing.

Mina Road is a popular, quiet residential road with little traffic and in very popular Old Merton Park within easy walking distance of Wimbledon mainline and tube station, South Wimbledon tube station and Merton Park tram station. There are numerous Ofsted 'outstanding' local primary and secondary schools nearby. There are local convenience stores and supermarkets on Kingston Road a couple of minutes' walk away, and you are perfectly situated for the many shops, restaurants and attractions of central Wimbledon. Local tennis courts and Nursery Road playing fields are close by as are a number of very popular parks and green spaces.

detailedDescription:
A spacious and bright 5 bedroom and 2 bathroom house with large private garden and off-street driveway parking, on attractive Grasmere Avenue in Merton Park SW19, close to fantastic Morden Hall Park, the shops and Tube station of Morden and South Merton mainline station.

On this popular residential road, the property is set back from the pavement with off-street driveway parking for 2 cars. There is a welcoming hallway upon entry with storage under the stairs and a large living room, currently set up as a bedroom, at the front and with bay window. At the rear is a second reception space / dining area which is open plan to the fitted kitchen. There is a large conservatory with downstairs toilet and with access to the large rear lawn garden.

On the first floor are 2 spacious double bedrooms, a smaller bedroom and a good-sized bathroom with bath and separate walk-in shower. On the second (top) floor are 2 further double bedrooms, some eaves storage and a second spacious bathroom.

There is clear potential to extend further into the garden on the ground floor, considerably enlarging the property subject to planning permission.

Grasmere Avenue is an attractive and broad residential road in desirable Merton Park with it's excellent schools and green spaces. The shops, supermarkets and Tube station of Morden are close by, as is the National Trust's Morden Hall Park and Mostyn Gardens with it's popular playground.

Further transport links are nearby with South Merton mainline station and the tramline connecting Wimbledon Station to Croydon. Central Wimbledon is also within walking distance and there are excellent road connections into and out of London.

Description
***fantastic 3 bedroom home with off street parking*** Found on a peaceful street between Mitcham and Colliers Woods, is our three bedroom family home offered in good condition throughout. The home boasts a large through lounge which is great for entertaining, fully fitted kitchen overlooking the rear garden, family shower room and three extremely good sized bedrooms. The area is extremely well served by local schools and amenities and is situated within a short walk of colliers wood tube station and Mitcham Town Centre.

Viewing's are a must as the property is sure to sell quickly!

detailedDescription:
No Onward Chain. One double bedroom with open plan kitchen-living room, allocated parking space, 100 year lease remaining and only 0.5 miles to Morden tube station.

The development has a secure communal entrance with lift access & stairs leading up to each floor. The property has a hallway area with storage space to one side, this leads this through to the spacious open plan kitchen-living room area. The kitchen has cupboard space to three sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven, space and plumbing for a fridge-freezer and dishwasher. There is space for a dining table & chairs and sofa's with a juliet balcony to one side.
The double bedroom has space for wardrobes and chest of drawers and the modern family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and towel rail.

Outside - There is an allocated parking space for this property and communal bike storage.
There is a large communal secure garden, with grassed area and children's playground.

Lease - 100 years remaining.

Location

Located in Morden, the property is 0.5 miles from Morden Tube Station (Northern Line) and only 0.4 miles from Morden South train station that has links into London Victoria and Blackfriars.

Morden has a good array of shops, restaurants and local amenities making it a great area for all ages.

address: Blossom Square, 8A The Drive, Wimbledon, London SW20
detailedDescription:
Blossom Square is an exclusive new build development close to Wimbledon Village offering 13 contemporary houses surrounding a landscaped square.

Location

Blossom Square is close to the charming Wimbledon Village just 0.7 miles from the High Street off Ridgway. The property is 800 metres from Wimbledon Common which has 1200 acres perfect for walking, riding, cycling and golf. Also 800 metres from Raynes Park railway station which has a regular overground link to Waterloo (21 minutes). Kings College School is just 800 metres away.

Source of distances: Google Pedometer
Source of times: Transport for London
All distances are approximate.

Description

Blossom Square is a new build development by renowned London developer Coronado located off The Drive near Wimbledon Village.

This exclusive gated development is ideally located to Wimbledon Village and within walking distance of a number of schools. All thirteen houses are within a garden square development and feature a private garden, along with either a garage or allocated parking.

Coronado are renowned for quality and a high level of specification. European oak doors with satin chrome ironmongery can be found, along with engineered European solid oak wooden flooring and large format Italian porcelain tiles. Kitchens feature integrated appliances, wine coolers, integrated dishwashers, European composite stone worktops and feature LED concealed lighting. Bathrooms feature Duravit sanitary ware, walk in shower units, recessed LED lighting throughout and Italian porcelain tile finishes to walls and floors.

All houses are freehold and include a ten year build warranty.

detailedDescription:
A light three bedroom penthouse apartment set within an attractive art deco (1936) building located opposite Wimbledon Common which benefits from two substantial private roof terraces.

The existing accommodation comprises three bedrooms, double reception room, family bathroom recently modernised kitchen, private locked roof garden, rear stairway and lease on part of the rear roof with planning permission to enlarge to create five bedrooms one dressing room, hall diner, two bathrooms (one en suite), three reception rooms, utility room, washroom toilet and a further roof garden. Private free parking permit with an option for a second car by negotiation. If enlarged with the current planning permission the penthouse would benefit from a further 1,492 sq. Ft. Of living space when added to the existing living space of 1 136 sq. Ft., the penthouse would be totalling over 2,600 sq. Ft.

address: Holly Lodge, 90 Wimbledon Hill Road, London SW19
detailedDescription:
Lovely third-floor flat that has been recently refurbished to a high standard and offers superb lateral space.

There is a communal entrance on the raised ground floor of this well-maintained building, with a lift providing access to the apartment. The layout inside is well arranged with great entertaining space in the form of a large and spacious reception/dining room with a private balcony, plus a well-equipped separate kitchen. Both bedrooms have built-in cupboards and the principal bedroom has an en-suite bathroom. There is also a separate family bathroom and plenty of well-planned storage throughout the flat.

Holly Lodge is a well-maintained purpose built block with plans to update the communal areas, lift access to the secure underground parking and communal gardens.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography. Please call us for more information.

Holly Lodge is set on the highly desirable Wimbledon Hill Road, between Wimbledon Village and Town Centre. Wimbledon mainline and tube station, providing direct access into Central London, are 0.2 miles.

The A3 is easily accessible with its direct route into central London and connection to the M25 network for both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

There are many good schools in the area both in the private and state sector, including Kings College School, Wimbledon High, The Study, Ursuline and The Norwegian School.

Recreation activities in Wimbledon Village include 2 riding stables, multiple golf courses within a 3 mile radius, tennis and fitness clubs and Wimbledon Common itself consisting of 1200 acres.

detailedDescription:
Description

A substantial 1930's Semi Detached family home. Although already extended to the side and rear, there is further planning granted for a first floor side aspect extension and a further rear aspect extension.
The property has parking for 3/4 vehicles in the front drive way and a large size garden with an outbuilding to the rear aspect.
The internal accommodation comprises to the ground floor, front Living room, a large Lounge, large Study/Bedroom, fully fitted Kitchen, Bathroom room and a Dining room.
On the first floor there are three bedrooms and bathroom, further up onto the second floor consisting of a further three bedrooms with shower room.
Internal viewings are highly recommend and offered on the market with No Chain.

detailedDescription:
A superb two double bedroom apartment located in a wonderful period property offering excellent lateral space.

Location

The Drive is a popular residential road in between Wimbledon Village and West Wimbledon. The property is approximately 700 metres from Wimbledon Common which has over 1,200 acres and perfect for walking, riding, cycling and golf. The property is approximately 1,300 metres from the shops and bars of Wimbledon Village and 900 metres from Raynes Park railway station which has a regular overground link to Waterloo (approximately 21 minutes). Buses also run from both Ridgway and Worple Road to Wimbledon Station with its overground and underground district lines.

Source of distances: Google Pedometer
Source of times: Transport for London

Description

An unusually large two bedroom flat within an attractive period property set back from the road behind a landscaped front garden.

The property opens into a deep entrance hall and is decorated in fresh neutral tones throughout. The flat comprises two double bedrooms one with a wall of fitted wardrobes. There is a generous reception room with an attractive fireplace and good natural light. A contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with integrated appliances. A stylish bathroom has a separate glass shower and bath tub.

The property also benefits from the use of the beautifully maintained communal gardens and parking.

Chain free.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An elegant four bedroom family house located within close proximity of Wimbledon Park.

Location

Melrose Avenue is an attractive, tree lined residential road built in the early 1900s. The house is moments from the amenities of Arthur Road, featuring a number of restaurants, cafes and local shops. Wimbledon Park is also on the doorstep with multiple playgrounds, tennis and volleyball courts.

The property is close to both Wimbledon Park Primary and Bishop Gilpin. There are also a number of highly recommended independent schools in the area.

The house is approximately 300 metres to the Wimbledon Park tube station (District line) with direct links into central London.

Source of times: Transport for London

Description

An attractive four bedroom Edwardian house offering well balanced family living space across three floors located within the Southfields Grid.

To the front is an elegant bay fronted double reception space with an attractive fireplace, built in cabinetry and useful shelving, which flows through to a dining area. Pocket doors open to a cleverly designed playroom. To the rear is a contemporary shaker style kitchen with an extensive range of stone topped units, fully integrated appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar. Glass bi-folding doors open out to a paved terrace overlooking a mature private garden with useful rear access and a garden shed.

Upstairs, on the first floor there are two generous double bedrooms with excellent built in wardrobe space, a single bedroom and a contemporary family bathroom.

On the top floor is the principal bedroom with a luxurious en suite shower room.

Square Footage: 1513 sq ft

detailedDescription:

A beautifully presented, modern, period-style townhouse, perfectly located in the heart of Wimbledon Village. In addition to three generously proportioned double bedrooms, the property includes two bathrooms, a modern, open-plan Kitchen/Dining room with a separate utility. detailedDescription:
Laurels are proud to present this stunning, four double bedroom family home in Streatham. The property is situated in a sought after private development which has a great community and is surrounded by an abundance of outdoor space and is just a short walk from the local amenities. The property is close to both Streatham Common and Mitcham Eastfields stations (Zone 3 London Victoria Approx. 35 minutes) and there are a number of local bus routes that stop just outside the development, giving you excellent transport links into Central London.

Guide Price £575,000 - £600,000

As you enter the property you are greeted by a spacious living area which leads through into the open plan, fully fitted kitchen and dining space which has access into the sunny private garden. The downstairs is finished with a spacious and contemporary toilet. The first floor comprises two large double bedrooms. Furthermore, this floor is completed with a spacious family bathroom. The second floor boasts the final two double bedrooms, one with en-suite and the other benefitting from a decked terrace area which is the perfect spot to relax after a busy day. There is ample storage throughout, and the top floor has a large landing area which is the perfect spot for an office.

Further benefits of this eco-friendly property includes being under the NHBC warranty, solar panels which reduces monthly outgoings, outstanding local schools, great transport links into central London and is in immaculate condition throughout. It is just moments from the communal outdoor space and the property also comes with one allocated parking spaces and there is also visitor parking available.

Viewings are highly recommended and can be accommodated 7 days a week including bank holidays!

detailedDescription:
A Spacious Semi-Detached 5 bedroom house with 2 bathrooms with a wider footprint and more spacious interior than the typical design of the area, private rear garden, and further potential to extend (STPP) on quiet and attractive Grove Road in South Wimbledon, SW19.

Set on this popular, residential road in a great location between Wimbledon and Colliers Wood, the property is set back from the road with a small front garden and secure front porch. There is a welcoming hallway upon entry, with storage under the stairs. There is a large living room at the front with period features, wood burner and large windows giving room plenty of natural light. At the rear of the ground floor the kitchen has been opened up onto the dining area and there are French windows with access out to the West-facing garden where there is an outside WC with basin, a workshop/shed and secure side access.

On the first floor are two large double bedrooms, one with bay window to the front, a third single bedroom / study and a family bathroom and separate WC. At the top of the house is a second bathroom with walk-in shower, a Master bedroom with double-door Juliette balcony and intelligently designed his-and-hers built-in wardrobes and there is a further double bedroom with velux windows and there is eaves storage.

The property benefits from double glazing throughout, wood floors and gas central heating.

Grove Road is ideally situated a short walk to Colliers Wood tube station and also within walking distance of central Wimbledon Station and Underground and Haydons Road mainline station. There are fantastic supermarkets, gyms and shopping around close by in Colliers Wood. Historic Merton Abbey Mills is nearby, as is the River Wandle with nature park and riverside walking/running routes. The Wandle Meadow Nature Park and Haydon's Road Recreation Ground are close and Tooting and Wimbledon offer fantastic options for eating out, cafes and further gyms and shopping options.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious, bright and modern 2 double bedroom terraced house with off-street driveway parking and private rear garden in Chaucer Way, SW19, a quiet and private gated development close to the River Wandle Meadow Park and walking distance to Colliers Wood and Tooting tubes.

At the end of Chaucer Way, which runs alongside the River Wandle and is surrounded by greenery, is Gower House, a private gated development of smart apartment buildings and private houses set within landscaped, maintained grounds. This lovely house is at the far side of the development and has it's own off-street parking space.

There is a small porch entrance for coats and shoes which then opens into a good sized living room with a bright, newly fitted kitchen beyond. There is space for in-kitchen dining and additional storage in the space under the stairs. At the back of the property, accessed via the kitchen, is a long lawn garden with shed storage and that benefits from being South-facing so enjoys the best sun coverage year round.

On the first floor of the property are two double bedrooms, both with large windows flooding the rooms with natural light and with excellent built-in wardrobe space. Between the bedrooms is a stylish, modern, tiled full bathroom with good storage and heated towel rail.

The property benefits from gas central heating, has good-quality double glazing throughout and green credentials with a 74 EPC rating.

Chaucer Way is in a bucolic, quiet setting away from major roads, next to the Wandle Meadow Nature Park and riverside walking/running routes, but close to central Tooting, Colliers Wood with it's excellent supermarkets, gym and shopping options, and also within walking distance of Wimbledon. The Northern Line is nearby at Colliers Wood, there is the mainline station at Haydons Road and Tooting and Wimbledon have brilliant further transport links. There is the CS7 cycle superhighway to the City of London and quick road links out of London to the South coast.

detailedDescription:
A bright and well appointed, modern 1 double bedroom flat with residents parking in Windlesham Grove a quiet residential road, moments from Wimbledon Common and Putney Heath and walking distance to Southfields tube station and Putney Train station, and available chain-free.

Set on the ground floor of this well-maintained small apartment building, this delightful flat has natural wood floors and access to a lawn area for relaxing on sunny days. Because the property enjoys sole, direct access to this, it feels as if an extension of the flat and of sole use.

There is a welcoming central hallway upon entry and at the heart of the property. To the left is a good-sized double bedroom with large wardrobes and a modern, tiled full bathroom. In the centre of the property is a fitted kitchen with gas cooker, large integrated fridge and freezer and additional storage space. To the right is a spacious living room with spot lighting, space for a dining table and direct secure access to the lawn garden, almost as an extension of the property.

There is good quality double glazing throughout and gas central heating.

Windlesham Grove is a couple of minutes' walk to the wide open spaces of Wimbledon Common and golf courses, Putney Heath and a short walk to Richmond Park beyond. There is also a lovely communal park and pond area.

It is within walking distance to Putney mainline station, and several bus routes to Kingston, Richmond, Clapham Junction & Victoria.

Wimbledon Village, Putney and Southfields with their plentiful shops, restaurants, cafes and bars are all within walking distance and you are close to the A3 for quick road access into, and out of London for those trips to Surrey, Sussex, the South Coast and beyond.

A perfect flat for a first time buyer, professional couple, as a pied a terre or for downsizing.

Additional costs:
Vendor advises that ground rent is a peppercorn and the the service charge estimate for 2020/2021 is £669.

detailedDescription:
This stunning two double bedroom split level apartment is located in an exclusive and desirable gated development set in the middle of Poulter Park.

This property presents a rare an unique opportunity and benefits from its' own front door which opens to a grand entrance hall and is currently being used as a study whilst providing excellent storage. The tiled staircase leads up to the main living space which offers a wonderful open plan kitchen/living room with a deep bay window and spectacular views.

The property further comprises of a large master bedroom with en-suite shower room, a second double bedroom and a family bathroom. Further benefits include allocated parking, visitor spaces, bike shed and a share of freehold.

This home is located within proximity of Morden town centre with the ever popular Underground station (Northern Line) and St Helier overground station providing commuters with a selection of convenient transport links as well as the numerous local bus routes on Bishopsford Road. The property currently falls into the catchment area for Harris Academy Morden(graded Outstanding).

Location

The property is located within 0.4 miles of Mitcham tram stop which has links into Croydon and Wimbledon and also within 1 mile of Morden tube station with access to the Northern Line. For primary schools, the property is within 0.5 miles of St. Teresa's Catholic Primary School and 0.7 miles of Malmesbury Primary School. For secondary schools, Harris Academy Morden is within 0.4 miles and Carshalton Boys Sports College is within 1 mile. Morden is a great area for families with a good array of shops, restaurants and local amenities. Mitcham town centre is a short driveway for a great range of shops.

Share Of Freehold

This property is offered for sale with a share of freehold.

detailedDescription:
This beautiful two double bedroom apartment is situated in a sought after private residential community.

The property is in an outstanding condition and there is nothing the new owner will need to think about other than where to put their furniture.

As you enter this apartment you will find a spacious hallway with plenty of storage for shoes and coats as well as all of life's essentials.

There is a modern, well appointed family bathroom. Continuing into the property you will find two equally sized large double bedrooms both of which are bright and airy.

For those who like to cook up a storm there is a modern separate kitchen where you will find all the essential mod-cons. The separate reception room is stunning, a real feature of the apartment. It is incredibly bright and spacious, with enough room for a dining table and chairs, it is an ideal space for entertaining.

A stunning apartment not to be missed, early viewing is recommended.

Location

Located in South West London you will find this wonderful flat a short distance from both Wimbledon, Wimbledon Village and Southfields.

The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms close by and some great walks and trails to explore including Wimbledon Common itself which offers some lovely dog walking opportunities.

Wimbledon and Southfields stations are close by and offer easy access into central London via the London Underground or Surrey via the London Tram Line.

The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away.

SW19 is an affluent and vibrant area of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser.

address: Cottenham Park Road, West Wimbledon SW20
detailedDescription:
An attractive four bedroom period family home which has been extended & refurbished throughout to allow for enhanced living accommodation. The property benefits from a south aspect garden, off street parking and outhouse being ideally located within West Wimbledon convenient for Wimbledon Village, Raynes Park high street with popular local parks, commons and schools.

This spacious property offers four bedrooms together with three bath/shower rooms and ample flexible living space. There is also the added benefit of mature front and rear gardens including off street parking and summer house.

The ground floor comprises a spacious entrance hall, two reception rooms, kitchen and family room with a cloakroom. The first floor offers three bedrooms and two bathrooms (one en-suite) with a further bedroom and bathroom being located on the top floor.

The property also has the option to further extend and enhance the loft to add a further room subject to planning.

Situated in the popular West Wimbledon area, nearby Wimbledon Village boasts an excellent range of exclusive, shops, bars and restaurants together with access to the many acres of Wimbledon Common. Raynes Park station offers regular train services into London Waterloo while the A3 provides access to major motorways. The property is well located for Wimbledon's highly regarded schools in both the state and private sectors.

address: Mill Green, London Road, Mitcham Junction, Mitcham CR4
detailedDescription: A truly unique and stunning completely refurbished four double bedroom, two bathroom, Georgian, Grade ll listed family home situated in a secluded gated area backing on to the River Wandle with views over National Trust Land. There is an abundance of period features throughout with exposed beams, original brick work and sash windows, the property also benefits from a modern kitchen/breakfast room, luxurious family bathroom and en-suite shower room to the master bedroom. There are three large reception rooms, currently laid out as dining room, living room with wood burning stove and a children's play/office room. At the rear there is a decked area over looking the river whilst at the front there is an enclosed and beautifully landscaped mature garden. The tram link is within easy reach and gives access to Wimbledon in 11 minutes and from there onward connections to the City. With covered parking available for two cars this is a fantastic opportunity for a buyer looking for a "one of a kind" family home.

Brinkley's Estate Agents are pleased to bring to the market this stylish, bright and airy, one bedroom flat. This one bedroom flat provides well-presented living space in an enviable location. Nestled in the heart of Wimbledon within walking distance to the mainline station, tube and tram link. There is a large reception/kitchen area featuring a luxury kitchen with fully integrated appliances and stone worktops. The property was built in 2003 and so benefits from modern building standards, but retains the charm of this street. Further notable benefits include no onward chain and a new 125-year lease. Description
simply stunning. These are two words that best describe this fantastic top floor one bedroom, modern apartment situated in the extremely sought after Willows Development. Auctioneer's Comments
This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack.

The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change.

address: Robinson Road, Colliers Wood, London SW17
detailedDescription:
Description

This well presented four bedroom terraced house is ideally located in Tooting. Local transport links include Collier Wood underground station, Tooting Broadway and Tooting train station all within just 0.6 miles of the property. Some local schools include Sellincourt Primary school and Singlegate Primary school both just 0.5 miles away. Also 0.6 miles from St Georges Hospital. Located just off High Street Colliers Wood which offers many shopping amenities, cafes, bars and restaurants, and is less than half a mile from Colliers Wood Recreation Ground.

Entrance Hall

Enter via solid wooden front door, radiator to right and wooden floors, doors leading to living room and kitchen, also storage under stairs.

Living Room (4.90m x 3.73m)

Enter from hallway, double glazed bay window looking onto road, fireplace, radiator and solid wooden floors.

Living Room (4.52m x 3.20m)

Second reception room, double glazed French doors leading to garden, radiator, and solid wood flooring.

Kitchen (6.17m x 3.10m)

Kitchen with matching wall and base units, tiled backsplash, integrated appliances including washing machine, gas hob & oven, and dishwasher. Double glazed window looking out to garden, door giving access to patio area and garden, radiators and tiled flooring.

Bathroom (2.46m x 1.78m)

Enter from first floor landing to fully tiled bathroom, double glazed window looking onto garden, bath with over head shower, WC, wash basin, mirrored wall cabinet and heated towel rail, also tiled flooring.

Bedroom 1 (4.9m x 3.2m)

Double bedroom with double glazed bay window facing front of property, radiator and solid wooden flooring.

Bedroom 2 (4.34m x 3.20m)

Double bedroom with double glazed window looking onto garden, radiator, and solid wooden flooring.

Bedroom 3 (3.20m x 1.78m)

Enter from first floor hallway, double glazed window looking over front of property, radiator, wooden flooring

Bedroom 4 (6.71m x 4.95m)

Double fourth bedroom on second floor loft conversion, two double glazed windows looking onto garden and skylight on front side of property, access to eaves storage, radiators and solid wooden flooring.

Garden

Garden with patio area and paved path to shed at the back, well kept lawn also.

Front Garden

Block paved front garden with parking space for two cars

address: High Street Colliers Wood, Colliers Wood, London SW19
detailedDescription:
Description:

Refurbished contemporary First Floor apartment forms part of St George's Court, a development by Laing Homes. The communal areas are scheduled for redecoration and carpet replacement in Summer 2021.

The apartment is located just 200 yards from Colliers Wood underground tube station(Northern Line) providing easy access into Central London destinations including Waterloo, London Bridge, Bank and Tottenham Court Road. There are also two overground train stations - Haydons Road and Tooting for additional links to King’s Cross ( Via Farringdon ) in just 40 minutes. A24 offers motorists swift routes into the centre of town as well as a direct link to the A3 and M25 (Junction 9) to the South.

There is easy access to bars and restaurants within nearby Merton Abbey Mills and High Street. Local supermarkets including Sainsburys, Somerfield and Tesco are all less than a mile from the apartment. There are Virgin Active and Nuffield Health fitness centres and Wimbledon Park Golf course within 2.2 miles. The property is 10 minute’s walk to St. Georges Hospital.
Hall


Fitted carpet, door to built-in walk-in cupboard, door to built-in airing cupboard housing hot water cylinder and with slatted shelving.

Master bedroom 14'11 x 9'1 (4.55m x 2.77m)

Double glazed window to front, electric heater, fitted carpet
En-suite shower room


Fitted with three piece suite comprising recessed tiled shower cubicle, pedestal wash hand basin, close coupled WC and extractor fan, wall mounted mirror, shaver point, single radiator electric heater, vinyl flooring.

Bedroom 2 10'0 x 9'5 (3.05m x 2.87m)

Double glazed window to front, electric heater, fitted carpet.

Living / dinning room 13'7 x 9'11 (4.14m x 3.02m)

Full height double glazed window to front, electric heater, fitted carpet, open plan to kitchen.

Kitchen 6'3 x 8'0 (1.91m x 2.45m)

Fitted with a matching range of maple effect units, 1½ bowl stainless steel sink unit with mixer tap, plumbing for washing machine, space for fridge/freezer, built-in

electric oven, built-in four ring electric hob with extractor hood over, vinyl flooring.
Bathroom


Fitted with three piece suite comprising panelled bath with hand shower attachment, pedestal wash hand basin and close coupled WC, tiled splashbacks, extractor fan, wall mounted mirror, shaver point, electric heater, vinyl flooring.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented ground floor two double bedroom apartment with a private balcony and garage.

Location

Southlands Drive is a prestigious development designed in a neo-Georgian style, which was built by Laing Homes approximately 20 years ago. Wimbledon Parkside is a popular location and Wimbledon village, within one and a quarter miles, offers a variety of charming boutiques, shops and restaurants.

The property is located only several hundred yards from Wimbledon Common, which provides a wide range of outdoor activities including cycling, golf, riding and walking. The area is highly regarded for the quality of its schooling in both the private and state sectors. For transport links, the flat is conveniently located for Wimbledon mainline and the District underground station (17 minutes approx. To London Waterloo via rail), and bus facilities.

Description

Set within this highly regarded gated development this ground floor property has been beautifully refurbished throughout.

The apartment is decorated in fresh neutral tones and opens into a central hallway. A wonderful reception room comfortably accommodates both a sitting and dining area with access to a private balcony and an attractive fireplace. A contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with fully integrated appliances.

The generous principal bedroom has a modern en suite shower room. There is an additional double bedroom and stylish guest bathroom. Wonderful green views of the communal gardens are available both to the front and to the rear of the property.

Southlands Drive offers 24 hour security with easy access to both Wimbledon Village and Wimbledon Common.

address: The Villas, 4 Cottenham Park Road, Wimbledon, London SW20
detailedDescription:
Three The Villas, forms part of a new build development of three highly specified five bedroom detached houses, with parking.

Location

Cottenham Park Road is a much sought after location in West Wimbledon. It is within walking distance of Wimbledon Village High Street (0.8 miles) and Raynes Park station (500 metres). There is a bus stop (200) to Wimbledon Town on the road. The open spaces of Cannizaro Park, Wimbledon Common (600 metres), West Wimbledon Tennis Club and Cottenham Park playground are all within easy reach. Locally are excellent schools including King’s College School, Ursuline High School, Hollymount Primary (300 metres) and St Matthew’s CofE Primary.

Source of times .
Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

This spectacular five bedroom detached property offers a traditional twist to contemporary living located off Copse Hill. The house is set back off the road with an unusually large garden and off-street parking.

The house is designed to an exceptionally high standard, with authentic natural materials combined with state of the art design and technology.

Wet underfloor heating is incorporated throughout and is controlled via a digital touch screen thermostat or your mobile device. Booster tanks are fitted to guarantee pressure to all wet areas at any time, the gas boiler is by Vaillant.

Rako mood lighting systems fitted throughout offer the user mood lighting, at the touch of a single button whilst controlling multiple circuits and lamp types. Rako is fully adjustable to the home owners requirements.

The stunning Binova Italian made kitchen, from the Bluna collection is finished in oak wood veneer. All kitchen hinges, accessories and mechanisms are soft close. The furniture range has a modern handless design. High quality fully integrated Miele appliances include tall wine coolers, dishwashers, ovens, combination microwave - oven, coffee machine extraction with external motor, tall fridge and tall freezer with ice maker. Both the kitchen and utility room worktops are composite stone complete with LED under unit concealed lighting.

All bathrooms are fitted with Dornbracht brass ware in a brushed stainless-steel finish, Duravit sanitary ware from the Luv range featuring a free standing bath, walk in shower with body jets. Bathroom units are Italian and supplied by Sangiacomo in oak wood veneer with composite stone bathroom worktops. Absolute stainless steel towel rail and recessed LED lighting is fitted in all bathrooms.

On the ground floor bespoke large engineered herringbone wood floor in natural oak, mat lacquered is fitted to the study and the open plan kitchen living/dining area. Large Italian porcelain tiles run across the hallway with smaller tiles in the kitchen and the utility room.

Carpet is laid to all stairs, landing and bedrooms. Porcelain tiles in a matt finish are in all bathrooms with a feature wall in mosaic tiles to the principal master and family bathrooms. In all the bedrooms are beautiful Italian Oak wood veneer fitted wardrobes with internal accessories and lighting.

All the internal doors are classic solid fire doors in oak veneer painted to match the windows and the external door with all ironmongery in a stainless steel finish.

The photos are of the Showhouse, 2 The Villas.

Square Footage: 3556 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented four bedroom extended family house with stunning open plan kitchen-dining room, two reception rooms, downstairs shower room, garage, 0.3 miles from both South Merton & Wimbledon Chase tube stations and scope to extend into the loft (STPP).

The property has a porch area to the front leading into a spacious entrance hallway with access to a downstairs shower room with w/c and cupboard space. There is a separate lounge to the front of the house and a separate reception room which is currently used as a family room with double doors leading into the open plan extended kitchen-dining room.
The kitchen has a cupboard space to three sides with integrated gas hob, electric fan oven, fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washing machine. There is a breakfast bar area with space for seating and there are double doors leading out to the conservatory across the rear of the property.

To the first floor, there are four double bedrooms with three of them benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side. The modern family bathroom has a stand-alone bath, shower cubicle, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Outside - To the front there is a block paved driveway for multiple cars. The rear garden has a patio area leading onto the lawn surrounded by mature shrubs and trees. At the far end there is access to a garage.

The property has recently been modernised throughout with a new roof, central heating system, re-wired and new windows fitted throughout in 2017.

The property has scope for potential loft extension (subject to planning permission).

Location

Wimbledon Chase & South Merton tube station (Northern Line) are both within 0.3 miles.
Raynes Park train station is a short distance away and has links into London Waterloo & Clapham Junction.

For primary schools, Joseph Hood Primary School is 0.2 miles away and Merton Park Primary School is within 0.4 miles.
For secondary schools, Rutlish School is within 0.1 mile and Ursuline High School Wimbledon is 0.8 miles away.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.
