detailedDescription:
343 Wimbledon Central is a superb apartment on the fourth floor of a landmark development in Wimbledon. The property has a spacious reception hall with double doors opening into a well proportioned reception room with clearly defined sitting and dining areas. Glass doors from the reception room open onto a balcony with views up towards Wimbledon Village. The two bedrooms are both double rooms and each has fitted wardrobes and access to a separate bath or shower room.

The property is decorated throughout in a neutral colour scheme with a white gloss kitchen with integrated appliances and both bath/shower rooms are fitted with modern white suites and have been fully tiled.

Wimbledon Central is lift served and has the advantage of both a 24 hour porter service and allocated parking (space number 80). The property is offered for sale with the benefit of no onward chain of related sales and the furniture is available to be purchased if desired.

Wimbledon is world famous for the annual tennis championships held at the All England Lawn Tennis Club in Church Road and is highly regarded for the quality of its schooling in both the private and state sectors. Wimbledon Village, which borders the Common, is lined with a select range of shops, cafes and restaurants whilst Wimbledon town offers a wide range of shops and other local amenities. Wimbledon mainline Rail Station located only several hundred metres from the apartment provides a fast rail link into London Waterloo (approximately 17 minutes) and is also on the London Underground District line.

detailedDescription:
St Augustin Court - Shared Ownership homes launching soon

Offering a stepping stone to homeownership in Mitcham, the first collection of 1 and 2-bedroom apartments at St Augustin Court are launching soon.

Take the next step, own in Mitcham, South West London
St Augustin Court is a new development of 1 and 2 bedroom apartments located in the heart of Mitcham. With a considerable amount of green space, its easy to enjoy an outdoor lifestyle. With plenty of shopping, dining, and historic estates nearby, Lavender Park is close by, and slightly further afield you will find Morden Hill Park and the 460-acre natural conservation area of Mitcham Common.

L&Q St Augustin Court
Every home at St Augustin Court will be built to a high-quality finish, with outdoor space by either a private balcony or terrace and a communal garden to the rear of the building. On-street parking will also be available. Priority to these homes will be given to anyone with a local or South-West Sub Region connection in Kingston upon Thames, Lambeth, Merton, Richmond upon Thames, Sutton, or Wandsworth.

Shared Ownership>
Our vision is to make quality homes accessible through Shared Ownership, allowing you to buy a share of your new home, paving the way to full ownership.

It allows you to buy a home, in an affordable way, in the area you know and love. It allows you to buy a share of your home – between 25% and 75%, with as little as a 5% deposit. You pay a mortgage on the share you own and rent the remaining share at a subsidised rate. You can increase your share in your home and staircase up to a larger share, and eventually full ownership.

Register your interest today to contact a member of our sales team!

address: Greenoak Way, Wimbledon Village, London SW19
detailedDescription:
Tucked away on a quiet residential cul-de-sac in Wimbledon Village, this 6 bedroom family home offers incredible potential for buyers and investors alike. Could you see yourself living here?

Overview

Escape the bustle of city life in this most impressive family home, which is located between Wimbledon Common and Wimbledon Park in South West London.

Spread across 3 floors, Greenoak Way is a well looked after family home that offers an abundance of living space.

The entrance hall on the ground floor leads to a magnificent drawing room complete with a marble fireplace. French doors provide direct access to the garden to the rear of the property, while also allowing plenty of natural light into the space.

Elsewhere on the ground floor is a utility room, WC, dining room, family room and a large kitchen. An internal door leads to a double garage providing convenient access in and out of the home.

On the first floor, 4 generously sized bedrooms along with a further study/bedroom can be found. The master suite features built-in wardrobes, and a large en-suite bathroom complete with a bathtub. A family bathroom along with 2 further en-suites also service the floor.

Moving up to the second floor, provides a 6th bedroom along with a bathroom, additional storage and study area. This would also make for an ideal office space for those who work from home, or equally an excellent guest facility.

The external grounds allow for off-street parking towards the front of the home. A large private garden complete with a well-maintained lawn can be found at the rear of the property.

Location

Greenoak Way is moments away from Wimbledon Common. There are plenty of green open spaces located nearby, allowing for quiet walks or participation in outdoor pursuits. The property is also located within a 5-minute drive of Wimbledon Tennis Club.

As well as being home to the famous tennis tournament, Wimbledon itself has plenty of independent shops, restaurants and bars. There are also a number of excellent schools and colleges in the area, making Wimbledon an extremely desirable location for families and working professionals alike.

Transport

Wimbledon is extremely well connected across all forms of transport. The property is a
10-minute drive to Wimbledon Train Station, which offers a regular service into London Waterloo. The nearest tube station is Wimbledon Park (District Line).

The A3 is within a 2-minute drive of Greenoak Way, providing an easy link to the rest of the South East. The number 93 bus running from North Cheam to Putney Bridge is within a 30-second walk of the property.

For international or business travellers, Greenoak Way is a short 15-mile drive to Heathrow Airport.

Viewings - By appointment only with Daniel White from Fine & Country Wimbledon. Please enquire and quote dwa.<br /><br />

address: Nursery View House, Morden, Surrey SM4
detailedDescription:
This property is situated on the popular ‘Willows’ development, within 0.5 miles to Morden Town Centre, which benefits from the Northern Line tube station and an array of bus routes linking Croydon, Sutton and Wimbledon. St Helier, South Merton and Morden South Train Stations link to Sutton and Wimbledon, and further into London. This part of Morden accommodates green spaces at Ravensbury Park and Morden Hall Park, which forms part of the National Trust.

This is a beautifully presented modern one-bedroom purpose built apartment.
A special feature is the Juliet balcony, which creates more natural light throughout the main living area. The dual aspect reception room is perfect for entertaining family or friends with seating and dining areas, which lead nicely to the fully equipped kitchen and its compliment of wall mounted, under counter storage and integrated appliances.
From the hallway is a spacious double bedroom and a separate modern bathroom.

The apartment is situated on the second floor within a well-maintained building as part of the desirable Willows development on Schoolgate Drive. The private communal garden is a unique feature to residents of this particular development. In addition, there is green space including a park for residents only accessible through a locked security gate.
This property is in excellent decorative order and viewings are highly recommended to appreciate the quality and size of this apartment.

*As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representatives on these matters at the earliest opportunity before making a decision to purchase.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A fantastic Ground Floor Period Maisonette with private garden with decked barbecue area and shed storage and on popular, quiet residential Acre Road ideally situated between Tooting and Colliers Wood, and close to the River Wandle with it's nature trail and parks.

Set on the ground floor of this attractive Victorian terraced row, the maisonette property benefits from it's own front door and has been intelligently and stylishly refurbished throughout. There is a welcoming hallway with built-in storage. Wood floors continue into the good-sized, attractive living room which has high ceilings, period features and large shuttered windows providing the room with lots of natural light and also privacy.

Carrying on through the property, the double bedroom feels modern and spacious with a neutral finish. Beyond this you open into a new, fitted stylish kitchen with plenty of storage. There is a hallway off to the rear with access to a tiled modern bathroom and then to the fantastic West facing garden that has a decked BBQ area and a second raised decked area at the end with a large shed for additional storage.

Acre Road is a quiet cul-de-sac a couple of minutes from the high street connecting Colliers Wood with Tooting so close to local shops and cafes. St George's Hospital is nearby and there are many fantastic supermarkets and restaurants within easy walking distance. Tooting and Haydons Road provide nearby mainline train options in addition to the Northern Line Tube which is 5 mins walk away, and there are excellent bus and road links into and out of central London.

An ideal flat for a first time buyer, professional couple, for downsizing to, as a pied a terre or as a buy to let investment.

The second floor accommodation comprises a hallway with storage, two double bedrooms, a fitted kitchen wish space for breakfast bar, good size lounge, bathroom and en suite shower room to the master bedroom. Further notable benefits include a allocated parking space, within the private car park, private balcony and a long lease. Within close proximity is Colliers Wood Tube Station, South Wimbledon Tube Station, Haydons Road Station, great road/bus links and good social facilities including Nuffield Health Fitness & Wellbeing Gym. detailedDescription:
No onward chain. Beautifully appointed two double bedroom Victorian house with many original features, ideally located on a highly sought after road minutes from Wimbledon town center and excellent transport links. New bathroom and offered with no chain.

To the ground floor the entrance hall is adorned with a beautiful prime oak floor which extends throughout the ground floor. There is an impressive double reception room complete with a feature bay window that allows for plenty of natural light and there is a stunning original stain glass window adjacent to the dinning area. As you approach the rear of the property you enter the modern kitchen which is an ideal size and provides access to the rear decked garden. The kitchen is just off the living dinning area and has recently been updated and also leads to a handy utility room with downstairs w.c.

To the first floor there is a new luxury family bathroom with rainfall shower over the bath and two double bedrooms both with prime oak floor. Particular mention must be made of the master bedroom which is of a particularly good size with fitted wardrobes either side of the feature fireplace and has large sash windows.

Outside, there is a private walled courtyard garden which requires very little maintenance and is fitted with decking.

Location

The property is ideally located on a highly sought after road just off the High Street and Wimbledon Theatre is just at the top of the road.

Wimbledon Mainline Station and South Wimbledon Underground Station are within easy walking distance making it a perfect location for anyone commuting into the City. There are also a number of outstanding Schools nearby, including St Mary’s Primary School.

detailedDescription:
This is a beautifully presented five bedroom semi detached house arranged over three floors, situated in Mitcham. The ground floor comprises of a well groomed front garden with a boundary wall, a spacious entrance hallway with ample under stairs storage, generous size lounge with large bay windows just one of many features that enrich and add character to this property, large contemporary style kitchen diner with patio doors leading out to the large private garden with access to outside storage, an outhouse, patio areas and side access.

The first floor consists of a contemporary style four piece family bathroom with a stylish bath, free standing glass shower unit, toilet pan and wash basin with bespoke under sink storage. Three bedrooms that consist of two doubles and one single, with bedroom one offering large bay windows and bespoke built in wardrobes.

The second floor offers a further two double bedrooms and a contemporary style shower room, with bedroom three offering access to eaves storage.

This property has immaculate decor throughout with a high specification finish and an abundance of rich natural light flowing throughout, ideal for families or investors, viewings are recommended.

Location

This property is situated on a popular residential street in Mitcham, next to Mitcham Common, and is ideally located within walking distance of local amenities at both Pollards Hill and Mitcham. A more extensive range of amenities is on offer in Croydon Town center which is located just 3 miles from the property.

The property location is ideal for commuters with Mitcham Eastfields station positioned just a mile away and offers direct services to London Victoria Station in around 25 minutes and London St Pancras International Station in around 35 minutes.

detailedDescription:
No onward chain - video tour available. Located equal distance between Raynes Park & Morden is this extended period house that has been newly refurbished. It offers bright and spacious accommodation laid out over 3 floors.
On the ground floor, you have an amazing entertaining space with a double reception room opening onto the integrated kitchen dining room that is flooded with light from the roof skylights and full-width bi-folding doors to the rear garden. There's a patio and artificial grass which leads to a covered seating area and large storage shed. From the reception rooms is a downstairs cloakroom.
On the first floor, you have two double bedrooms and a family bathroom, then up a further flight of stairs, you reach a dual aspect 19' double bedroom with an en-suite shower room.
Viewings are recommended to fully appreciate the size and condition of this fine period house.

detailedDescription:
A particularly spacious halls adjoining semi-detached four double bedroom period family house with high ceilings and a southerly aspect rear garden. Early viewing recommended!

The property is approached via the front garden which provides off-street parking. A useful porch leads to the front door and entrance hall.
The house has been extended to provide excellent family accommodation, with a huge kitchen/reception room, utility room, downstairs cloakroom, rear through-reception room which leads out to a good size southerly aspect rear garden. Upstairs are four bedrooms and three bath/shower rooms arranged over two floors.

The property is well placed for access into Raynes Park and Wimbledon with their commuter stations and selection of useful shops and businesses.
The area is also well regarded for its sporting and recreational facilities as well as for its choice of schools in both the state and private sectors.
The green spaces of Wimbledon Common, Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
One double bedroom flat with lounge-dining room area, private balcony, 110 year lease and only 0.2 miles from Haydons Road train station making this ideal for 1st time buyers & young professionals.

The building has a secure communal entrance area leading up to the property.
The flat has an entrance hallway area with storage cupboard space to one side. The kitchen has cupboard space to three sides with integrated electric hob, fan oven, fridge-freezer, built-in microwave and brand new dishwasher.
There is a private balcony with views into the communal gardens and inner courtyard area.

There is a double bedroom with built in wardrobes to one side, the family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Outside - There is a communal garden for residents to use and there is also a Co-operative shop on site.

Lease - 110 years remaining.

Location

The property is located 0.2 miles from Haydons Road train station with links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge and Wimbledon.
Wimbledon Park tube station (District Line) is 0.6 miles away and Wimbledon train & tube station is 0.8 miles away with links into London Waterloo & Clapham Junction.
There are two bus stops directly outside the property and regular buses into Wimbledon and Tooting.

title: Land for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

We are pleased to present this fabulous first floor flat with a private terrace. The property boasts a large open plan living room/ kitchen, bathroom with three piece-suite, two well sized bedrooms and a private terrace.

The current owner not only enjoys the well laid-out space of the flat but also that he has the benefit of private outdoor space, where he can entertain guests with a BBQ.

There are many local amenities on offer from the local Tesco, takeaway shops, the popular aya Lebanese Restaurant and everything else you would expect to find on a great high street.
Wimbledon Rail and Underground (District Line) which are situated in the Town Centre are within walking distance and is a popular route for those commuting to Clapham Common and London Waterloo. Wimbledon Town Centre not only offers excellent transport links but also very trendy bars, restaurants’ and the well renowned Ely’s Department store and Centre Court Shopping Centre.
If you are seeking open spaces in Wimbledon, Abbey Recreational Ground and Morden Hall Park are close by and very popular amongst the locals.

This property is situated on the popular ‘Willows’ development, within 0.5 miles to Morden Town Centre, which benefits from the Northern Line tube station and an array of bus routes linking Croydon, Sutton and Wimbledon. St Helier, South Merton and Morden South Train Stations link to Sutton and Wimbledon, and further into London. This part of Morden accommodates green spaces at Ravensbury Park and Morden Hall Park, which forms part of the National Trust.

A modern one bedroom purpose built apartment in the popular Schoolgate Drive development comprising of one double bedroom and a spacious modern bathroom. There is a spacious reception room with an open plan modern fitted kitchen including integrated appliances.
The apartment is situated within a well maintained building as part of the desirable Willows development. In addition, there is green space including a park for residents only accessible through a locked security gate.

Location, Location, location, walk to Morden Hall Park or Morden underground station this superb example of an extended family home with a layout ideal for anyone that needs self-contained living space. A must see to truly appreciate!

Description
This extended three/four bedroom end of terrace house is situated directly opposite the vast recreational grounds of Morden Hall Park, the delightful home truly does offer a unique blend of convenience with peace and tranquillity.

Modern living space that includes a large open plan living/dining room, kitchen off to the side of the rear extension and lovely French doors opening to the garden. Further benefits include a separate reception space accessed by double doors of the main living space, utility room and downstairs w/c. On the first floor you have three double bedrooms and a main family bathroom. Lovely and private with sunny aspect the rear garden is an ideal spot for anyone to space top enjoy the summer BBQ's, a driveway to the front offers plenty of off street parking

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Last flat available!

Oaks Estate Agents are delighted to present to the market, Chenab Court, a high specification newly built development located in the heart of Morden.

Widely available on the Help to Buy scheme, these luxurious apartments have been elegantly crafted and Flat 12 benefits from an impressive 691 sq. Ft. Of modern day living space.

Light and airy throughout, this exceptional property comprises; open plan modern fitted kitchen/dining room with direct access to private balcony, two well-proportioned double bedrooms, contemporary three piece bathroom suite and utility room.

This beautiful apartment has engineered wooden flooring throughout the living areas and has a mixture of LED dimmer lights and LED pendant lights.

The development is secure in part due to the communal CCTV camera system and security lights. The property has lift access, cycle storage and a remote control video door entry system with dual touch fob, key pad entry system.

Situated only 0.3m from Morden Underground station, the most southerly station on the Underground network providing access onto the Northern Line.

In addition to the excellent transport links, the property is also located close to a wide array of popular and well-regarded local amenities.

detailedDescription:
One double bedroom flat with spacious lounge-dining room, separate kitchen, modern bathroom, 90 year lease and only 0.7 miles to Colliers Wood tube station and 0.4 miles from Phipps Bridge Tram Stop making this ideal for first time buyers and young professionals.

The property has communal entrance with stairs up to the first floor. The flat has an entrance hallway area with two large cupboards to either side. The lounge-dining room is a fantastic open plan space with room for a sofa and dining table & chairs and bay window area allowing plenty of natural light into the room.
There is a separate kitchen with cupboard space to two sides, space and plumbing for a gas cooker, fridge-freezer and washing machine. The double bedroom has space for wardrobes & chest of drawers either side of the bed. The modern bathroom is tiled throughout and has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail.

Lease - 90 years remaining.

Location

detailedDescription: This well-proportioned period four bedroom end of terrace family house is situated in this no through road with access to Wimbledon Town centre and Wimbledon Village. Salisbury Road is approached through the front garden to the front door. The entrance hall has a window to the front providing ample natural light. The front reception room offers a bay window to the front overlooking the garden and a feature inset fireplace. The dining room has ample space for entertaining and the luxury of wonderful views of the rear garden with the added benefit of double sliding doors which lead out on to the private rear garden. The kitchen has a wide range of matching eye and base level units and benefits from an extensive breakfast bar with quartz work surfaces. From the entrance hall the stairs rise to the first floor where there are three bedrooms and a well presented family bathroom. On the second floor there is a double bedroom with the benefit of an en suite shower room and ample eaves storage space. The garage is located to the rear of the property which is accessed via a separate driveway.

detailedDescription:
Beautiful period family house situated a short distance from Wimbledon town centre, mainline station and tube (District line) as well as the many boutiques and restaurants of Wimbledon Village.

The ground floor comprises an entrance hall that leads to a well presented double reception room with wood floors, fireplace and high ceilings, beautiful kitchen/dining/family room with bi-folding doors that lead out onto the rear garden, guest cloakroom and steps to a good size cellar with great storage/utility space.

The first floor includes a lovely principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The top floor comprises two further double bedrooms which share a Jack and Jill shower room.

Outside there is a pretty south facing garden with decked area and lawn.

Springfield Road is located a very short distance from Wimbledon town centre, mainline station and tube (District line) as well the boutiques, bars and restaurants of Wimbledon Village. There are many good schools in the area, both in the private and public sector and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as tennis and golf clubs. The A3 is close by with its direct access into central London and links to the M25 network to both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports.

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious penthouse apartment located close to Wimbledon Village. Could you see yourself living here?

Description

Located directly opposite Wimbledon Common, the penthouse of Oxford House boasts 1,385 sq ft of living space.

The property is accessed via a communal entrance hall that is stylishly decorated to hotel standard. This leads to a large reception room which would equally be ideal for relaxing as it would be entertaining. Views over the Common are beautifully framed by the windows which let in plenty of natural light.

The kitchen offers a versatile space with room for dining, that has plenty of potential to be further enhanced with some modernisation.

Both bedrooms benefit from ample storage, with the master bedroom also featuring an en-suite with a separate shower. A second family bathroom is cleanly decorated and is equipped with a bath and twin sinks.

Set within well landscaped communal gardens, the property also comes with two allocated spaces for secure underground parking.

Location

Wimbledon is a sought-after area of London, with a leafy green appeal while still being in close reach of the city. Several excellent schools are located in the area, as well as bustling shopping and restaurant districts, tennis clubs, golf clubs and horse stables.

Oxford House is well served by public transport and is only moments from several bus routes.

Wimbledon Tube Station on the District Line is the closest underground station to the property. The station also connects to National Rail services, offering a regular service into Central London.

The A3 is also just a short drive away for easy connectivity across the capital.

Viewings - By appointment only with Daniel White from Fine & Country Wimbledon. Please enquire and quote dwa.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Summary

For Sale By Online Auction. Starting Bid 270,000. Terms and conditions apply.

We welcome to the market this two double bedroom ground floor property. The flat comprises of an entrance hall, an open plan lounge/kitchen, two double bedrooms, a family bathroom with shower.

This flat offers a bright and airy open plan reception lounge with laminated wooden flooring. The contemporary kitchen is fully integrated with cabinets, a sink and drainer unit, washing machine and appliance such as an electric hob. The two double bedrooms all are fitted with double glazed windows and carpeted flooring. The flat also features a modern family bathroom featuring a shower, hand wash basin and low level WC.

There is also a private courtyard at the rear of the flat with paved decking and a shed perfect for storage. There is off street parking available on first come first serve basis.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

detailedDescription:
Earn instant income on this already tenanted investment opportunity!

Yieldit are pleased to offer this modern 2 bedroom apartment located in the sought after Compass House development. Built in 2010, the property has been well kept and in immaculate condition comprising of: A fully equipped kitchen with high gloss units; wood effect laminate flooring throughout; 2 bathrooms with the master also benefitting from a walk in shower and two spacious bedrooms with the total area of the apartment being a generous 70 Sq. M. There is also one allocated parking space with the property and secure fob access.

With the introduction of a 24 hour underground train services as well as the increased awareness of its easy access into Wimbledon - the West End, the City and key commercial areas of Surrey, Morden is an up and coming area that has seen a 25% increase in online property searches over the last 12 months.

The housing stock in Morden varies and as result has attracted investors looking outside of the central London in recent years. With one and two bedroom flats lining many of the streets leading up to the underground station, landlords find the good transport links and varied property types make for a great buy-to-let market.

To the north of Morden Station is Merton Park. With its conservation area status, has made Morden is a highly desirable location.

Overall, Morden represents an area of London that so far has been undervalued and under-appreciated, but ballooning Central London property prices and the general trend towards redeveloping outlying areas means that Morden is increasingly being sought out as the next place to invest.

detailedDescription:
A well presented 6 bedroom detached house with fabulous entertaining and family space in this sought after Village road. The space is further enhanced by the high celings in the house. There is a garage, off-street parking behind secure electric gates and a beautifully landscaped garden to the rear.

This exceptional house is arranged over four floors and on the ground floor comprises: Entrance hall; study; a bespoke kitchen/dining room that is partially open plan to the stunning drawing room; a family/media room; cloakroom; utility room and access to the integral garage. The principal reception rooms all open out onto the terrace and landscaped garden.

The lower ground floor is devoted to recreation and storage with a games room; gymnasium; temperature controlled wine store; a large store room with built in cupboards; and a sauna and shower room.

On the first floor is the truly impressive master bedroom suite complete with built-in wardrobes, a fully fitted dressing room and an en-suite bath and shower room. There are two further bedrooms on this floor, one with an en-suite bathroom and the other with an en-suite shower room. On the second floor, there are three further bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower room. In addition there is a large family bathroom with both bath and shower.

To the rear of the house is a truly delightful landscaped south-westerly facing garden with both sun terrace and dining terrace. To the front of the house is a generous driveway behind electrically controlled security gates with off-street parking for several cars.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

St Mary's Road is a sought after road being convenient for both Wimbledon Village, with its wide selection of fashionable shops and restaurants, the Common with its acres of woodland walks and Wimbledon town with its shopping facilities, mainline station and tube links. There are excellent schools in the area, both in the private and public sectors and a wide range of recreational activities are available such as golf, tennis and fitness clubs. The A3 is close by with its direct route into central London and connections to the M25 network for both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

detailedDescription:
A large two bedroom apartment with outside space situated in this very well appointed modern development. Presenting over 900 sq ft of accommodation the property boasts a wide entrance hall, dual-aspect open plan kitchen/reception adjoined by a fantastic private terrace, master bedroom with Juliet balcony and en-suite shower room, second double bedroom with Juliet balcony and a guest bathroom. All of the fixtures and fittings are of an excellent standard as you would expect with high end developments of recent construction including hardwood flooring and built-in Sonos music system throughout. There are a host of amenities in the immediate area and is close to Wimbledon Town Center with its excellent transport, shopping and leisure facilities.

Location

Located in South West London you will find this wonderful apartment a short distance from both Wimbledon and Wimbledon Village. The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms close by and some great walks and trails to explore including Wimbledon Common itself which offers some lovely dog walking opportunities. Wimbledon and South Wimbledon stations are close by and offer easy access into central London via the London Underground or Surrey via the London Tram Line. Haydons Road station which is operated by Thameslink is also a short distance away. The A3 is super close and provides great access to the South East’s road networks with Gatwick airport a short distance and Brighton beach a short car journey away. SW19 is an affluent and vibrant area of London with lots to offer and prospective purchaser.

detailedDescription:
Offered for sale with no onward chain, a spacious four bedroom end-of- terrace modern house located in a quiet and much sought-after residential cul-de-sac conveniently situated for Raynes Park Station, shops and other local amenities.

The property offers bright and flexible accommodation, including four bedrooms, set over three floors and has the added benefit of a southerly aspect rear garden and off street parking.

The property is situated on a quiet residential cul de sac on the slopes up to Wimbledon Common, well placed for access into Raynes Park with its commuter station offering fast and frequent services to London Waterloo. A selection of useful shops (including Waitrose) and businesses, the green spaces of Wimbledon Common, Holland Gardens and Cottenham Park are also within easy reach. The area is well served for local schools in both the state and private sector.

detailedDescription:
Description

One Bedroom Apartment for Sale. No Onward Chain.

Located in the leafy area of Raynes Park is this airy and very well looked after modern one bedroom apartment for sale with neutral decor, open plan living space with dual aspect views and a large private balcony overlooking lots of greenery, in a cul-de-sac development. The apartment comes with allocated private parking and a healthy lease. It is conveniently located close to plenty of shops and amenties such as the bank, post office, newsagent, range of bars, pub, restaurants and Cafes. It also has good transport links and connections to Motspur Park, Raynes Park station for fast commute into Central London/London Waterloo.

The St. Catherine's close development built in 2011 by Bewley homes, benefits from beautifully landscaped communal gardens and a secure video entry phone system. This property would make an ideal purchase for first time buyers or alternative make a good buy as an investment property.

The apartment is located in close proximity less than 0.6miles to alot of good primary schools, St. John Fisher rc Primary School, Sacred Heart Catholic Primary School and Hatfield Primary School.

There are extensive leisure activities in the area including the David Lloyd Leisure Park, Malden Golf Club, a number of parks including Cottenham Park Reacreation Ground, Raynes Park Sports Ground and Cannon Hill Common, Raynes Park Resident's Lawn Tennis Club.

EPC rating B

detailedDescription:
Summary
***three double bedrooms***off street parking*** Short distance to Mitcham Common. This fantastic three double bedroom terrace home offered in good condition throughout. The house has the benefit of a secure car park behind the terrace which can be accessed via security gates from the road. Call now

description
***three double bedrooms*** off street parking*** Short distance to Mitcham Common. This fantastic three double bedroom terrace home offered in good condition throughout. The property is with an excellent distribution of space across all floors. On the ground floor there is a spacious reception room with direct access to the low maintenance garden, large downstairs cloakroom and separate fully fitted kitchen. On the first floor are two double bedrooms and a large the family bathroom. On the top floor is a third double bedroom with integrated storage too. The house has the benefit of a secure car park behind the terrace which can be accessed via security gates from the road and there is an access point directly into the garden too.

Chestnut Grove is moments from outstanding Harris Academy Merton, the amenities of South Lodge Avenue, including it's library and shops and main bus stops. Viewing's are a must as the property is sure to sell quickly! No onward chain.

Auctioneer's Comments
This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack.

The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change.

1. Money laundering regulations: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale.
2. title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully appointed semi-detached house which has been finished to an exacting standard and features fantastic ceiling heights of 3 metres. Situated in this much favoured residential road, the property is well placed for local shops as well as first-class educational and recreational facilities.

On the ground floor, the house comprises of a bright welcoming entrance with cloakroom, a light and airy separate sitting room with bay window and the kitchen/dining room to the rear. The kitchen is bespoke with a composite stone worktop and fully fitted Neff and Fisher & Paykel appliances. There is also a sizeable separate utility room affording plentiful storage and plumbing for a washing machine. From the kitchen/dining room, there are bi-folding doors which lead out to the landscaped private rear garden with a patio area and lawn.

On the first floor are two spacious bedrooms, both with excellent bespoke wardrobe storage, and a family bathroom. Also on this floor is a useful study/office space.

Upstairs to the second floor is a further sizeable bedroom with bespoke storage and an en-suite bathroom.

There is plenty of storage throughout the property and a parking permit allowance. Further benefits include underfloor heating throughout the ground floor and all bathrooms, as well as air conditioning to all rooms throughout the house. Additionally, there are pv Solar panels installed.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Southdown Road is a sought after location being a short distance to both Wimbledon Village and the Town Centre as well as the local shops and Raynes Park mainline station. The are many great schools in the area, both in the private and public sectors.

detailedDescription:
This is a beautiful four bedroom terrace house situated in Mitcham. The property comprises of a easy maintenance front garden, porch, entrance hallway with under stairs storage and a storage room with bespoke built in storage. Spacious living room with a featured fire place and large windows that allow an abundance of rich natural light throughout, just one of many features that enrich and add character. Large dining room, generous size contemporary style kitchen diner with a skylight and patio doors leading out to the generous size two tier garden with patio, lawn area and shed. There is also a W.C on the ground floor that has dual use as a utility room.

The first floor consists of a stylish white three piece family bathroom suite, two double bedrooms and a single, with bedroom two offering large bay windows and bespoke built in wardrobes, bedroom three also offers built in wardrobes.

The second floor includes a spacious master suite with a contemporary style en suite and skylights.

This property offers immaculate decor, bespoke lighting and flooring throughout. Ideal for families or investors viewings are recommended.

Location

The location of this property is ideal for those looking for a quiet residential area that is still well connected to Central London via Mitcham Eastfields train station and the various bus links which can be accessed on Eastfields Road & Grove Road. Mitcham Eastfileds benefits from trains in London Victoria as well as the Thameslink service.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A generous two bedroom flat located on the first floor of an attractive period property.

Location

The flat is very well located approximately 600 metres from Wimbledon Village High Street with its popular collection of shops, restaurants and bars. Wimbledon Common is around 500 metres away and offers 1,200 acres approx. Of open space, ideal for walking, riding, golf and cycling. Locally are a number of highly sought after schools with King's College School, The Ursuline Prep and The Hall School, all within 300 metres. Wimbledon Town Centre and Wimbledon Station are both easily accessible and within 1000 metres with regular services into London Waterloo (17 minutes) and the district line into central London.

Source of distances Google Pedometer

Description

A beautiful two bedroom apartment offering excellent lateral space, high ceilings and large sash windows located on the first floor of this elegant period building.

The flat opens into a central entrance hall with a contemporary kitchen to the front with an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards with integrated appliances and a breakfast bar. Alongside is a stylish shower room.

A generous reception room with elegant sash windows and an attractive fireplace is located to the rear with green views of the well maintained communal garden. A small study is conveniently located off the reception space.

There are two generous double bedrooms one with a walk in wardrobe/dressing room, the other with fitted wardrobes and a guest's cloakroom. There is potential to create an en suite bathroom in the principal bedroom.

Square Footage: 1069 sq ft

detailedDescription:
*****We are open for viewings*****

Located within the heart of Wimbledon Park is this versatile, first floor period apartment set within a gated, well maintained period building with extensive communal grounds and allocated parking. Arthur Road offers excellent access to local shops, restaurants and the District Line Underground station as well as the recreational facilities of Wimbledon Park. detailedDescription:
Oaks Estate Agents are delighted to present to the market, Mitcham Parkside; a spectacular and luxurious development built to exacting standards by the award winning and well renowned Aquinna Homes, situated in the vibrant community of Mitcham, an up-and-coming suburban area in South London.

Located on the periphery of Mitcham Common on the well-regarded residential road, Commonside East, this wonderful and lavish development has been carefully and elegantly crafted and is available on the popular Help to Buy scheme.

Situated on the top floor, 8 Mitcham Parkside benefits from an impressive 647 sq. Ft. Of living space and comprises; two well-proportioned double bedrooms, contemporary bathroom suite and spacious open plan modern fitted kitchen/reception room with direct access to private terrace.

The bespoke designer kitchen is fitted with high end appliances from Siemens including a multi-function electric oven, microwave, extractor hood and integrated fridge freezer, slimline dishwasher and washer dryer.

The contemporary bathroom suite is fully tiled by Porcelanosa and benefits further from a co-ordinated Porcelanosa ceramic floor. The rest of the bathroom is decked out in designer including Hansgrohe chrome basin mixer taps and Hansgrohe shower plus Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware including bath, wall mounted W/C and vanity units.

Mitcham Parkside also benefits from video door entry system, pre-wiring for alarm, high level TV points and Sky Q wiring and hard wired cat 6 connectivity to ethernet sockets.

Externally, this apartment benefits from an allocated parking spot and there is also a bike store. In addition, the property further benefits from a 10 year NHBC Buildmark Warranty.

The apartment is perfectly positioned for access into The City due to its close proximity to both Mitcham Eastfields and Mitcham Junction making it a real commuter hub for professional people.

The closest station, Mitcham Eastfield, provides access into London Victoria via Clapham Junction and City Thameslink via London Blackfriars. Mitcham Tram Stop is also nearby and that offers access into Wimbledon, East Croydon and Beckenham.

In addition to the excellent transport links, the property is also located close to a wide array of popular local amenities in the Town Centre and benefits from the wide open spaces of the Common opposite.

detailedDescription:
Refurbishment project - opportunity to create your perfect home in wimbledon

Peter Morgan Exclusive are delighted to present this fabulous vacant possession refurbishment project with planning permission agreed. Offers are invited in excess of £1.1m. Please note there are photographs, plans, CGIs and proposed plans in this brochure. This is one option designed to suit the seller. There have been many other designs implemented in this Street.
The largest plot on this tree lined avenue, this property enjoys a unique position at the end of a cul de sac. It is adjacent to Beverley Meads playing fields and benefits from far reaching views over Wimbledon Common.
This is a charming semi-detached, 4 bedroomed family home, arranged over 3 floors, totalling around 2,000 sq. Ft, with planning to extend to approximately 3,000 sq.ft. See architects drawings and CGIs.
There is potential to achieve beyond 4,000 sq.ft STPP.
The property is in need of extensive renovation, but the cost to do so would be more than justified by the market value of lesser comparables in the adjacent avenue.
This is a rare opportunity to create a large and fabulous family home in a sought after road, where properties seldom come to market. The home is ideally situated in West Wimbledon and is only a short distance from the quaint and trendy Wimbledon Village.
Wimbledon Town Centre, New Malden and Kingston Upon Thames are all very local and major shopping centres.
There are excellent links to London via the A3 and the M25 orbital motorway connecting you to both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports within a comfortable 40 minute drive.
If travelling to London, there are direct rail links within walking distance from Raynes Park. Wimbledon Town Centre is 2 stops further on and additionally benefits from a London Underground Tube Service.
There is a vast selection of both private and state schools nearby and ample activities and local amenities within a short walk.
Wimbledon has a plethora of health and leisure facilities including tennis and golf clubs, boutique shops, restaurants and bars.
Viewing - Appointments are by agreement only and can be arranged with Peter Morgan Exclusive

Entrance via large wooden door with stained glass panelled windows either side, staircase to first floor, fitted carpet. Doors leading to.

Gardens
Ample frontage combining garden with spacious driveway, enough to accommodate 2 cars, Further street parking to the front, controlled by resident permits. The rear garden is a wonderful feature benefiting from a large raised patio overlooking the lawn and well established trees and shrubs. The garden spans approximately 200ft and backs directly onto the Beverly Brook. The property is adjacent to Wimbledon Common which is ideal for a stroll in nature.

detailedDescription:
A modern top floor flat in a detached block between Stonecot Hill and Morden Park. This property would make a great first time buy, buy to let investment or if you are simply looking to downsize this is one not to be missed.

As you enter this property from the ground floor communal entrance stairs will take up to the 2nd floor landing.

As you enter the flat its self the entrance hallway has wooden laminated flooring along with storage cupboards and to the left side is the main living space which double aspect windows and a carpet covered flooring.

There is a modern kitchen which has a rear aspect window overlooking the communal gardens and the reserved car parking area. The kitchen is
tiled and has an electric hob, oven with an overhead extractor fan along with plumbing for a washing machine and space for a fridge. There are modern wall and base units providing storage and wooden laminated flooring.

There are 2 bedrooms with bedroom 1 overlooking the rear of the property and bedroom 2 the side and both with carpet
covered floors.

The bathroom is modern with an eves window, low level WC, enclosed panelled with a shower rail and curtain, vanity sink unit, and heated towel rail and carpet covered flooring.

To the rear of the property is the communal garden and there is allocated parking for 1 car and there is also a visitor’s parking space which is available on a first come first served basis.
Location


Located in Stonecot Hill, with local bus routes, schools and Morden Park.

If you need to travel into London you can catch the 93 bus which has stop almost outside the property which will take you directly through to Morden Underground Station which is on the Northern Line. Stay on the 93 and it will take you through to Wimbledon, Wimbledon Village stopping at Putney High Street.

There are a number of highly sort after schools for all ages for which the area is well known and Morden Park has its Leisure Centre with its swimming pool and gymnasium.
Leasehold disclaimer


As this is a leasehold property you are likely to be responsible for management charges and ground rent. You may also incur fees for items such as leasehold packs and in addition you will also need to check the remaining length of the lease. You must therefore consult with your legal representatives on
these matters at the earliest opportunity before making a decision to purchase”.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
**Reference Number NL0178**

Beautifully maintained two double bedroom apartment set within the highly sought after Brenley Park purpose-built development. This 2nd floor flat offers modern living, included is a bright and spacious open plan through lounge/fully integrated kitchen, with a fantastic balcony. The property features a good-sized en-suite to the master bedroom and a further modern tiled family bathroom. Accommodation starts with a wide entrance hall with large storage area with double doors, then the spacious open plan reception and kitchen with doors to the balcony. The kitchen area comprises an ultra-modern range of matching wall and base units, with work surfaces incorporating single drainer sink unit, halogen hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further integrated appliances. There are two generously sized double bedrooms, with stylish en-suite with walk-in shower to the master, and a further modern tiled bathroom accessed via the hallway.

Brenley Park is a sought after development with pleasant open spaces, play area for children and parkland, all set within few mins walk to Mitcham Eastfields station providing 20-minute links into Victoria. Mitcham town centre is just a short stroll away offering all amenities, and the ever green Mitcham Common is also a walk away.

Viewings of this stunning apartment are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
We are proud to present to the market the latest development from Lifestyle Projects, who are respected and revered builders of some of the area’s finest ‘new homes’. Offering an elegant contemporary twist on a traditional façade, these substantial and spacious luxury houses offer around 4000 sq. Ft. Of accommodation and have been constructed to a high specification using the finest materials and meet the demands of discerning, environmentally friendly, home owners. These stunning houses offer a flexible and spacious lower ground floor which incorporates a private study/bedroom, shower room, media room with bar and access to the rear courtyard with the garden beyond. The sumptuous kitchen/dining room leads to a wonderful copper ceilinged garden room, off which is a terraced area with a sylvan outlook. The bespoke kitchen will be fitted with a full range of quality kitchen appliances and waters softeners. A comfortable sitting room with a library area completes the principle ground floor accommodation. On the first floor there is a family bathroom and three bedrooms including a spacious master suite with a gorgeous en-suite bathroom and bespoke built-in wardrobes by ‘Kew Joinery’. The second floor comprises two further bedrooms and a second family bathroom. Both the first and second floors have good ceiling heights and some wonderful views from the upper floors towards the central London skyline through the double glazed windows which are made in the UK and supplied by Mumford and Wood Co Ltd. To the front of each house there are two parking spaces, a plug in for electric vehicles, a secure bike store and an easy to maintain walled landscaped area. The buyer will also have the opportunity to choose their own specifications for their preferred fixtures and fittings if the sale is agreed prior to the properties being cosmetically completed. Photos are of A similar project.

detailedDescription:
Viewings seven days a week including Bank Holidays. This immaculate four-bedroom house is offered to the market on a quiet cul-de-sac overlooking fantastic open green spaces which is often rarely found. The property is within walking distance of Raynes Park, Motspur Park and Wimbledon Chase railway stations and many local amenities. The property also benefits from numerous outstanding local schools and local shops.

The property comprises a welcoming entrance hallway, large living / dining room which overlooks the sunny rear garden. There is a separate downstairs kitchen with built in appliances and a downstairs home office or further reception room. Downstairs is completed with a cloakroom and utility room. Upstairs the main bedroom suite has a private balcony overlooking the green spaces opposite, an en-suite bathroom and extra built in storage. There is a further second bedroom with en-suite and then a further two doubles with a modern family bathroom.

Additional benefits include ample storage throughout, a NHBC guarantee in place as has only recently been built, a beautiful rear garden with patio, laid to lawn and shed. The property benefits from side access and driveway for off street parking. The property is ideal for commuters with numerous stations offering multiple routes across London. The A3 is also a short 5-minute drive away with access into London and the M25. The property is also situated in the middle of both Heathrow and Gatwick airports.

Location

Bertram Cottages runs between Hartfield Road and Gladstone Road in central Wimbledon. The transport connections of Wimbledon Station are within 600m (17 minutes to London Waterloo), as are the shopping facilities of the Centre Court shopping centre and Wimbledon town centre. Two double bedrooms and a bathroom are on the first floor.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Nestled in between Wimbledon Town Centre and Wimbledon Village is this unique and cleverly designed three bedroom, two bathroom, end of terrace townhouse with off street parking.

This spacious end of terrace townhouse is a true hidden gem and as well as being a great family home, would make an ideal pied-à-terre for those looking for a bolt hole in London or looking to upsize locally.

As you approach the front driveway you are greeted with a modern frontage to this house. After entering through the front door you will find a hallway with additional room for storage of coats and shoes and a W/C. In addition on this floor you will find a spacious kitchen with all the modern fittings one would expect to find.

Continuing into the house you have the option of moving downstairs or upstairs. Moving downstairs you will find a spacious and bright dining room overlooking your private garden patio, leading to a large communal garden, to the rear of the house . You will also find a large storage area, situated above the dining room and a garage to the front.

Moving to the first floor you will find an incredibly bright and spacious reception room which is flooded with light from the large windows overlooking the front of the property. On the second floor you will find the master bedroom including a modern en-suite bathroom and walk in wardrobe.

On the third floor you will find bedroom two and three, bedroom two being an excellent size double room and bedroom three ideal for an office or nursery. There is also the addition of a family bathroom on this floor.

This house offers a great amount of versatile space, through its unique and innovative design. A marvelous, spacious house set in a highly sought after location, early viewing is recommended.

Property Description

Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £888,000

Buy it now option available
In no chain


Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Location

Located in South West London you will find this lovely house in Wimbledon village, a short distance from Wimbledon town.

The area boasts some outstanding schools in both the state and private sectors. There are excellent gyms close by and some great parks, walks and trails to explore including Wimbledon Common itself which offers some lovely walking opportunities, horse riding and golf clubs.

Transport links aplenty; you are situated in between a number of train stations including Wimbledon (South West Trains and Thameslink, London Underground network) and Wimbledon Park (London Underground network - District Line)

Surrey and Kent are also easily accessible via the London Tram Line at Wimbledon station. The only station in London that provides an interchange between the London Underground and Tramlink. The A3 provides great access to the South East’s road networks, including Gatwick airport, and the M25 for access to Heathrow and major connections to other main motorways.

SW19 is an affluent, vibrant sought after borough of London with lots to offer a prospective purchaser.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.
